txt.en: <u>The Foundry</u>\n\qI am almost impressed. You have stumbled upon the source of some most unusual weapons. I wonder if you will be able to uncover the real secret that lies within my foundry.\q
<u>In A Northern Dale</u>\n\qGood luck to you. The road will be a long one, and dangerous.\q

<u>Bâr Nírnaeth, the Houses of Lamentation</u>\n\qNone come unbidden to the Houses of Lamentation. And yet, here are the Living and the Deathless, uninvited and uninitiated. I have not forgotten the rites of old, Master, for Morloth shall soon drink of their blood. There is flesh to be flensed and there are minds to be broken... and all shall be left naked before the Lidless Eye.\q
<u>The Hideout</u>\n\qThe hunt for Amdir leads to the hideout of the brigand Skunkwood, but to what end is unknown....\q
<u>The Point of Decision</u>\n\qWe always knew that the Company of the Ring would face the difficult decision of what road to take. We simply did not know how soon....\q
<u>Outrun the Wind, Outrun the Waves</u>\n\qRide for Umbar! Ride with haste!\q
<u>Running Towards Nothing</u>\n\qGreat and terrible things lurk in the dark of the forest. If any of the refugees from Byre Tor yet survive, they will need aid.\q
<u>The River Gate</u>\n\qIt is not too late, my friend. Our warning will reach the Kindred with hours to spare.\q

<u>A Flight of Drakes</u>\n\qPembar, the resting place of one of the famed forges of Eregion, has fallen beneath the shadow of the drake-matron Rimlug and her brood. The great Wing-mother and her spawn must be defeated if the forge is to be awakened once more....\q
At the outskirts of a dwarf camp in the Rushock Bog, you hope to put an end to the dwarf Olwir's plan to capture a Stone-troll and give it as a gift to the resurrected Skorgrím in the north.

<u>The Training Hall</u>\n\qMany armouries and forges of the dwarves lie dormant in Khazad-dûm, awaiting the hands of their masters. One such has been claimed by the Orcs of Moria for a training hall. If the forge is to see service again, the Orcs must be driven forth....\q
<u>The Cage and the Captives</u>\n\qI hope they are all right.\q

<u>The Ghost-forge</u>\n\qThe ancient tomb of a great dwarf-smith of Khazad-dûm is now the site of a terrible evil. A Cargûl in the service of the Nine has come to the forge, and with him many fell spirits, and has put the fires of the forge to evil use....\q

<u>Midnight Raid</u>\n\qThe servants of Saruman have laid claim to the ancient forges of Eregion. Savage Dunlendings have raised their encampment around one such forge. The men of Dunland must be routed if the crucibles of the forge are to burn once more....\q
<u>The Uprising Begins</u>\n\qGo, then, and good fortune go with you! Good fortune go with us all!\q

<u>The Mithril Slaves</u>\n\qDwarves are not alone in their search for mithril. Orcs and goblins toil within the barren mines, seeking some small vein of Moria-silver to use against the Free Peoples, or at the least to keep it from them....\q

<u>The Morroval Outcasts</u>\n\qIn the deep places of Moria, an ancient and hidden dwarf-forge has been penetrated by an outcast band of merrevail, seeking the tools which lie there in disuse. To what ends such creatures might put them remains unknown....\q
<u>The Red Sky Darkens</u>\n\qMy story begins at the camp on the edge of Agarnaith. You know the one.\q

<u>The Deeping-coomb</u>\n\qSaruman's foul sorcery has destroyed the Deeping Wall and driven the Rohirrim into the Deeping-coomb. The retreat to the Glittering Caves and the Hornburg must be secured if there is to be any hope.\q

<u>The Siege of Barad Morlas</u>\n\qThe kindred of Elrond Halfelven have driven forth the half-orcs from Barad Morlas, but the ancient ruin is not yet safe. Dunlendings march even now upon the encampment, while the Elves tend to their wounds....\q
<u>Battle for Hamât, Part 2</u>\n\qMizâdi has tracked Bârshud to the fortress of Dun Shûma in Khûd Zagin. The time has come to meet Bârshud in pitched battle and defeat him for good.\q

<u>The Spider Nest</u>\n\qThe returning dwarves go heedlessly into the dark of Moria. Their scouts, seeking a lost forge, find instead a nest of deadly spiders. The spiders prefer the blood of the living, and so there is still hope for their rescue....\q
<u>The Ox and the Dragon</u>\n\qMeanwhile, Radanir of the Dúnedain brings tidings of Lheu Brenin's betrayal to the Uch-lûth in Enedwaith.\q
<u>Battle for Hamât, Part 3</u>\n\qPush into Dun Shûma and end the threat of Bârshud!\q

<u>The Library of Steel</u>\n\qThe Library of Steel contains many secrets of the smithy, protected by the wards of the dwarves, for which they are well-known. Now the Ghâsh-hai seek to summon lesser fire-spirits to break the wards and ravage the library and the forge within....\q
<u>The Roving Threats of Central Gondor</u>\n\qYou gather to defeat the Hardened enemies of Central Gondor who have banded together to stand off against those who oppose them.\q
<u>The Siege of Hytbold</u>\n\qThe Enemy is marching upon Hytbold, intent upon defeating the Lords of the Eastemnet and claiming eastern Rohan as their own.\q
Pelennor Prototype - Visual Test
<u>Negotiations</u>\n\qYou have earned the respect of the formidable Captain Jajax, and he will now negotiate with you regarding the fate of Lothgobel.\q
TBD…
<u>The Reclamation of Talath Anor</u>\n\qLearning of a group of Haradrim, unwilling to surrender, Elfhelm summons you to join him on a mission to rid Talath Anor of these fleeing foes.\q

<u>A Hunter's Charge</u>\n\qAfter receiving word of a pack of Wargs making their way into the Shire, land of the hobbits, the huntress Gytha Lainey has recruited the best hunters to track and slay the evil Wargs before they can harm any of the Shire-folk....\q
<u>Othrongroth</u>\n\qAn unholy alliance is forged within the depths of Othrongroth, the Great Barrow, a sinister pact which could spell doom for Eriador....\q

<u>Rescue by Moonlight</u>\n\qAvorthal had been moved from the Dourhand encampment to a ship preparing to depart for an unknown port in the North. His rescue is paramount to maintaining peace in Ered Luin....\q
<u>Too Far From the City</u>\n\qOsgiliath is lost, and its defenders flee across the plain. Can they reach the White City before the enemy overtakes them?\q

<u>Fornost</u>\n\qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

<u>Rage of the Erui</u>\n\qMaddened by the encroaching Haradrim, the Lone Lady has lashed out, raising the long-emptied armours of Men who fought in the Kin-strife to drown those who taint the waters of the Erui. Fearful of her anger growing beyond control, the Sisters of Lebennin have united to calm their Sister and bring peace to Lebennin once more.\q

<u>Prisoner of the Free Peoples</u>\n\qThe pages of Sara Oakheart's journal uncovered the way into the ruins of Delossad, once called Sithad in brighter days. The search for Narchuil has led here, but to what end? What have these ragged stones seen...?\q

<u>The Forges of Khazad-dûm</u>\n\qAt the height of Durin's reign, the Forges of Khazad-dûm were once famed for producing great crafts of beauty and majesty. Now they have fallen into misuse by the Orcs which now infest the ancient halls of Moria, spewing forth their terrible tools of war....\q\n
<u>What the Steward Saw</u>\n\qThere is much to do, and now I hear the Steward has summoned my friend for an audience? Time-wasting rubbish!\q
Prince Ingór has declared a Zhélruka Clan feast to commemorate their new Mountain-home….
<u>Let's Take the Hornburg!</u>\n\qYou have survived the long night standing before the walls of the Hornburg, and it is time to take your prize at last. The horse-men must fall!\q
<u>Death From Below</u>\n\qBeneath the captured tower of Thangúlhad, the earth stirs as a band of goblins strives to undermine the Malledhrim outpost.\q

<u>Last Stand</u>\n\qWildermore has suffered enough loss and heartbreak to last its people many lifetimes. With the return of Thrymm, the hero of the land, it is time for Núrzum's reign of terror to come to an end.\q
<u>TBD</u>\n\qTBD\q

<u>The Battle for Aughaire</u>\n\qMordirith, the Steward of Angmar was believed defeated, but such hope was in vain. According to the armies of Angmar, Mordirith has returned and now stretched forth his hand to crush the Trév Gallorg in Aughaire....\q
<u>Viznak Lives</u>\n\qViznak has escaped the Halls of Black Lore with his life, but the merrevail are closing in! We must hurry, before Faeron is overrun!\q
<u>Atop the Island</u>\n\qNow we will end the threat of Balakhâd and Nakási once and for all!\q
<u>Days Long Past</u>\n\qSheltered from the evil that has taken hold of the forest, Barallas wishes to recall the days before Núrzum's coming, when the Ents once met at the Enting Hollow.\q

<u>Assembly Call</u>\n\qThe Avanc-lûth have been swayed by your influence in Dunbog and have called an Assembly. There, they will decide if they are to fight the threat of Isengard or remain secluded from the world.\q

<u>Mekeb-farak</u>\n\qWhen Moria fell, so too did its lore and legends. Within the halls of Mekeb-farak, the stories told by the Dwarves of Moria rest silent and dust covered, waiting for someone to find them.\q

<u>The Water Wheels: Nalâ-dûm</u>\n\qDeep in the abysses of Moria, the dwarves had once crafted a great waterway to bring water in from the mountains. Something now blocks the great wheels from turning, causing the Iron Garrison concern.\q
<u>The First Blade</u>\n\qYou stand at the steps of Cair Andros where the fearsome Sûhalar, Korpûrta, must face the consequences of his actions for the slaughter of Gilgír and his sons.\q

<u>The Sixteenth Hall</u>\n\qThe dread malady that spreads among the servants of the Enemy in Moria is strong in the Sixteenth Hall. Whatever nameless thing dwells there has entrapped many an Orc to its service, poisoning their minds and controlling their actions.\q

<u>Fil Gashan</u>\n\qFil Ghashan is the stronghold of Talug, right hand of Mazog, Lord of Moria. Here, the Orc-general musters an army to make a futile assault upon Lothlórien. Here, he also breeds Orc-warriors of a most deadly skill....\q
<u>The Lord of Gundabad</u>\n\qI hear fighting just ahead! Let us press on!\q
<u>A Disturbance At the Gate</u>\n\qGárwig, the Reeve of Wildermore, has been summoned by a disturbance at the western gate of Forlaw.\q
<u>Battle of the Ford, Afternoon</u>\n\qWe formed up between Théodred and our foes, fighting for our lives and his. There seemed to be no end to the uruks!\q

As the War of Three Peaks drew near its end, the Dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ suffered a sudden, terrible setback. Before the final effort is made to breach the gates of Gundabad, the dwarves must resist falling to despair and overcome their doubts.

<u>Shield-maiden of Rohan</u>\n\qTo appease the grief of Reeve Fríthild's children, Thane Ordlac has chosen to hold a private -- and unsettlingly cheerful -- funeral for the late Reeve of the Broadacres....\q

By the breath of Hrímil Frost-heart, the gates of Gundabad were sealed shut. If the Dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ intend to enter the sacred mountain, they shall first have to overcome the towering wall of ice that separates them from their prize.
<u>Searching the Depths</u>\n\qAnd so we return to Mâkhda Khorbo, the Temple of Sauron. I had hoped to never see this foul place again. And yet, here we are.\q

<u>Retaking Pelargir</u>\n\qThe Corsair fleet has tarried on Gondor's coast, pillaging on their way. Now Aragorn's host has caught up with them at the port city of Pelargir. Join Elladan and Elrohir in an advance party to clear the path for Aragorn's assault on the unsuspecting Corsair force.\q

<u>The Shattered Crown</u>\n\qAfter the fall of Mordirith at Gador Gúlaran, the dread-realm of Angmar was undone yet again. In the wake of its downfall, the folk of that realm and what remained of their Dourhand and Hill-men allies fled beyond Bálach Iaran into Câr Bronach. However, bereft of the wisdom of their masters, the Iron Crown fell into disarray and sought desperately for a means to restore their kingdom of old.\q

<u>Caverns of Thrumfall</u>\n\qDeep within the recesses of the Stormwall lie ancient passages and twisted tunnels, concealing the whereabouts of Etterfang Foulmaw and her restless horde. Only the dwarf Drengur has seen the venomous beast and lived to tell the tale.\q
<u>Siege Escalated</u>\n\qThe White Hand is pressing its assault upon Brockbridge, and the few defending it will be hard-pressed to survive.\q
<u>Doom of Caras Gelebren</u>\n\qDetermined to possess the Great Rings of Power, Sauron made war upon the Elves and led his vast armies to Eregion to lay waste to Caras Gelebren....\q
<u>Sons of Blackroot</u>\n\qMy brother and I have sworn a solemn vow to bring down the mighty Mûmakil that have come to Gondor!\q
<u>Among Enemies</u>\n\qAzagath slew my captors in Jirush, but I felt no gratitude to him. I fled from him, seeking somewhere to hide.\q
<u>Gothmog Appears</u>\n\qOur enemies have brought a great ram to the city. We must damage or destroy it!\q
<u>An Audience with the Cuan-lûth</u>\n\qThough Cariad would like for you to help him approach the Rangers, discussing such matters with the leader of his people may be another problem.\q

<u>Munfaeril's Warning</u>\n\qMadin's grandfather was a good man, giving succour to the People of the Boar when the Draig-lûth nearly destroyed them. Madin and his son Nevid, however, have fallen to evil ways, and I cannot, as a servant of the Huntsman, allow this travesty to continue....\q

<u>Bonds of Oak and Iron</u>\n\qAs the Battle of Azanulbizar continued on the slopes of Zirakzigil and Bundushâthur, King Thráin and his vanguard prepared to assault the gates of Khazad-dûm. Yet, unbeknownst to the Dwarves of the Haban'akkâ, there was unrest at Amdân.\q
<u>At A Cross-roads</u>\n\qThe Cuan-lûth do not bow easily to those with power, and the Rangers of Tornhad are no exception.\q

<u>Memories of Máttugard</u>\n\qFor but a brief moment during the Sixth War of the Dwarves and Orcs, the Haban'akkâ of Thráin gained entry to Mattugard. But beyond the noble gate of Mount Gundabad, Komog, son of Azog, laid in wait to slay all that sought to reclaim even the smallest foothold within his father's realm.\q

<u>Flowers for Eshtali</u>\n\qEshtali lies in the tombs of Esh-kimâkhi. In the fight to liberate Kûr Anzar, there was scarcely enough time to think, let alone mourn the dead. Now that the immediate threat is over, we mourn our fallen and remind ourselves why they still take such firm residence in our hearts.\q
<u>Wrath of the Reeve</u>\n\qI have taken to the battlefield, hoping to inspire and reassure my people. We fight together, and I wish to witness firsthand your ability in combat.\q

<u>Dark Delvings</u>\n\qIn the deepest delvings of Moria dwell nameless things which shun the light and feed on the darkness. The Elves of Lórien strive to constrain the vile creatures, but led by the evil Gurvand, they may be too strong to hold back forever....\q
Upon the High Pass, a terrible frost drake guards the mountain path….
Upon the High Pass, the Frost-horde has blocked the mountain path….
Rumours tell of a mighty beast unlike any other. Deep in the Shield Isles it lies, who preying on Corsairs and freebooters alike. Venture forth and try to find and tame the mighty beast.

<u>The Last Refuge</u>\n\qSkorgrím's Dourhands have taken refuge from the wrath of Durin's Folk within an ancient dwarf-hold high in the passes of the Misty Mountains. There, they plot their return, unless an end can be put to their scheming once and for all....\q
<u>The Story of a Strange Stone</u>\n\qThere is a story behind the stone fragment you uncovered in Dunfast...\q

<u>Mossward, The Border Village</u>\n\qSpeak, then, of how you came to this place of safety: Rivendell, the Last Homely House East of the Sea. But speak swiftly, before the shadows deepen. From where did your road lead?\q
In the ruins of Sedgemead a new menace arises. Drive the Earth-kin from the ruins.
Despite the failure of the Iron Garrison, the dwarves will not allow the Orcs of Khazad-dûm to spill forth into Azanulbizar, the Dimrill Dale.

<u>A Burglar's Errand</u>\n\qMedhrod, a legendary sword once wielded by a great hero who helped keep the Great East Road clear of threats, has been stolen by the half-orcs of Naerost, leading Palma Brownlock, a hobbit-burglar of no small reputation, to gather allies to recover it....\q
Despite the failure of the Iron Garrison, the dwarves will not allow the Orcs of Khazad-dûm to spill forth into Azanulbizar, the Dimrill Dale.
Despite the failure of the Iron Garrison, the dwarves will not allow the Orcs of Khazad-dûm to spill forth into Azanulbizar, the Dimrill Dale.
Just an ordinary night in a quiet hobbit township. What could possibly go wrong?
<u>Signs and Portents</u>\n\qThe dreaming mind sees much, and much is seen of it...\q
Despite the failure of the Iron Garrison, the dwarves will not allow the Orcs of Khazad-dûm to spill forth into Azanulbizar, the Dimrill Dale.
Despite the failure of the Iron Garrison, the dwarves will not allow the Orcs of Khazad-dûm to spill forth into Azanulbizar, the Dimrill Dale.

<u>A House Forged Anew</u>\n\qAfter seventy-eight years in the dungeons of Barad-dûr, King Váskmun Greytooth of the Stout-axes has returned to lead his folk. However, if there is to remain any hope of forging a new Dwarf-kingdom within Mordor, the Stout-axes must break free of their servitude and challenge the Mistress of Lûghash, Zôreth.\q
<u>Death Comes for All</u>\n\qThe Rohirrim have taken the field, and the armies of Mordor cannot stand against us!\q
Within the old halls of Kallamdâm, in Gundabad, cold-drakes of the Frost-horde erect a fortress of ice….
<u>Battle For Maurûsh</u>\n\qThe time has come to fight with Galâmka and the refugees to reclaim the stronghold of Maurûsh from the Orcs.\q
<u>To Avert a War</u>\n\qThe Ranger Langlas prepares to mount an effort to rescue the Elf-prince Avorthal from the clutches of the treacherous Dourhands....\q
The post is late from the Shire and the news is that something has the post-carrier spooked and unwilling to make the crossing. You have been sent to investigate.
Rumors of permafrost within a frigid dwarven catacomb begin to circulate….

<u>The Foe Resurgent</u>\n\qThe Witch-king of Angmar is slain, but the forces of the Enemy remain unbroken. Instead of fleeing at the sight of their Master's fate, their resolve is strengthened as countless new foes pour forth from Osgiliath. What other commander could lead such an army against Gondor?\q

<u>Sant Lhoer, the Poison Gardens</u>\n\qKnown as the poison gardens of Carn Dûm, Sant Lhoer is a dank place teeming with deadly plants, trees, and flowers, the likes of which have scarcely or never before been seen in Middle-earth. Above the foetid, beryl-green waters which flow through Sant Lhoer rise immense, pellucid structures, greatest among them Bâr Heledh, the Glass House. It is here that the sorceress Oganuin plies her craft, experimenting upon creatures, plants, and all those who stray too near the ever-grasping tendrils of her creations. To what end, and for what purpose? One can only assume the darkest of designs....\q
<u>A Final Vengeance</u>\n\qWe have to find Golodir before it is too late!\q
<u>On a Field of Red</u>\n\qFight onward! The battle is not yet ended!\q

<u>The Sickle, the Lotus, and the Lion</u>\n\qYou have brought the leaders of Ambarûl, Khûd Zagin, and Imhûlar together in Iridír. Mizâdi has much to do before Girhâzi and Amalíbi trust her or her leadership.\q
<u>Lords of the Eastemnet</u>\n\qSkeptical of the King's state of mind, the Lords of the Eastemnet have gathered to decide how to defend their lands.\q

<u>Attack at Dawn</u>\n\qIn the late evening hours, a small group of refugees sought refuge in the hidden Ranger-camp of Esteldín. These refugees were followed by a small group of goblin-scouts that quickly fled to Dol Dínen to bring word to their chief, Graug. Siniath the Ranger has asked you to seek out Graug and defeat him before he can spread word of Esteldín's location. As you arrive near Dol Dínen, the first rays of the false dawn can be seen overhead.\q

<u>Tûl Zakana, the Well of Forgetting</u>\n\qDeep in the war-torn lands of Imhûlar, locals warn you of an Ordâkhai encampment, a trading post of sorts. It is known as Tûl Zakana, the Well of Forgetting, whose waters will make you forget your troubles, and, if you drink enough, even who you are. But unless you are trading for this water, it's best to stay quite clear of the Well, for many have vanished near it, never to be seen again. You are now tasked by the families of the vanished with investigating the Well and its secrets.\q
<u>Hildith's Council</u>\n\qHildith, the headstrong wife of Grimbold, now leads Grimslade in her husband's absence.\q
<u>Ransacking Gathbúrz</u>

<u>Sagroth, Lair of Vermin</u>\n\qYears under the corruptive influence of the Iron Crown have poisoned the land, leading to rumours of monstrosities lurking within Carn Dûm's sewers. A sorcerer named Gárvadach pursued these rumours for his own ambitious purposes. Little did he know, a group of Trév Duvárdain has tracked him down, determined to put an end to his twisted aspirations....\q
Take what gold ypu can find to supply Mizâdi's forces and defeat the powerful foes in the Ekhamâti camp.

<u>A Timely Rescue</u>\n\qNow and again even the finest tracker may find that the tables have turned upon him and the hunter becomes the hunted. So it is with my kinsman Amarion, who finds himself in a precarious position, as shadow wolves stalk him in the gathering darkness.\q
<u>The War of the Three Peaks</u>\n\qForward! Forward! Gundabad will be ours!\q

<u>Sister of the Gilrain</u>\n\qThe mysterious Roamingstar, Sister of the Gilrain, hopes to atone for her past mistakes by using her influence over the rivers of Gondor to banish the Ruthless Dead from her lands forever.\q
<u>Into The Citadel</u>\n\qThat is enough rest for now. Pick up the water-bowl again and cross the bridge.\q
<u>The Secret of Stormwall</u>\n\qDeep within the ruined crafting halls of Stormwall lies a burning secret, slumbering in the shadows....\q
Far from Angmar, the last stronghold of the Iron Crown keeps watch over Elderslade for the forces of Gundabad….
<u>Meet Harding</u>\n\qHarding is the Thane of Harwick, Reeve of the Wold, and Aldor of the Northmarch, and the time has come to meet him....\q
Far from Angmar, the last stronghold of the Iron Crown keeps watch over Elderslade for the forces of Gundabad….
Far from Angmar, the last stronghold of the Iron Crown keeps watch over Elderslade for the forces of Gundabad….
<u>Missing in the Marshes</u>\n\qArtamir has disappeared from his camp. Has he run afoul of some evil in the Dead Marshes...?\q

<u>Mysteries To Unravel</u>\n\qFor reasons unknown, Aighrig of the Trév Dúvardain has ventured alone into the Angmarim encampment of Dûn Traikh. With the Angmarim bent upon hunting her down, the situation has grown dire.\q
<u>The Ithil-Stone</u>\n\qUnder the command of Ingold, many in Gondor work to thwart the nefarious plans of Dulgabêth, the Black Word as he sifts through the ruins of Sauron's defeat.\q

<u>The Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu</u>\n\qWithin the Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu, Angmar mines for the ore they need to arm their legions. In their search for iron, they have uncovered the home of the Eldgang, as well as a hidden evil, ancient beyond knowledge....\q
<u>Acolyte of The Necromancer</u>\n\qOroniel, captain of guards of Felegoth, has unexpectingly encountered a threat from Dol Guldur, hidden within the old elven ruins of Caras Tilion.\q
<u>The Hands of a Healer</u>\n\qA great effort has been expended to find kingsfoil for the wounded, but now their survival depends upon Aragorn's healing skill.\q

<u>A Trap for the Creature</u>\n\qGarbert, a fisherman in Tâl Bruinen, believes a trap can be set for the skulking creature which has terrorized the scattered inhabitants remaining in the region. Nevertheless, the creature has been a wary and cunning opponent....\q
<u>Instance: Faltharan's Confrontation</u>\n\qYou have tracked down where the traitor Lorvegil is located, and are ready to bring him to justice.\q
A massive encampment of brigands threatens the region, and there is a growing fear that the organized forces are soon to attack. You are directed to find any plans that might be in the encampment.
<u>Hard Negotiations</u>\n\qIn the grim aftermath of the Wade-slaught, Thane Edric journeys to Edoras to confront Éowyn on matters of honour and duty.\q
<u>The King and the Steward</u>\n\qThe gates of the city lie before us. It is time at last.\q
There is a thought that if the leaders of the Southron Men are eliminated then the rest will fall into disarray. Make your way to the encampment.

Watch-towers in the brigand encampment provide them a greater visibility over the approaching land. A large force cannot approach, but a small number can, and you have been drafted to remove their threat.
<u>Judgements of the King</u>\n\qMany are the matters set before the throne on this day. May I rule justly, for the good of Gondor!\q
<u>The Sons of Isildur</u>\n\qThis siege has lasted much longer than anyone expected, or hoped.\q
<u>The Wizard and the King</u>\n\qNight blankets the city, but we have climbed in darkness high above Minas Tirith. I know not Mithrandir's purpose.\q

<u>Tales of the Bright Company</u>\n\qGlorfindel and the Bright Company have accomplished many heroic feats in service of High King Gil-galad. But be not over-awed! I have found them friendly and approachable both.\q
<u>A True Friend of Gondor</u>\n\qA new White Tree will grow in the Court of the Fountain. May Gondor prosper!\q
<u>All Is Quiet</u>\n\qAll is quiet, and our victory will soon be at hand. And to think you doubted this would be easy!\q
Reports reached the village that there are trees walking around the hillside. This cannot be so, and you have been drafted to investigate.

<u>Behind Bars</u>\n\qNot long ago, my kinsman Dagoras was captured by deserters from the Dunlending force in Eregion. I've sent aid for his rescue, but their freedom shall be short-lived if they cannot escape before the alarm is raised.\q
<u>A New Post</u>\n\qRaphûz invited you to speak with him after you assisted him.\q

<u>The Ruined City</u>\n\qThrough ruined Osgiliath, you pursue a mysterious figure arrayed in Faramir's tattered cloak. When at last you catch up, will you find Faramir beneath the hood? Will you know the face for friend or foe? You must hope, at least, that you will learn something of Faramir's final fate.\q
<u>The Drowned Relics</u>\nMany ancient relics are believed to have drowned in the Dunbog, but lucky anglers can often snare these treasures.\q

<u>The Howling Pit</u>\n\qDeep beneath Járnfast, in a place where the red stone once cracked, three doors were recently riven. Three doors and a seal of mithril, built to contain a rift of howling horrors, straining to get out.\q
Upon the ruins of Shakal-atrâd, in Elderslade, an Angmarim ritual has taken place, defiling the old watch-tower….

<u>Retaking Pelargir</u>\n\qThe Corsair fleet has tarried on Gondor's coast, pillaging on their way. Now Aragorn's host has caught up with them at the port city of Pelargir. Join Elladan and Elrohir in an advance party to clear the path for Aragorn's assault on the unsuspecting Corsair force.\q
<u>Funeral for a Friend</u>\n\qAfter the Battle of the Hornburg, Burnoth, Ulf, and Hutha recount the heroic deeds of their fallen companion, Léofdag, to honour his memory....\q
Within the ruins of Shakal-atrâd, in Elderslade, an Angmarim ritual has taken place, defiling the depths of the old watch-tower….

<u>The Rite Undone</u>\n\qIt was not long after the Iron Crown returned to Carn Dûm that the Trév Duvárdain and their chieftain, Claghórd, began to trouble us once again. In mere days, the Stone of Clúcath was seized, the challenge was called, and we of the Trév Gállorg had no choice but to answer it....\q
Treasures have been stolen from the dwarves! It is suspected that the treasures were brought to Shakal-atrâd, in Elderslade, and hidden in the depths of the old watch-tower….

<u>The Truth of the Matter</u>\n\qWhile the mystery of the thief has been solved, the Orc's offer of information has complicated matters. He may be the key to understanding the situation in Deepscrave, but his trustworthiness is another question entirely.\q

<u>Beneath the Drearspire</u>\n\qAfter the downfall of Mordirith, Angmar fell into disarray and the Iron Crown all but abandoned Carn Dûm. With our future now uncertain, tensions arose within the Trév Duvárdain, leading many to forsake their oaths, renounce their kin and tribesmen, and turn their blades upon the Iron Crown. In time, those of us who remained travelled into the east, into the shadow of Mount Gundabad, and into that accursed tower, Tûr Fúar, the Drearspire....\q

<u>Nothing for Nothing</u>\n\qLhaereth the Stained has invaded the Circle of Madness seeking information. It has brought her to my doorstep, the Halls of Black Lore. She may perhaps gain what she seeks, but I have one rule that all who enter must observe: Nothing for nothing.\q

<u>Meeting the Quartermaster</u>\n\qWith Shúkurz's help, you have made it into Vatug-ronk without a scratch. The mission is far from over, however. There is no telling whether your guise of being a prisoner will fail, or if you will even learn of Dhúrstrok's location at all....\q

<u>Angmar Reborn</u>\n\qIn the aftermath of the siege of Carn Dûm and the destruction of the shard of Tauressar, Hill-men of the last great tribes of Angmar, the Trév Gállorg and the Trév Duvárdain, have gathered to parley at Fail-á-Khro. As the Iron Crown falls and the shadow of the Witch-king fades at last, a new day dawns across Angmar....\q
Those of Trader's Wharf have all been called away, and you are the only one left to defend the docks from attackers.

<u>Léofdag's Return</u>\n\qBurnoth bade you return Léofdag's ody to his home in Aldburg, where you are to speak of his honour and valour at Helm's Deep, redeeming him in the eyes of the townsfolk and his family....\q

<u>Odd Benefactors</u>\n\qThe Dunlendings in Cuvnerth have been receiving supplies from a mysterious source somewhere within a nearby cave. Whatever the foe that aids our enemies, it must be stopped!\q
A group of brigands led by Ulâmul the Talon has been preying on citizens along the road. Discover their hiding places and put an end to them.

<u>Ride Against the Goblins</u>\n\qBaldmund, leader of the refugees from Torsbury, convinced Reeve Fríthild that the first threat they should deal with are the Warg-riders in the east, which prevent the hunters of Stoke from provisioning the townsfolk for the coming siege....\q

<u>The Trail Ends</u>\n\qThe Draig-lûth has captured many clansmen and women of the Uch-lûth and imprisoned them in a great cavern hidden behind a waterfall. It is the fate of these poor prisoners to be used as fodder to appease the gwiber and giants of Thrór's Coomb....\q
<u>Heirloom of the Eglain</u>\n\qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted carving have led you to the Spring of the Red-maid....\q
At Nímbarth, half-men from the south make ready for war. It is time to foil their plans.
Haudh Nírui has been overrun by grave-robbing goblins. If we defeat their leader we may be able to scare them off for now.

<u>Assault on Bardh-dorám</u>\n\qThane Ordlac of Oserley convinced Reeve Fríthild to put an end to the White Hand's invasion once and for all by leading an assault against their camp of Bardh-dorám....\q

<u>Hammer of the Underworld</u>\n\qThe defenders of Gondor struggle to hold the line as Grond, the great ram of the Enemy, crawls towards the gates of Minas Tirith. Grond must be destroyed before it can serve its vile purpose!\q
The key to more powerful explosives may lie in the slimy secretions of gredbyg....

<u>Necessary Sacrifices</u>\n\qDesperate to be rid of the innumerable spiders and other foul creatures now feeding on the Orcs of Lhingris, Captain Róglarg of Cirith Ungol has gathered a company of Orcs to be sacrificed as tribute to Her Ladyship, Shelob.\q
Prince Ingór has declared that the newly forged Zhélruka swords must be properly tested before they can be gifted to the Longbeards….
<u>Who is our Ally?</u>\n\qSigénik lead you to a secluded area of Jirush and whishes to question your knowledge of who the elder aligned with the rebellion may be.\q

<u>The Mustering</u>\n\qGrimbold has fallen into a deep gloom since the death Prince Théodred, and deeper still when Elfhelm and the Rohirrim abandoned him. He now awaits death as the last defender of the Fords.\q

<u>The Heraldry of Lindon</u>\n\qIn the confusion which ensued during the abandonment of Dolendath, many things were left behind by Golodir's company, not the least of which was the breastplate of the Elf-lord Laerdan. But other things lie there as well... best left buried....\q
<u>The Fords Have Fallen</u>\n\qFollowing the death of Théodred, the servants of the White Hand launch a second attack upon Elfhelm and Grimbold at the Fords of Isen....\q
<u>Troubled Friendship</u>\n\qI know not why my friends Sperling and Brúnstan are fighting, but someone must stop them! I am afraid they are going to injure more than their friendship....\q

With little reason to celebrate, the masters at Gramsfoot have noticed morale slipping. To bolster the troops they are sending forth intrepid combatants to gather as many hobbits as can be gathered for a great feast.
<u>Sword-hall of Dol Guldur</u>\n\qThe Sword-hall of Dol Guldur is the central training hall of the Enemy's minions, overseen by three terrible champions of the Dark Lord….\q

<u>Ost Dunhoth</u>\n\qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition...\q

<u>Realm of the Old Mother</u>\n\qThranduil Swiftstream, King of the Northern Wood, has finally found his old foe, the spider Iphantemel. Trapped within the rocky crevasse of Torech Emel, Thranduil hopes to keep sight on the spider until the Old Mother can be dealt with.\q
A young man seeks his place in life and discovers it in service to the sea.
A first tour on the sea ends in a harbour town under attack.
While on a standard patrol beyond the Bay of Belfalas, the Mariner and crew discover the Corsairs responsible for the attack on Pelargir and prepare to apprehend them.

<u>Zigilburk Returned</u>\n\qThe dwarves Bori and Bróin have arrived at a momentous decision: to return the mithril axe, Zigilburk, to the place where it was found, never to be wielded by friend or foe again.\q
The bond between the Captain and Mariner grows deeper.
<u>Blackwolds Broken</u>\n\qAmdir's defeat shattered the back of the Blackwolds, but pieces of the mystery remain unsolved....\q
<u>Taking the Morvith Bridge</u>
Far beyond familiar shores, at the tip of Andrast, the Mariner's ship, The Nenglor, traps the Corsair captain on the shore.
<u>Muckle: Moria</u>\n\q Within the depths of Moria there is an ancient battle taking place.\q
After receiving commendation for rescuing the captives, the Captain and Mariner rebuild the Nenglor.
<u>Into the Circle of Wrath</u>\n\qTo gain a foothold in Minas Morgul, we must capture the tower of the Gate-wardens' Keep in the Circle of Wrath.\q
<u>Red-pass</u>\n\qThe Gaunt-lord Ivar spreads corruption through Agamaur, the Red Swamp, raising a host of evil to do the bidding of Angmar....\q
A discussion of duty and vengeance aboard the Nenglor.
A discovery could restore honour and dignity to the Captain and so the Mariner set out to help his friend.

<u>The Glittering Caves</u>\n\qThe Glittering Caves of Aglarond are where the women, children, and supplies have been hidden. With the loss of the Wall and the Deeping-comb, Gimli, Gamling, and Eómer now rally any they can find to hold the line and protect all huddled within.\q
After a terrible wreck that cost all parties their ship, the Captain and the Mariner engage the Corsair captain and his lieutenants in a battle to the death.
<u>Facing His Fear</u>\n\qRaphûz asked you to assist him in facing his greatest fear.\q
<u>Proving His Bravery</u>\n\qRaphûz asked you to assist him prove his bravery.\q
The crew of the Khâlbina have been kidnapped by Corsairs! Luckily they are still in port. Rescue the crew and take the fight to the Corsairs.
You must intercept a caravan of waggons filled with supplies and weapons and turn it over to Mizâdi's forces.

<u>Boss from the Vaults: Naruhel the Red-maid</u>\n\qThe Red-maid is lost -- or so it seems -- to the corruption wrought upon her land at the hands of corrupt Men. Perhaps you can discover a method to undo the damage.\q

<u>Jailbreak</u>\n\qA chance encounter with brigands upon the road leads to captivity. You awaken with the Ranger, Strider, before you.  As he urges you to act quickly, you realize that you have become involved in matters much greater than yourself....\q

<u>Seat of the Great Goblin</u>\n\qThe denizens of Goblin-town have remained long in disarray after the death of the Great Goblin and their defeat at the Lonely Mountain. Whispers have travelled throughout the Misty Mountains of a new Great Goblin, a leader whose return could spell doom for the Free Peoples of Middle-earth.\q
<u>Tûr Fúar, the Drearspire</u>\n\qTBD.\q
<u>The Gates of Isengard</u>\n\qAn emissary of the Rohirrim approaches the gates of Isengard, hoping to learn the true intentions of the wizard Saruman.\q

<u>Glimmerdeep</u>\n\qAn Orkish faction now occupies much of Glimmerdeep, pillaging its wealth for who knows what master and standing in the path of the Zhélruka resettlement of their ancient lands.\q

<u>Lady Éowyn's Charge</u>\n\qThe Lady Éowyn of the House of Eorl has been charged with protecting the people of Edoras. Soon, she will lead them to Dunharrow in the south as the forces of Isengard begin to close in.\q
<u>Fire Beneath the Shadow</u>\n\qTo protect the Host of the West, I have taken it upon myself to lead Aragorn and his trusted friend into the Morgul Vale.\q

<u>The Hand of Angmar</u>\n\qYrjänä, the chieftain of Sûri-kylä, desires to aid the Free Peoples of the South in their hunt for Narchuil, the ring of Amarthiel, but he fears the threats of Mordrambor....\q
'I probably worry for nothing. When we find Bilbo we will laugh long and well... but not before!'
'Look for Canaddal and Ringhul on the high moor outside the valley. Perhaps they have seen something of our hobbit!'

<u>Into Darkness Falls a Star</u>\n\qIn the Year 3434 of the Second Age, a great Alliance of Elves and Men assembled in defiance of the Dark Lord's will to conquer all the lands of Middle-earth. The High Elves, the blessed of Valinor who suffered the greatest wraths of Sauron and Morgoth the Enemy, now seek to ensure that his evil is forever banished from the world.\q
'Arifael may have seen our missing hobbit. The trick may be getting him to tell us!'

<u>Ashunûg, the Fane of the Accursed</u>\n\qWe have discovered a dangerous cult of Usan-kûni worshippers hiding in our own back-yard. They call themselves Anâkhi, and have made their home inside Ashunûg, a salt mine in northern Ambarûl that has long been abandoned. We are only recently freed of Sauron, the All-Seeing, and must not allow this new cult to take hold. The Anâkhi scorpion worshippers must be driven from our lands.\q
'I understand that Bilbo once adventured with the dwarf Glóin, who now camps north of Imladris. Has he seen Bilbo lately?'

<u>Bult-kâr</u>\n\qOnce one of the great lumber store-houses of Moria, Bult-kâr has long since fallen into the domain of Orc and beast. The Iron Garrison, in need of supplies to fuel their reclamation efforts, see Bult-kâr as a crucial location that must be brought back into the control of the dwarves.\q
<u>The Great Hall of Durin</u>\n\qYou have met a dwarf passing through Zelem-melek in the Great Hall of Durin, but it would seem that not all is well in his travels.\q
'Bilbo may have left tracks behind as he journeyed north... unless the recent snows have buried them!'
'Fight your way into Pinnath Fenui and clear it of goblins! Only then will it be safe to confront the goblin-leader about our missing hobbit!'
'We will need a distraction if you are to rescue Bilbo from Goblin-town. I will provide it!'
'Close the gates that lead further into Goblin-town, or you will be overrun before you can rescue Bilbo!'
<u>At the Stone of Erech</u>\n\qIn the Second Age of Middle-earth, Isildur called the Men of the Mountains to the hill of Erech to discuss their loyalties....\q
'They must be holding him in the dungeons! Find Bilbo and free him!'
<u>Whispers from the Long Years</u>\n\qI do not know what lies beyond that room of deep shadow. Remain alert!\q
Zóva, Prince Ingór's advisor, has devised a plan to further disrupt the Orkish factions within Gundabad….
<u>Lhaid Ogo</u>\n\qCan the words of Ergothorn be trusted? If so, a messenger from Dunland must be somewhere in the depths of Lhaid Ogo, hurt and afraid...\q

<u>The Harrowing of Morgul</u>\n\qIn an attempt to repel the forces of Ugrukhôr and the Rangers of Ithilien, Gothmog's forces have fortified the outermost ring of Minas Morgul. Believing the ire between Ugrukhôr and Gothmog might be turned to your advantage, Damrod has tasked you with igniting a war between the Orcs in Minas Morgul.\q

<u>The Skin of Bregmor</u>\n\qThe Champions of Eriador have been thwarted in their attempts to hinder Angmar's plans. All that remains to them now is to keep Angmar from claiming the hide of the dragon Bregmor....\q

<u>New Devilry</u>\n\qWith the absence of the Balrog, other powers less great, yet terrible still, have arisen in the dark places. Mazog has sent his Orcs into the Shadowy Abyss to entreat or control these powers...though it may prove his undoing....\q
<u>Attack on Zudrugund</u>\n\qOnce more we put our trust in Ergothorn and travel with utmost haste to Zudrugund. Will we find there a band of uruks, as he says, or a time-wasting detour?\q

<u>The Mirror of Galadriel</u>\n\qJealously do I guard my secrets, not the least of which is my mirror. Still there are times which require a greater knowledge, and this is one such time. Shadows gather in the east, and the fates of lost friends burns in the heart....\q

The Ordâkhai are a fearful people. Many of them have heard a story since they were children of a blood-stained spectre who steals the life right from the Men of the south when they sleep. We believe you can be that spectre to them, to ignite their fears.
<u>Together Now</u>\n\qAshâmi and Raphûz are tasked with attacking the cultists as a distraction.\q

<u>The Doom of the North</u>\n\qAngmar has gathered all they need to kindle the forges of Eregion. The Champions of Eriador must now travel to Mirobel and do whatever they must to foil the plans of Amarthiel....\q
<u>The Runes of Malice</u>\n\qVarthmath, the brave Beorning, trusts his keen senses in that something indeed stirs the creatures of Máttugard from within caverns, deep under the Mighty Court.\q
<u>Heirloom of the Ordinary</u>\n\qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted necklace have returned you to a forsaken ship....\q

<u>Barad Tironn</u>\n\qLaerdan, succumbing to the whisperings of Mordrambor, foolishly seeks to confront Amarthiel at Barad Tironn, where she seeks to use the palantír to find Narchuil. The only hope for the Free Peoples is for the palantír to be recovered from her grasp....\q
Within the halls of Thikil-gundu, hidden riches await excavation from the darkest corners….
Within the halls of Thikil-gundu, the corpses of dwarves of old roam the ancient keep….
Within the halls of Thikil-gundu, Orcs from Gundabad have taken hold of the old armoury….
TBD…
The entrance to Thikil-gundu has been blockaded by a terrible frost drake and her spawn….

<u>Helm's Dike</u>\n\qHelm's Dike forms the first barrier of defence for Rohan's final stand. The rearguard left here must buy time for the defenders to prepare the fortress and wall for the oncoming siege. Saruman's army marches, angry and ready for war.\q
Deep within Wyrmsgráf, there lies a great larder which once belonged to Scatha the Worm. In recent years, it has come to be a feeding ground for the young dragon-kind of Ered Mithrin.
<u>Defence of The Prancing Pony</u>\n\qThe inhabitants of Bree have spent the occupation holed up within The Prancing Pony. Angered at their uprising, the brigands have decided to burn them out....\q

Deep within Wyrmsgráf, there lies a great larder which once belonged to Scatha the Worm. Long lost to the Dwarves of the North, the time has come to reclaim the remains of their ancestors from Scatha.

<u>Ost Dunhoth</u>\n\qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition….\q

<u>The Battle Under the Tress</u>\n\qMy own kingdom was not the first attacked. First came Lothlorien. Three times the Golden Wood was tested by Dol-Guldur, I have learned, the first falling some days before the battle at high-walled Minas Tirith in Gondor.\q
<u>The Glittering Caves</u>\n\qThe folk sheltering in the caves will be defenceless if the battle goes against us. Protect them, my friend.\q
Deep within Wyrmsgráf, there lies a great larder which once belonged to Scatha the Worm. Rumours have spread of a gluttonous rock-worm dwelling among the bones of Scatha's long-devoured prey.
<u>A Faltering Reflection</u>\n\qYou are here. I am so glad. Come stand by my Mirror once more. We shall see what we shall see in it, you and I.\q

<u>The Return</u>\n\qWe have followed Glorfindel's trail to, of all places the Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu. We must hope he has found the prophecy of Gil-galad there that he sought, and that all else lies as still and undisturbed as we left it.\q
<u>The Bow is Drawn</u>\n\qWith nothing else to stall it, the deliberations of the Elves' Council of War may begin. Take the place you have truly earned among them.\q
<u>Den of Pughlak</u>\n\qFar under Mount Gundabad lies the Den of Pughlak, the realm of the deepest of the deep toads.\q

<u>A Mysterious Council</u>\n\qThe flame from the scorched breath of a pygmy drake gave life to your torch, and a map was revealed to guide your feet to this chamber. Moria has many forgotten places, hidden by secrets that died with their keepers. What will your bright light illuminate now that the darkness is pierced?\q
<u>Respite in Shonith</u>\n\qAfter the struggles the pair faced, Raphûz and Ashâmi share time in Shonith.\q

<u>The Defence of Trestlebridge</u>\n\qThe little town of Trestlebridge is all that stands between the Orcs of Angmar and Bree-land to the south. Halbarad, Ranger of the North, gathers heroes to help defend Trestlebridge from the approaching onslaught....\q
<u>The Smell of Revolt</u>\n\qLotho's plans to change the Bounds in Yondershire must be stopped. Luckily, Fredegar Bolger has a plan of his own.\q
Thieving Corsairs are stealing artifacts from the Ambarûli side of Telperiën's Wall. You have been asked to put a stop to this by any means necessary.
<u>Stand at Ost Galadh</u>
'Let us hope you can bring Bilbo safely through Goblin-town without incident!'

<u>Filikul</u>\n\qHasta went forth to discover the meaning of the strange happenings which occurred but weeks before. He has not returned, and his companions are becoming worried that something may have happened to him….\q\n
Flags of the enemy fly over Caras Gelebren. The White Hand defiles the land once held sacred by the Elves. Tear down their banners.
<u>The Fiddle and the Drum</u>\n\qLong at odds with the glory-seeking Éowyn, Ellen Fremedon of Underharrow finds herself overwhelmed by the task of sheltering the helpless of Rohan.\q
<u>The Mysterious Thief</u>\n\qNight has fallen on the trading village of Loeglond. Now is the time to enact Sírithon's plan, patrolling the village in hopes of catching mysterious bandit.\q

<u>Instance: The Pain of Regret</u>\n\qLéofmar carries a deep guilt with him since his arrival in Fangorn, one that has led him to believe that he is cursed. He is ready to reveal to you the story behind his regret.\q

<u>The Tomb of Elendil</u>\n\qRespect, the one thing Gwindeth desired most, has earned passage into the tomb of Elendil, the resting place of the last Silithar. But with the lowering of the floods, robbers and thieves have taken the opportunity to plunder the tomb....\q

<u>Roots of Fangorn</u>\n\qA dread spider queen, long ago banished beneath the misty mountains, has returned to wreak her vengence upon the ents of the forest. Even now her brood poisons the roots of ancient Fangorn, in caverns far below.\q

<u>The Legend of Folca</u>\n\qMeregyth, daughter of the Thane of Fenmarch, retells the story of King Folca the Hunter and the Boar of Everholt. This tale of bravery and vengeance may illuminate details of history that were lost.\q

<u>Confronting Dravron</u>\n\qArmed with the knowledge that Dravron is cheating on his taxes, the Lord Dervorin moves to confront the lumber camp's leader. He does not expect things to turn to violence, but in case they do, he has bid you to join him.\q
<u>The Siege of Gondamon</u>\n\qThe Dourhands have forged an alliance with the Blue Crag goblins and have laid siege to Gondamon for nearly two weeks. The final assault will be launched soon....\q
<u>Heirloom of the Riddermark</u>\n\qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted heirloom have run afoul of an Orc raiding party....\q
Deep within the halls of Gundabad, an ancient forge has long grown cold….
<u>The Tale of Tolwin</u>\n\qThe slain body of a Sûhalar Easterling has led you to a brave warrior holding out in Talath Anor that may be in need of your aid.\q
Orcs have set up camp near the Span of Nâmbadir. You are tasked with sabotaging their weapons and defeating any who get in your way.
<u>Shattered Roots</u>\n\qAfter conversing with the trees of Balewood, Mossbeard has learned horrifying truths of Núrzum's origins and the fate of the elder Huorn, Brúndoron.\q
<u>Farewell to Pelargir</u>\n\qAfter freeing many citizens of Pelargir from the grasp of Corsair holdouts, it is now time for them to locate a safer refuge.\q

<u>The Silent Street</u>\n\qIn his haste to save Faramir, Beregond has thrown open the Fen Hollen and makes for the House of the Stewards. In his wake, the enemies of Gondor descend on Rath Dínen, the Silent Street, all hoping to bring the rule of the Stewards to an end.\q
You found the tracks of a terrible beast that must have gored the Mariner and put him into such a state. You pursued the beast to its cavern and must now face it down.
The Corsair captain is the true prize. Pursued for years across all of Middle-earth, cornered now in Evendim among the ruins and among the tomb-raiders. Mete out the final vengeance.
<u>Grievances</u>\n\qI will hear this complaint, but not at my throne. I will go among the people.\q
<u>The Stone of Wyrgende</u>\n\qI have business in Snowbourn, but first I would see Wyrgende's Stone. Will I next fall to the crone's curse?\q

<u>The Great Goblin in Exile</u>\n\qA horde of goblins has departed Goblin-town, and wrought chaos in its path. We have followed, and come to their new hiding place. Now we have them cornered. It is time we found out what is going on here!\q

<u>Revenge of the Great Goblin</u>\n\qThe Great Goblin's forces are approaching and the Warlord's host lies in wait. Battle will soon erupt. All we can do now is watch and hope they fall upon each other's spears.\q
<u>The Hidden Chamber</u>\n\qForgive the mess, my friend! I had only been cleaning for a short time when I found… well, you will see!\q
<u>Night Falls on Meduseld</u>\n\qMy uncle Théoden will listen to me and put right the situation with Reeve Fastred. He is still King in Rohan.\q

<u>An Unexpected Summons</u>\n\qAs days pass with no sign of the cold-drake, Vethúg Wintermind, King Thorin III Stonehelm has grown impatient and seeks to learn the truth of these matters. Unknown to the King under the Mountain, an unexpected return may prove a boon to Durin's Folk.\q

<u>The Path of Aearil</u>\n\qYrjänä revealed the location of a cave where Aearil, the captain of the Elf-ship Thoroval, had long ago taken refuge. The Lossoth seer, Saija, guides the heroes from the South in search of Narchuil....\q

<u>The Darkness Over Lebennin</u>\n\qNow fearing for the fate of the Corsairs, Daxamat, the brother of Jajax, recalls his dread in Dor-en-Ernil when he observed the meeting of the Scourge and a terrible man.\q
<u>Forest for the Trees</u>\n\qRepulsed by the destruction the White Hand and Núrzum have caused in the forest, the Ents of Balewood march to war.\q

<u>The Eldest House</u>\n\qWithin the deepest reaches of Gloomingtarn, the Angmarim of the Iron Crown have unwittingly discovered a long-forgotten passage rumoured to lead to the first house of Durin the Deathless.\q

<u>Messages from Lórien</u>\n\qMessages have come from Lothlórien, messages that cannot be ignored. My sons have returned from the Wild, and together they and a hero of Eriador must respond to these tidings with decisive action...\q

<u>The Sixteenth Hall</u>\n\qThe dread malady that spreads among the servants of the Enemy in Moria is strong in the Sixteenth Hall. Whatever nameless thing dwells there has entrapped many an Orc to its service, poisoning their minds and controlling their actions.\q\n
<u>Bustle in the Blue Theatre</u>\n\qAfter negotiating a performance in the legendary Blue Theatre, the Cloudyheads endeavour to finally take the stage.\q
You've been asked to trim back the branches of a group of huorns pillaging along the roads of the Cape of Umbar.
<u>The Moon Over Ambarûl</u>\n\qMy mother will be impressed by our successes when we arrive back at Iridír!\q

<u>Glinghant</u>\n\qGlinghant, the gardens of Annúminas -- once a place of great beauty, now overgrown and fallen into ruin. The stagnant waters of the gardens have become corrupted by the fell spirits of Angmar, and evil Men do their bidding....\q
<u>Beyond Living Memory</u>\n\qRest well. If you should dream, rue it not! The dreamless sleep holds no wisdom.\q

<u>A Place for Hobbits</u>\n\qIt is known as Bâr Thorenion, or the hidden house, for it is nearly that. Hidden and much abandoned. Nothing some rolled up sleeves and a little honest labour cannot set right!\q
<u>Welcome to Harwick</u>\n\qAldor Harding requests your presence, and you can only hope that he has heard of your diligent labours on behalf of Harwick.\q
<u>Urugarth</u>\n\qLying on the outskirts of Carn Dûm is the fortress of Urugarth, home to countless Orcs, goblins, and other curs of Angmar... the breeding grounds of Angmar's horde.\q
<u>Undermining Ushkútoz</u>\n\qDesperate to break a bloody stalemate in the War of Three Peaks, Agnar has devised a plan to infiltrate Ushkútoz and impair the defences of the forces of Gundabad.\q

<u>Instance: Parphád</u>\n\qLong have the ruins of Parphád remained closed to the inquisitive and invaders alike. Not content with this, invaders have breached the gates of the ruins and threaten the relics contained within. Ascbert has tasked you with preserving the relics and texts within, even if that effort means confronting the invaders.\q
<u>Deeper In</u>\n\qWell we've got to go back in now, that's how I figure it. Pipeweed and suspicious fellows! Now I want answers even more than I thought I wanted treasure.\q

<u>The Rite of Clúcath</u>\n\qThe free Hillmen of the Trév Gallorg have long been in conflict with many of their sister tribes. Now they prepare to again face the Trév Duvardain in the Rite of Clúcath, a ceremonial rite of judgement...\q
<u>A Meal in Cormallen</u>\n\qIt is so good to be here with you, old friends. And doing something so Hobbit-like as sharing a proper meal.\q
Brigands have overrun Gaervarad. You are tasked with defeating every last enemy amongst the ruins.

<u>World Behind and Home Ahead</u>\n\qWould you look at this. All of us here again, gathered round! At least as many of us as there could be. What I mean to say is, it wouldn't be so, if not for our friend here.\q

<u>The Mirror-halls of Lumul-nar</u>\n\qTo bring life back to the gardens of Moria, the Iron Garrison has crafted great mirrors and placed them upon the pinnacle of Zirakzigil. The light has failed, however, and the dwarves seek to learn why their mirrors do not reflect it as they once did.\q\n
<u>The Defence of Minas Tirith</u>\n\qThe War for Gondor begins as Sauron's armies march for Minas Tirith. Can the Men of Gondor master their fear before the Enemy claims the White City?\q
A vicious storm has driven a variety of creatures from the mountain. Snow-beasts have been pushed into caverns and represent a threat to the forces arrayed in Gundabad.
<u>Instance: Missing Friend</u>\n\qAs Oldheart's memory unfolds, you feel long, long years of loneliness fluttering away as a tiny bird hops about the grass, peeping and cheeping away.\q
<u>A Glimpse of Daylight</u>\n\qA small moment of peace has given Mizâdi time to speak with Amalíbi, to see the consequences of her decisions.\q
<u>The Witan</u>\n\qSkeptical of the King's state of mind, the Lords of the Eastemnet have gathered to decide how to defend their lands.\q

<u>Instance: A Troubling Report</u>\n\qScout Molkha has a troubling report to share: The Frost-bound Hobgoblins, the Angmarim, and the Drakes of the Frost-horde are negotiating alliances, and using fallen dwarves as bargaining chips.\q
<u>The Divided Loyalties of Glúrkub the Goblin</u>\n\qI remember how it all began....\q
<u>Hamât Renewed</u>\n\qMizâdi, Girhâzi, Rahâzi, Amalíbi, and Numûru have gathered outside Dun Shûma to discuss their victory and what fate awaits for Shagâna.\q
TBD…
<u>Instance: The Tipping Point</u>\n\qScout Klúso has an interesting report to share: Relations between the Orcs and hobgoblins may have finally reached a tipping point....\q

<u>Vile Tongues</u>\n\qWith the aid of Mithrandir and Gúldil, you have tracked the scroll-thief to the Old Archives. If he cannot be reached before unleashing the fell magicks bound to the scroll through the Enemy's sorcery, Minas Tirith may be undone from within.\q

<u>Instance: The Giant's Den</u>\n\qHórin believes the best course of action is to enter Thyrstáth on a diplomatic mission. Your aim is to prevent the ice-giants from also falling under the sway of Hrímil and her Frost-horde.\q
<u>Fate of the North</u>\n\qThe dwarves Rúzat, Agátur, and Náth take the pass from Misthallow to Ered Mithrin, unaware of what waits for them.\q

<u>Instance: A Clandestine Meeting</u>\n\qScout Kyrstig has an important report to share: a secret meeting between Loknashra and the leader of the Cult of Drugoth hints at their true motives in the region....\q
<u>The Warrior Found</u>\n\qThis is near the location where Vútro encountered the Weeping Warrior. Where then has he gone?\q

<u>Instance: The Secret Ritual</u>\n\qUgarad the Harbinger intends to perform a secret ritual to impart the strength of the Gauntlord Drugoth into Loknashra of the Frost-bound. You and Hórin must stop this ritual before it is too late!\q
<u>The Breaking of the Fellowship</u>\n\qSomething happened to our mutual friends: the signs of it are everywhere in the East Wall. But did the danger come from without their number... or within?\q
Helm's Deep Prototype - Gameplay Test

<u>Instance: The Warlord's Gambit</u>\n\qYou have reached the end of the Father's Path, and Warlord Dushtalbúk must be ahead. His reason for marching to the mountain's peak is about to be revealed....\q
<u>The First Promise</u>\n\qSkarháld is under attack! Karazgar seeks the fulfillment of his promise!\q

<u>The Battle of the Deep-way</u>\n\qBori's failed raid upon Zabadgathol has brought the wrath of the Orcs down upon the dwarves. The encampment at the Deep-way faces a terrible onslaught from Mazog's horde. Are the Longbeards strong enough to face the challenge?\q
<u>The Grim Southron</u>\n\qThe Nazgûl lurk in the shadows of Middle-earth, lurking in an unseen realm from which they stalk forth to terrorize the land at the behest of their master Sauron.\q

<u>The Grim Southron</u>\n\qSince your battle with the Grim Southron, you have felt a dark chill settling upon you. It has drawn you to this place, close to the shadows. Here you will face the terror that has called to you in your sleeping hours - a nightmare made real.\q
<u>Whispers of the Forge</u>\n\qAyaluk's plan is set in motion...\q

<u>The Grim Southron</u>\n\qSince your battle with the Grim Southron, you have felt a dark chill settling upon you. It has drawn you to this place, close to the shadows. Here you will face the terror that has called to you in your sleeping hours - a nightmare made real.\q

<u>The Grim Southron</u>\n\qSince your battle with the Grim Southron, you have felt a dark chill settling upon you. It has drawn you to this place, close to the shadows. Here you will face the terror that has called to you in your sleeping hours - a nightmare made real.\q

<u>The Grim Southron</u>\n\qSince your battle with the Grim Southron, you have felt a dark chill settling upon you. It has drawn you to this place, close to the shadows. Here you will face the terror that has called to you in your sleeping hours - a nightmare made real.\q

<u>The Grim Southron</u>\n\qSince your battle with the Grim Southron, you have felt a dark chill settling upon you. It has drawn you to this place, close to the shadows. Here you will face the terror that has called to you in your sleeping hours - a nightmare made real.\q

<u>Throne of the Dread Terror</u>\n\qThe Enemy's grip tightens on the defenders of Gondor as Gothmog seizes control of the armies of Mordor. Marching from the gates of Osgiliath, foes pour into the Pelennor Fields with a renewed vigour. In the wake of the Witch-king's defeat, vile sorcery looms over the field as the most powerful allies of the Dread Terror are summoned forth. If Gothmog spoke true of the fate he shares with Golodir, can victory yet be found?\q

<u>The Battle Before the Rammas Deluon</u>\n\qThe might of Angmar rallies to defeat the Trév Gallorg. Reinforcements from Urugarth and Carn Dûm march through the swamp of Malenhad towards Rammas Deluon. It falls to the Champions of Eriador to stop them....\q

<u>The Grim Southron</u>\n\qSince your battle with the Grim Southron, you have felt a dark chill settling upon you. It has drawn you to this place, close to the shadows. Here you will face the terror that has called to you in your sleeping hours - a nightmare made real.\q

<u>The Grim Southron</u>\n\qSince your battle with the Grim Southron, you have felt a dark chill settling upon you. It has drawn you to this place, close to the shadows. Here you will face the terror that has called to you in your sleeping hours - a nightmare made real.\q

The hobbits in Hoarhallow are ever a thorn in the side of the forces at Gramsfoot. Foolish little creatures that serve as a good source of food, but their pointy weapons do more damage that the trouble they are usually worth. An easy way to destroy the village might be to destroy their food stores since they seem to eat... a lot.

<u>The Grim Southron</u>\n\qSince your battle with the Grim Southron, you have felt a dark chill settling upon you. It has drawn you to this place, close to the shadows. Here you will face the terror that has called to you in your sleeping hours - a nightmare made real.\q
Rising into the Grey Mountains above the Greylin, Grálinvarth overlooks Elderslade and might prove a valuable foothold in the War of Three Peaks.

<u>Father of our Lament</u>\n\qThe oath of Fernvael, father of Cadelhin, binds the shades of the Lich Bluffs to their earthly tombs. The only hope remaining for these poor spirits is the defeat of their dark ruler….\q

Rising into the Grey Mountains above the Greylin, Grálinvarth overlooks Elderslade. However, a recent ambush by dragon-kind of the Frost-horde threatens the dwarves keeping watch from this valuable foothold.

Rising into the Grey Mountains above the Greylin, Grálinvarth overlooks Elderslade. After a bloody battle, Gorgar's forces have overrun the foothold and gained a significant foothold deep within the territory of the dwarves.

<u>A Guardian's Duty</u>\n\qThe town of Trestlebridge is under siege by Orcs out of Angmar. One of the guardians of Trestlebridge, Severin Wheeler, has assembled the townsfolk and their southern allies to defend the town against the marauding hordes....\q

<u>The Battle of the Way of Smiths</u>\n\qWith the revelation of Zigilburk, Mazog knows that the Heart of Fire has been discovered and seeks to claim the forge for his own. In the Way of Smiths, the dwarves must stem the flood of darkness and prevent the Heart of Fire from falling to the Orcs.\q
<u>The Daring Strike, Dawn</u>\n\qDawn came swiftly on the twenty-fifth of February, as my Prince prepared to conduct his daring strike.\q
<u>The Orcs Attack</u>\n\qWynmar and his men brace for an Orc attack that threatens to be more dire than the earlier encounter on the hill, a mere taste of what is to come....\q
<u>Stanric's Stand</u>\n\qStanric, the leader of Stangard, grows inspired by the changes you have brought about for this crippled settlement.\q

<u>The Ford of Bruinen</u>\n\qThe forces of evil have marched up to the bank of the Bruinen and waited for the sign to attack. Dark clouds roll in as a great storm approaches. If the Ford falls, Rivendell shall not be far behind it. The battle is nearly upon you....\q

<u>The Prisoner of Sammath Baul</u>\n\qIn Sammath Baul, the Elf-lord Laerdan was tormented, both in body and mind. Even Elves can only endure for so long, though Laerdan resisted to the last. When pain alone proved ineffective, Amarthiel turned to deception....\q
<u>The Battle of the Ford, Sunset</u>\n\qOur prince was trapped in the middle of the river Isen. We had to fight through the line of uruks to reach him!\q
<u>A Secret Chamber</u>\n\qAn ancient chamber, kept secret for thousands of years, has been discovered by our intrepid explorers. Perhaps it was kept secret for a reason.\q

<u>The Fate of Laerdan</u>\n\qLaerdan's delusion is complete. Once Narchuil is restored, he will give it to Amarthiel, hoping to bring back his daughter. In folly, he will doom Eriador to fall beneath the Shadows of Angmar....\q
<u>Hilltop Assault</u>\n\qThe Golden Host is preparing to bring the first act of their invasion on Mirkwood to a close with an all-out assault upon the hill overlooking the landing.\q

<u>Emissary of the White-hand</u>\n\qIn the South, Saruman builds his strength at Isengard. Despite past conflicts with Angmar, he has sent an emissary to Minas Caul to forge an alliance between the White Hand and the Iron Crown...\q

<u>The Tourney Field: Mounted Combat Tutorial</u>\n\nYou have been granted a war-steed of prized Rohirrim stock. Now you must master your steed on the Tourney fields of Harwick, under the tutelage of the aged Rohirrim instructor, Seoca.\q

<u>Sâri-surma</u>\n\qAn evil presence has descended upon the Ice Bay of Forochel, inhabiting a large glacial iceberg. Having sent several hunters to defeat the evil, the Lossoth have asked you to help them destroy this evil once and for all....\q
<u>Assault on Rath Teraig</u>\n\qThe combined forces of Lord Dwalin of Thorin's Hall and Dorongúr Whitethorn of Duillond prepare to march upon the goblin-army at Rath Teraig....\q

<u>The Madness of Vanyalos</u>\nAfter days secluded in her chambers, Lady Vanyalos has left them in a troubled state, seemingly heedless of her path. Down from her hill, down out of Imloth Melui, down to the high banks of the River Anduin where fair flowers nod in the breeze and danger lurks all around.

<u>The Fading of the Forests</u>\n\qThe trees of this grove are beautiful and perfect. It is absurd for them to sit idle when they could be put to such good use by the woodworkers of Iridír. Let us talk some sense into this Shanthar of Arwáth.\q
<u>Shadows In Jirush</u>\n\qThe fortress sleeps, but it sleeps with an eye open. We must take care not to wake it too soon.\q
<u>Unravelling the Thread</u>\n\qStrider and the Rangers pursue their fallen brother Amdir to the Blackwolds' camp, but not all is as it seems....\q

<u>A Defence in the Darkness</u>\n\qIn the woods near Lin Giliath, a broken refuge of the Elves, Stone-trolls have gotten the better of a small host who marched to the defence of their haven. Their fate stands upon a precarious edge, but your arrival has brought them hope when their doom was nigh.\q
<u>A Message in Mithril</u>\n\qThe Longbeards are under attack! We must come to their aid!\q

<u>The Battle for Erebor</u>\n\qThe Easterlings in the North are dismayed by the news of defeats in the South, and the time has come to break the siege of Erebor. However, Sauron's champions await you at the gateway to the Lonely Mountain....\q
<u>Fangorn's Edge</u>\n\qYou have found my lumber-camp. Very impressive. Few know of its existence. Do you think you can stop the tide of progress? The war will continue. The time of Man is over.\q
<u>The Adventures of Jajax and Daxamat</u>\n\qMy brother Dax and I returned at last to Umbar Baharbêl, the City of Sails.\q
<u>A Long Way From Gondor</u>\n\qIt was in the days of June that my father Denethor, the Steward of Gondor, called his sons to the White Tower...\q
<u>Assault on Clovengap</u>\n\qAh, this is the way to Akrakír, the Ladder Gardens of Gundabad! They were renowned for their beauty; let us hope they have not been despoiled.\q
<u>A Journey by Boat</u>\n\qThe river Anduin is as familiar to me as my own shadow, but it is still a journey of some days. We must stop here for the night.\q

<u>Facing Fears</u>\n\qIngmar, my husband, seeks to persuade his father to allow him to lead a force of men against the Orcs who now threaten us, despite Théoden King's ban. I hope his grandmother, Lady Góda, may bring wisdom to the debate....\q
<u>A Promise Kept</u>\n\qThis must be Karazgar's doing! We have to hurry!\q

<u>The Riders Four</u>\n\qWe were dispatched by Lord Éomer to harry the Orcs roving the plains of the Mark, but what we discovered in the Brown Lands was truly terrifying. Now we ride through the Eastemnet on our way to Edoras, warning the Reeves of the Easterling horde marching upon them....\q
<u>Hunter's Hunted</u>\n\qWithin the halls of Dahâl Huliz, the gladiators make their home. Rothog has asked that you question Shaidal.\q
The people of Iridír wish to prepare a meal and are in need of chicken eggs.
<u>Passage of the Marshes</u>\n\qThe foetid swamplands stretch in all directions. Did Frodo come this way...?\q
Upon the dwarf-ruins of Zarkul-sulûn, a deadly two-headed troll waits for those foolish enough to challenge their claim….
Upon the dwarf-ruins of Zarkul-sulûn, a band of trolls has claimed the Torrent-spires….
Upon the dwarf-ruins of Zarkul-sulûn, bats have descended onto the Torrent-spires in the darkness of the night….
Ice-giants have plundered treasures from deep within Gundabad….

<u>Depths of Mâkhda Khorbo</u>\n\qAfter the confrontation in the Citadel of Winds, the ship bearing Azagath, Belondor, and Nakási, Reaper of the Waves sails north-west into the shadow cast by the Mâkhda Khorbo. Pursuing the trio, you enter the depths of a long-hidden cavern leading through dank, twisting passages ending at an iron-wrought gate. The smells of the sea, iron, and ash assail you as you press deeper beneath the land and closer to the remnants of the temple ruins.\q
<u>Heirloom of the Earth-kin</u>\n\qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted Earth-kin pouch have led you to an Ent, a shepherd of the trees, and the story he has to tell....\q

<u>Ghashan-kútot, the Halls of Black Lore</u>\n\qLong ago, this was a great hall of Númenórean wisdom and learning. A shining beacon high in the Moon-lit City. Until it was set to the torch by the Witch-king, and from the ashes, an endless repository of sorceries and secrets; the blackest knowledge. Here, I continue my life's work.\q
Frost-horde Emissaries have begun to lend aid to ice-giants in a mountain pass leading towards an entrance in Gundabad….
<u>Defence at the Carrock</u>\n\qIn the morning mist, shadows came to the Carrock. As they singed the horizon, my only thought was to protect the sacred rock with my life.\q
<u>Grimslade Will Burn</u>\n\qThe half-orc prisoner, terrified of burning along with Grimslade, has disclosed a planned attack by the servants of Saruman.\q
<u>The Battle for Dol Amroth</u>\n\qCorsairs from the south have taken the fortress city of Dol Amroth. Together with the swan-knights, you must aid in recapturing it.\q

<u>The Stars' Favour</u>\n\qBelieving the stars' favour might herald an auspicious end to the Iron Garrison's efforts to reclaim Khazad-dûm, Byrski Hardprow has enlisted your aid for an expedition onto the Mirrormere to seek out Durin's Crown...\q
<u>Extermination of Gorogrod</u>
<u>The Moot</u>\n\qPip and I had escaped into Fangorn Forest, but we did not know if we would find safety under the eaves...\q
Siege engines have been discovered in an Ekhamâti camp. Destroy them.
<u>Othrongroth</u>\n\qOthrongroth, the Great Barrow, the oldest and largest of the Edain mounds within the Barrow-downs... and home to some of the most terrifying servants of the Witch-king.\q

<u>Hammer of the Underworld</u>\n\qThe defenders of Gondor struggle to hold the line as Grond, the great ram of the Enemy, crawls towards the gates of Minas Tirith. Grond must be destroyed before it can serve its vile purpose!\q

<u>The Bells of Dale</u>\n\qAid will not come to the Men of Gondor from the North, for in these last days of the Third Age, war has come to the foot of Erebor. Easterlings answering the call of the Dark Lord prepare to besiege Dale and the Lonely Mountain. The only comfort is that Mordor's host will also be bereft of these forces.\q

<u>A Spear at the Southern March</u>\n\qBrigands and half-orcs from the south have been pressing upon the Greenway as of late, threatening the good folk of Bree-town. You have been enlisted to join the line of Wardens who march against these foes, for brigands possess a chaotic nature, and will not stand against such organized defence.\q

<u>The Secrets of Sundergrót</u>\n\qThe Dwarves, Rúzat, Agátur, and Náth have stumbled upon a secret meeting between Rákhrum, Goblin Overseer of Sundergrót, and Gúrbarash, The Gundabad Hill-troll Chief.\q
<u>The Voice of the Dragon</u>\n\qAll of you know why we are here. This is a sacred place, a dwarf place. This is Gundabad!\q
<u>The Last Greymaul</u>\n\qThe two of you must reach the peak!\q

<u>Isle of Storms</u>: A great winged terror known to the people of Umbar as a Roc has been seen attacking ships sailing off the Cape of Umbar, swamping them with terrible winds and plucking the hapless crew out of the water.

The lords of Umbar have requested that you find the nesting place of this monstrous bird and drive it from the Shield Isles.

The Roc is believed to be roosting upon a deserted isle in the far reaches of the archipelago, once a haunt for pirates and brigands. Rumours say that they were driven out by strange and monstrous creatures, far greater in size than any beast should be....

<u>Glade of the Three Merry-makers</u>\n\qRhûd-pulo-Drât, a wise Drúadan, leads you to a sacred grove of Púkel-men statues in order to ward away the mysterious beasts that invade the Drúadan Forest.\q

<u>Herald of the Rohirrim</u>\n\qA brave herald of the Rohirrim has come to stave off battle with the Dunlendings, but one faction is bent upon killing him before he can parley with the brenin of the other clans.\q

<u>Eithel Gwaur, the Filth-well</u>\n\qAt the source of the Morgulduin lies the Eithel Gwaur. It is the prison of Rauniel, the River Maiden, who seeks her freedom as she beckons you ever further into this watery chamber.\q

<u>Ost Dunhoth</u>\n\qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition….\q
<u>A Caper On Honeymead Lane</u>\n\qWe have to get that present back before Angelica opens it! Don't let anyone see you!\q
<u>A Very Boffin House-warming</u>\n\qIt took some time getting here, but all's well that ends well, I suppose. At last Angelica will have her party!\q
<u>Lair of the Beast</u>\n\qTwo ships are docked in this hidden harbour. Are their captains, my targets, to be found within?\q
<u>Threat of a Good Punch</u>\n\qProve it was no mistake for Derwent Bindweed to seek the aid of a good Brawler, or I will teach you nothing....\q
<u>Thikil-gundu, the Steel Keep</u>\n\qThe ruined crafting halls of Stormwall keep a fiery secret, slumbering in the shadows...\q

<u>The Old Woman of the Mountain</u>\n\qGwyllion, the Old Woman of the Mountain, in service to Saruman the White has brought terror to the herdsmen of the Uch-lûth. Saeradan now seeks to bring her reign of terror to an end.\q

<u>Dark Delvings</u>\n\qIn the deepest delvings of Moria dwell nameless things which shun the light and feed on the darkness. The Elves of Lórien strive to constrain the vile creatures, but led by the evil Gurvand, they may be too strong to hold back forever....\q\n
<u>Finding Meneldor</u>\n\qThe search for the great eagle Meneldor has brought you to a large spider cave in the Wailing Hills, a dwelling most perilous for a denizen of the skies.\q

<u>The Deeping Wall</u>\n\qThe dike has been overrun. Now, the full weight of Saruman's army prepares to crash down upon the valiant defenders upon the ramparts of the Deeping Wall. The wall must stand or the fortress will surely fall.\q

<u>The Flickering Flame</u>\n\qSpurred by the call of the Dark Lord, the goblins of the Misty Mountains have sent an emissary to Minas Maur to treat with the Iron Crown. If these two forces unite, there may be no stopping Angmar from sweeping through Eriador...\q

<u>The Battle in the Tower</u>\n\qThe time has come for the last assault upon the fortress of Dol Guldur. The fighting begins even as a smaller force enters the citadel in secret, prepared to face their final foe...\q
Amon Firn is occupied by half-orcs. Their leader must be somewhere amongst the ruins. Defeat him!
<u>Borangos The Horror</u>\n\qNargroth, realm of Borangos, entrenched with otherworldly fires, houses more mysteries than the answers in which Isnír seeks.\q
<u>Breaking the Back of the Boar</u>\n\qPakon, the Chieftain of the Maldorr Orcs has long plotted revenge against Folca's line. If not stopped, he will have his long-sought vengeance.\q
<u>The Melee in the Square</u>\n\qDerwent Bindweed has moved from one dangerous town to one that might be even more dangerous! He needs a Brawler to help him, though he might not know it....\q
<u>Pit-fighter</u>\n\qThe arena of Thorzhaf is home to a pit-fighting tournament, where the greatest warriors battle for fame and power.\q
The bridge of Caranost is overrun. Battle the enemy forces back to relieve the threat against Sírlond.
<u>Shanties in the Storm</u>\n\qAs a storm batters Bree-town, Barliman Butterbur looks to you and your gifts for storytelling and song to raise the spirits of his customers in the Prancing Pony....\q

<u>Escape from Rushdurinul</u>\n\qIssuriel listened to the tale of your adventure along the Secret Road into Rushdurinul, where the Orc-king Mazog was seized by the dwarves... but there was more to the story, and now she waits for you to tell it.\q
