<u>Homestead Defence</u>\n\qMy son awaits at my homestead to provide my messenger the ledger that contains all of my records. I must have this to prepare for the auction in the village.\q

<u>Thief-taker's Bane</u>\n\qA simple quest to recover ancient Dúnedain relics from the hands of the grave-robbers who stole them has gone terribly awry. The thieves will not allow the Rangers and their allies to take their treasures from them so easily....\q
<u>A Reasonable Request</u>\n\qWynmar, struck by the beauty of Noriel, wishes to look upon the Elf one last time before accepting his people's banishment from Thinglad by its Elf-sentinels.\q
<u>Those Who Came Before</u>\n\qYou feel a strong sort of tug to investigate the Bridge of Khazad-dûm once more....\q

<u>The Lady's Champion</u>\n\qBrigands out of the Stonedeans plot to murder Lady Lúfa, the young wife of Thane Ordlac of Oserley. The Thane has devised a plan of his own that appears to heartlessly use his wife as bait for the trap....\q

<u>Instance: Storm on the Withered Heath</u>\n\qThe barren, burnt expanse of the Withered Heath is deceptive in appearing empty. After centuries untouched by dwarves, it is rich in resources, history, and peril.\q

<u>Return to Azanarukâr</u>\n\qIn the depths of Azanarukâr, the sorceries of Gorothúl have set into motion an evil that cannot be ignored. You have come with Magor into the dark reaches, and must end this threat before it is too late.\q

<u>The Unmarked Trail</u>\n\qAn ancient evil, a corruption of the very nature of Middle-earth, threatens to spread its vile poison throughout the Trollshaws. This evil must be thwarted before it can be brought to bear against the hidden vale of Rivendell.\q
<u>The Lone Dwarf</u>\n\qI have given those two long enough. If they failed, that is on them. The time has come to deal with the Jangovar menace. The axes of dwarves shall be upon them!\q
The enemies of Urush Dâr use the poison glands of the usan-kûni on their blades. We must do our best to reduce this practice.
<u>The Weeping Warrior</u>\n\qBryn, prince of Dale, has fled into the wilds. His mind still seeks out answers in these recent turbulent times that have befallen the Dale-lands.\q

<u>The Funeral in Forlaw</u>\n\qThe people of Forlaw gather to mourn those lost in the battle of Scylfig. Most notably, their champion, Thrymm Red-beard... and with him they bury any hope of surviving this war.\q
Within Valdhellir, the most vicious Wargs of Elderslade dwell in darkness. There, even the most skilled of hunters must tread with care lest they become the hunted.
DNT
Within Valdhellir, the most vicious Wargs of Elderslade dwell in darkness surrounded by countless skulls and other grisly trophies.
Within Valdhellir, the most vicious Wargs of Elderslade dwell in darkness. Drauglok, the leader of this terrible pack, poses a great threat to the Dwarves of Durin's Folk.

<u>The Reeve of Entwash Vale</u>\n\qWe have arrived at Eaworth, capital of the Entwash Vale, bringing word of a vast Easterling horde invading from the north, but I fear that word has come too late, for Orcs are encamped upon Eaworth's threshold. I only hope that we can convince Reeve Ingbert of the greater threat facing the whole of Rohan....\q
<u>All that Remains</u>\n\qYou have escorted Inhild to the home of Randgar, offering her the chance to have closure regarding the death of the man she once loved.\q

<u>The Fate of the Ectheldur</u>\n\qLong ago a great ship of Annúminas, the Ectheldur, sank beneath the waters of Lake Evendim, and both its storied history and the precious artifact it housed were lost to the Dúnedain. Now, a band of tomb-robbers out of the South seek for where the Ectheldur came to rest, hoping to pillage it for their own gain....\q
<u>Gauntlet in Dol Guldur</u>

<u>Fornost</u>\n\qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q
Goblin-town has long been a thorn in the side of the free peoples in Rhovanion. Once again, the goblin horde inside stirs….
Goblin-town has long been a thorn in the side of the free peoples in Rhovanion. Once again, the goblin horde inside stirs….
Bree-land farmer Robb Thornley is recovering after being captured and tortured by marauding Orcs. Battered and beaten, Robb Thornley wants retribution.
The watch post of Bizar-atrâd, in the Grey Mountains, has been taken over by Frost-bound Hobgoblins….

<u>Corruption's Cost</u>\n\qThe Angmarim sorceress Brágha Fellwinder has discovered a way to enhance the power, ferocity, and madness of the deadly Warg. She must be stopped before she is able to pass on this knowledge or expand her capabilities.\q

<u>The Northcotton Farm</u>\n\qSeveral hobbits have disappeared recently in the vicinity of the Northcotton Farm. It was abandoned years ago, but something stirs within its grounds and a faint, sweet aroma wafts over the walls....\q
The watch post of Bizar-atrâd, in the Grey Mountains, has been ambushed by a horde of dragon-kind….
The Orkish commander of Tharbad still resides within that tower. You must make your way up to find his lair and defeat him.
<u>Thrymm's Farm</u>\n\qThrymm's Farm is on the verge of recovery, but their efforts may be for nothing should the Warg-riders return.\q
<u>A Prisoner to Stangard</u>\n\qYou have taken the Uruk-hai vandal to Stangard, where Gadda has brought him before Stanric and Sithric to await his judgement.\q
<u>Head of the Fallen Beast</u>\n\qIn an attempt to cleanse the Pelennor Fields, I have asked for you and Éomer to destroy the corpse of the Witch-king's fell-beast.\q
The waters of the Bruinen prevented the Black Riders from entering Rivendell, but nothing has been heard of them since. Their fate remains yet to be seen.

<u>Thikil-gundu</u>\n\qAfter the great cold-drake, Vethúg Wintermind, was defeated at Erebor, it was believed that Thikil-gundu would at last be reclaimed. Unbeknownst to the Longbeards and Zhélruka, Karazgar, the Weeping Warrior, has claimed the Steel Keep and subjugated the wills of the Orcs and dragon-kind dwelling within its frozen halls. What has become of Nori's expedition in that ancient dwarf keep?\q
Within the courtyard of Caranost, an Orc warlord drives his forces into a frenzy. It is time to put his menace to an end.

Very little information has gleaned about the Black Riders' locations, so your party looks to the Great Eagles for possible answers. However, the dangers that stalk Eregion might affect your endeavors….
<u>Trouble in Tuckborough</u>\n\qBrigands and goblins are laying siege to the Great Smials. Food supplies are low, and time is running short....\q
As your party climbs the slopes of the Redhorn, the twins grow silent and conversation comes to a standstill. Only the howling wind fills the air now.

<u>Mazog</u>\n\qPride oft heralds woe, it is said. With the power of the mithril axe Zigilburk at hand, will pride overthrow the dwarves who seek to reclaim Moria, or will it fuel the fire that burns within them to drive forth Mazog from Zabadgathol at last?\q
Uruks besiege ruins across the land, and an organized attack is too dangerous given the forces available in the region. A task to help reduce the threat falls to you.
<u>A Commanding Knock</u>\n\qLoud noises from outside the Crossing-hall require Borhador to seek your aid and quell his fear of an Orkish invasion.\q
The uneventful trip through the Dimrill Dale does not seem to shake the twins' apprehension, nor does the sight of the river Nimrodel.
<u>Balakhôr the Scourge</u>\n\qBalakhôr has asked that I treat with him on the deck of his flagship, but can he be trusted?\q
<u>A Reunion Bittersweet</u>\n\qIn the hopes of securing peace for Lhan Garan, Eluna has arranged a meeting with Ardhun....\q
Though your party made haste towards northern Lórien, the sight that greets you at Talan Revail is anything but encouraging.

<u>A Secret Club</u>\n\qSomething evil is afoot in the Shire. Brigands in the employ of someone calling himself the Chief have overrun the town of Dwaling. Ponto Oats intends to give the Chief's enforcer in Dwaling second thoughts about trifling with the Shire-folk.\q
<u>Hatred of Bear and Man</u>\n\qOfolmóth has brought this fate upon himself, but it does not make our duty of bringing him to justice any easier.\q
Atop the ruins of Caranost, a vile foe awaits you. Can you best this menace, or will you succumb to the strength of the enemy?
<u>Even In Darkness</u>\n\qWe must storm the Night-jewel and put an end to Balakhôr and the threat of Umbar!\q
<u>Down Payment</u>\n\qYou find the house that was purchased is not very well kept, and seems to have unwanted occupants....\q

<u>In Defence of Eaworth</u>\n\qAgainst my wishes, my son Ingmar has taken to the field against the Orcs of Maustazg. He thinks of the glory victory would bring him, but not the grief it would bring to those who love him should he perish....\q

<u>The Flickering Flame</u>\n\qMany are the Hillmen of Angmar who have chosen to serve the Iron Crown. Now they seek further favour from their dark masters by sending an emissary to Minas Agar. If the Hillmen cannot be dissuaded, Eriador will surely fall...\q
<u>The Blooms of Anarlossë</u>\n\qListen to me now, and I will tell you of days long ago, when my brother and I walked among the flowers of yesteryear in the lands of Men....\q
<u>Celebration of Victory</u>\n\qDespite Reeve Fríthild's misgivings with the victory at Bardh-dorám, Thane Ordlac has prompted her to hold a celebration feast....\q
Jackals in the furrows scavenge from the dead. It is their nature, but the defiling of fallen allies the coalition cannot abide.

<u>The Court of Seregost</u>\n\qDeep in the heart of Seregost, Lhaereth the Stained prepares to unleash a second Great Plague upon the realms of Men. Any hope of thwarting her lies on the intrepid few, led by Rangers Rhadrog and Faeron, who have gained entry to her doorless keep.\q
<u>An Audience with the Hall-father</u>\n\qKhôltekh has taken you into his trust, for now. He's asked you to accompany him to his house to speak more about his plans for Umbar.\q

<u>The Battle of Rhunendin</u>\n\qThere is a chance to bring security to Aughaire, for at least a little while, but it will require courage of the greatest magnitude. The armies of Angmar must be met upon their own land... they must be defeated at Rhunendin....\q
Gond Orchal has been corrupted by a gaunt-lord who is raising Wights from the various tombs. This evil must be defeated.

<u>The Road to Dunharrow</u>\n\qUpon the plains of the Firienfeld at Dunharrow, the people of Kingstead have at last found shelter. Yet at the edge of the Dimholt, a sudden wave of dread flows over Éowyn and her people.\q
Upon the peaks of Gundabad, the Angmarim breed bats for nefarious purposes….
TBD…
The old Arnorian watch-tower of Sutwarden has attracted many foes of the Freepeoples who wish to spy upon the Bree-fields.

For the forgeworkers who wish only to escape hard labour and the lash, there is but one hope. In this secret meeting with the Easterlings, they must somehow bargain safe passage far from cruel Mordor and vengeful Gondor and all they have ever known.
Temámir Dwarves have been excavating a cave on the Cape of Umbar looking for precious stones, but the cave proved too weak. Help the dwarves escape the cave-in!
Acquire healthy boar slabs for a chef to make into his famous bacon recipe for the hungry people of Urmâkh.

<u>The Hunter's Path</u>\n\qA terrible and vicious wolf called Yellowfang stalks through the Old Forest, often ambushing travellers upon the Great East Road. The accomplished huntress Gytha Lainey is resolved to ridding the Forest of this savage threat....\q

<u>Vengeance of the Fallen</u>\n\qIn a desperate bid to rid the Wastes of two terrible foes, Faramir, son of Ondoher, has devised a ruse to set the Wainriders of old against the merciless Black Númenórean, Burudagath the Bloodletter.\q

<u>A Cornered Foe</u>\n\qGollum has been cornered by a cunning Orc-commander from Dol Guldur. Should he be captured, his knowledge of the Ring and the Company entrusted with it will be laid bare to the Enemy.\q
<u>Aldburg Convenes</u>\n\qThane Arcil and Éothain have gathered in the Mead Hall of Aldburg to state their cases and weigh the options that will afford the most benefit to Aldburg.\q
TBD…

<u>Broken Alliance</u>\n\qAfter learning of a plot by Sharkey's Men to forge an alliance with the Orcs encroaching into the northern Bree-fields, the Ranger Saeradan sets into motion a plan to break the alliance before it can be established....\q

<u>The First Assault</u>\n\qSensing weakness in the humble crofting settlement of Walstow, the Orcs of Mordor have poured forth from the East Wall in hopes of claiming part of the Sutcrofts for their dark master.\q
<u>The Gift of Greenleaves</u>\n\qMy story begins not long ago, at the Elven ruins of Rhosgobel.\q
<u>The Speech of Animals</u>\n\qOoooh, I do not like this creepy forest, but I will show you where I saw that great beast of a bear!\q
<u>The Eagles Are Coming!</u>\n\qGwaihir the Windlord and his noble subjects have come to the aid of the Host of the West!\q
<u>A Parting</u>\n\qLet there be an end to this delay. Farewells are never easy, are they?\q
<u>The Precious, At Last</u>\n\qGollum caught up to us on the slope of Mount Doom, and Sam stayed behind to deal with him while I entered the Mountain, eager to be rid of the Ring.\q

<u>Taking a Stand</u>\n\qThéodred's scouts are a brave lot, but I am uncertain that facing the combined might of the Ox-clan and the Dragon-clan is the wisest course of action. Perhaps with a hero's aid, they may indeed stave off the storm blowing south to Rohan....\q
<u>Long Memories</u>\n\qRemain alert for anything that might threaten the safety of Tornhad and its people.\q

<u>Barad Guldur</u>\n\qBarad Guldur is the chief tower of Dol Guldur. From here, the Necromancer once viewed Greenwood the Great. Now the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur forays from this perch in search of the Company of the Ring....\q
<u>The Lasting Friendship</u>\n\qWe agreed to help Ravaedron with his latest task, but he has been taking his time with it, has he not?\q

<u>Memories of the Last Alliance</u>\n\qHoping to raise the spirits of the Host of the West, Elladan and Elrohir have offered to tell the tale of a great victory over the Enemy at the end of the Second Age.\q

<u>The Empty Passage</u>\n\qThe Heart of Fire, the great forging room where Durin's Axe was birthed was lost in ages past, but the discovery of the Way of Smiths would bring fresh hope to those who seek to reclaim the glory of Khazad-dûm....\q
DNT

<u>The Fires of Smaug</u>\n\qThe Dwarves of Erebor wish to send forth ravens with news of the Battle of Dale and to request aid, but the Easterlings have constructed a device of great evil to smoke the dwarves out of the Lonely Mountain....\q
<u>Flight of the TBD</u>\n\qNone seem to know what befell Hármelak or Khôltekh during the uprising. We may never know.\q
<u>A Mending</u>\n\qWe walked toward the setting sun, but our progress was slow.\q
<u>The Forgotten Lords</u>\n\qWithin the Dead City of Minas Morgul, a forgotten chamber of the Witch-king has opened. What lies within the Fiend-house of Roz Dagalur, none can say.\q
<u>A Hard-earned Meal</u>\n\qGladion and his wife Limril have invited you to join them for a family meal, but Gladion's brother Fuirion has not yet arrived.\q
<u>The Raiding Party</u>\n\qHuneric, Lord of the Thíuda, has noticed the Enemy forces gathering at Mokh Darga and wishes to halt their raid upon Adambel before it begins.\q
Kergrim to the far north-west in Tûkurdul near Ashâgir ransacked a shipment from the west. They took the driver and the contents of his haul with them.
<u>A Night for Ghost Stories</u>\n\qYou simply must celebrate the spirit of the scary season with us!\q
<u>The Haunting of Wistmead</u>\n\qThese letters have gone undelivered for so long. Can it be they may hold the answers you seek?\q
<u>None But One</u>\n\qOh, I do not like this spooky forest, not one bit! Let's see about this spectre and get out of here as quick as we can!\q

<u>The Dome of Stars</u>\n\qOn the eve of Sauron's assault against Minas Tirith, ships of Umbar sail up-river to the White City. Meanwhile, atop the Dome of Stars, the Black Blade of Lebennin casts a dark shadow over Osgiliath and the host of Minas Morgul below. If his spirit cannot be banished to Mordor before uncovering Aragorn's gambit, it could spell doom for all of Middle-earth.\q

<u>The Forgotten Treasury</u>\n\qMany ancient halls lie hidden beneath ages of ruin within the walls of Moria. The dwarves seek to recover and protect their treasures of old, while the Orcs seek to exploit them. Soon, the Forgotten Treasury may become a battleground of terrible proportions....\q
<u>Instance: Lost in Fangorn</u>\n\qThe Ent Baillas wishes to impart a memory upon you, for something has piqued the interest of this sleepy, tree-ish creature.\q

<u>Mordrambor</u>\n\qThe time has come. Angered by Mordrambor's treacherous betrayal of Laerdan, the Ranger Calenglad is determined to confront the Black Númenórean and learn where Narchuil, the ring of Amarthiel, resides. . . .\q

<u>The Meaning of Alliance</u>\n\qThe people of Galtrev have formed an alliance with the White Hand, for Isengard has vowed friendship in return for assistance in the war effort. But the people left behind in the presence of the servants of Saruman are little more than slaves in this new era....\q
<u>A Lock with No Key</u>\n\qKhôltekh has asked you to accompany him back to his Umbari manor, so he can think clearly about the riddle of the key to Dâr Sêkhta.\q

<u>A Scar of Battle</u>\n\qThe Zhélruka revealed that Vethúg Wintermind carved a great cleft through the Grey Mountains as he fell wounded from battle. Now Dori and Company seek to prove that the great cold-drake who slew King Dáin I has truly met his doom.\q

<u>Gwathrenost, the Witch-king's Citadel</u>\n\qOnce the seat of the Witch-king of Angmar, the dread citadel of Gwathrenost casts a long shadow upon the city of Carn Dûm. All but abandoned after the Steward of Angmar was deposed, the remnants of the Iron Crown have crept forth from the shadows, seeking to master a lost artifact of the Witch-king and reclaim dominion over the realm.\q
Nestled in the foothills of the Misty Mountains, the dwarf-keep of Kidzul-kâlah lies half-sunken in the Gladdenmere. However, the Redhorn Pass lies open to friends and foes alike….
Nestled in the foothills of the Misty Mountains, the dwarf-keep of Kidzul-kâlah lies half-sunken in the Gladdenmere. Meanwhile, a pack of worms has encroached on the old dwarf-keep….

Nestled in the foothills of the Misty Mountains, the dwarf-keep of Kidzul-kâlah lies half-sunken in the Gladdenmere. With the eyes of the dwarves elsewhere, the Dourhands have come to steal priceless relics long ago left behind....

Nestled in the foothills of the Misty Mountains, the dwarf-keep of Kidzul-kâlah lies half-sunken in the Gladdenmere. Deep in its newly-drained depths, the Dourhands seek to mine the veins of the Goldencleft....
Dol Ernil, an ancient bastion of Men, now falls under control of the Dead. Cleanse their menace from within the ruins.
<u>A Secret Return</u>\n\qIoreth says the hands of the king were the hands of a healer? I must find Aragorn and see if this be so!\q

<u>The Fall of Moria</u>\n\qToo deep and too greedily the dwarves delved. Little did they know what darkness truly lay in the deep places of the Misty Mountains, but Durin would not be dissuaded. Alas, what sorrow and shadows would come to Moria....\q

<u>The Grand Stair</u>\n\qIn elder days, this place once served as a grand portal to many levels and halls within Moria, but since the ruin of Moria, it has become a den of many Orc-tribes. Mazog, he who rules the Orcs of Moria, exacts his tribute here through his minion Igash....\q

<u>The Ties That Bind</u>\n\qKaj, the chieftain's son, is in love with Pinja, a young woman with a heritage drawing from many tribes. Unable to show her his true feelings, he invokes an ancient ritual, long forgotten, in an attempt to win a bride from a rival tribe....\q
Within Gundabad lie the ancient tombs of Atkât-darag. There, many wonders are kept, and many bones of great dwarves rest….

<u>The Defence of Galtrev</u>\n\qThe White Hand was driven out of Galtrev by the Free Peoples, but they return in great numbers with a hunger for revenge. The people of Galtrev must be defended against this evil, for their warriors have been taken from them.\q
Evidence of previous dwarves lie in a buried tomb, waiting to be uncovered….

<u>The Father of the Sutcrofts</u>\n\qFastred, Reeve of the Sutcrofts, stands in silence at his father's grave -- a respite from his brutal assaults against the Orcs. His grief still fresh, he wishes to speak of Dagred's life and legacy before he takes his leave to Snowbourn.\q
<u>A Theft of Freedom</u>\n\qI do not know if we can trust him. If we cannot, there are none better than you to endure the possibility of betrayal, and triumph.\q
Lalia, a frightened hobbit girl, has gotten lost in the Barrow-downs while searching for 'The Last Prince' of legend.

<u>The Mead Hall of Floodwend Besieged</u>\n\qThe Easterlings have regrouped and are poised to assault Floodwend. The attack comes as success is reported to Radwig, yet now the town finds itself in a struggle to keep the Mead Hall from falling to the enemy.\q

<u>Assault on the Ringwraiths' Lair</u>\n\qThe baileys of Dol Guldur are highly fortified, nearly impenetrable, and the finest of the Enemy's soldiers defend within. But before the rest of the fortress can be assaulted, these must be taken....\q

<u>Dun Shûma, The King's Fortress</u>\n\qThe hostile forces of Ekhamât have claimed Dun Shûma, the hidden fortress of Menûn Shûma III. The ancient ruin is said to hold many historical treasures of the kingdoms of Shagâna. Though Bârshud has retreated, his Umûni still stand opposed to Mizâdi's quest to claim the Crown of Hamât.\q
<u>Vóin's Tale</u>\n\qWhat secrets did Vóin hide within these Halls of Memory? Let us now discover them, my friend.\q
<u>Passage Into Dunland</u>\n\qYou have been invited to join a band of Dunlendings as you pass into Trum Dreng.\q
<u>The Wanderer's Confession</u>\n\qThis is my tale. Hear it, and know from whence I came.\q
<u>The Perfect Picnic</u>\n\qWhat a grand day for a picnic! Mayor Will Whitfoot has decided to join you for a delicious feast upon his favourite hill in all the Shire!\q
<u>His Father's Son</u>\n\qNever before had I known such despair.\q
<u>The Disaster</u>\n\qThe second attack was more fierce than the first had been. Isildur's defeat seemed certain.\q
<u>Into the Circle of Despair</u>\n\qTo further the conquest of Minas Morgul, we must brave of the horrors of the Lofty Watch-fort in the Circle of Despair.\q
<u>Freed of the Burden</u>\n\qWhat secrets did she add to the Halls of Memory? I wonder…\q
<u>Closing the Book</u>\n\qI leave the final disposition of the Black Book up to you, my friend.\q
<u>A Request</u>\n\qI just want to talk.\q
A group of Brigands have locked themselves in the mines of Writhenset, in a last ditch effort to control their foothold in the Wildwood.
<u>Bee's Big Business</u>\n\qGrimbeorn has agreed to travel with his big bees to the flowering fields of Lossarnach and assist with the pollination efforts upon the meadows!\q
A group of Tarkrîp Orcs seek to collapse the mines of Writhenset!

<u>The Forges of Khazad-dûm</u>\n\qAt the height of Durin's reign, the Forges of Khazad-dûm were once famed for producing great crafts of beauty and majesty. Now they have fallen into misuse by the Orcs which now infest the ancient halls of Moria, spewing forth their terrible tools of war....\q
Within the depths of the mines of Writhenset, a brood of spiders grows restless.

<u>Whispers in the Pits</u>\n\qAfter being granted a troubling vision by the Green Lady, you have travelled to Dol Guldur in search of Karazgar. What will you find in the shattered halls of Gostador?\q
<u>Mourning the Dead</u>\n\qAfter much bloodshed and loss, I have asked everyone gathered at my Pavilion to rest and mourn the deaths of our brethren.\q
Although it once served as a camp of the Ungoledain, Kêr Bréin has fallen to the Frost-horde. There, the cold-drakes of Ered Mithrin lay their eggs within its ruined walls.

Although it once served as a camp of the Ungoledain, Kêr Bréin has fallen to the Frost-horde. From within its ruined walls, a powerful hobgoblin leads the raids on Skarháld and keeps watch on the newly-laid eggs of the Frost-horde.
Scorpions near Dûlagig have been expanding their reach and are growing more aggressive in their attacks. Cull their number before they become an even greater threat to Urmâkh.
<u>A Game of Brigand-bashing</u>\n\qThe fearless children of Langhold have invited you to join them in a game of Brigand-bashing, in which they re-enact the deeds of their fathers and foes.\q

<u>Searching for Hope</u>\n\qThe Ordâkhai prisoner, Khûldim Umûn, claims that Dubarâkh, a hidden library Girhâzi and I have been searching for, is located inside this abandoned salt mine. Not trusting that the former overseer isn't leading you into a trap, Girhâzi has brought him along.\q

<u>The Broadacres Betrayed</u>\n\qThane Ordlac, revealed to be the traitor who orchestrated Reeve Fríthild's death, has claimed regency of the Broadacres and the Reeve's children. Young Thane Torferth of Torsbury prepares to ride against Stoke and take back the seat of the Reeve....\q
<u>Death Out of the Drownholt</u>
<u>Mists of Anduin</u>\n\qHas no one seen our new friend... or the Dunlending girl? I thought they would have returned to Stangard by now. Did some trouble befall them on the road?\q

<u>Flame and Shadow</u>\n\qRemarkable darkness and a long-forgotten cavern live out the years in silent stillness, and will soon be disturbed at last by the inimitable torch you now bear. Your instructions now bid you to seek an extraordinary flame to set this great beacon alight.\q
<u>Glory of the Golden Host</u>\n\qIn the Mirk-eaves, the Malledhrim seek ever to demonstrate to the minions of the Enemy the glory of the Golden Host....\q
<u>Nár's Tale</u>\n\qAlthough he has at last found comfort amongst Durin's Folk at the Lonely Mountain, the dwarf, Nár, has been witness to much hardship and tragedy throughout his long life.\q
<u>Pit of the Falcon</u>\n\qMeanwhile, in the dungeons below Isengard, Lothrandir of the Dúnedain resists the torments of his captors.\q

<u>The Deeping-coomb</u>\n\qSaruman's foul sorcery has destroyed the Deeping Wall and driven the Rohirrim into the Deeping-coomb. The retreat to the Glittering Caves and the Hornburg must be secured if there is to be any hope.\q
<u>A Daring Rescue</u>\n\qSithric, emissary of Théoden, rules in Stanric's place amongst rumours of foul play, and Stangard lies in disarray.\q

<u>The Ancient Lair</u>\n\qFonn, one of the Hillmen of the Trév Gallorg, sent a scout to an ancient cave in Malenhad, the brimstone swamp, where many Gertheryg were observed gathering. The scout, Bethan, never returned, and Fonn fears he may have been taken by the trolls.\q
Girhâzi has decided it is time to go on the offensive and has ordered an assault on the Ordâkhai camp of Khetsok.
Amongst the barrows in the depths Gundabad, the spirits of our forefathers are being disturbed….
<u>In Remembrance</u>\n\qNow that the family members are all gathered, we can begin the memorial in tribute of the crew of the Iskánta.\q

<u>A Captain's Standard</u>\n\qDwarves of the Dourhand house have taken refuge in the ruins of Ost Galumar, not far from the mines of Othrikar, stirring the Longbeards of Othrikar to action. Jarl Copperbrace recruits the bravest of the brave to deal with the threat of the Dourhands....\q
<u>Short of Stature, Great In Deed</u>\n\qI have been in this cage for what seems like days! Are my friends coming to rescue me or not? Should they even bother? They have probably left already.\q

<u>Storm on Methedras</u>\n\qWhile the Grey Company journeyed south to the aid of Aragorn, we came upon a Dunlending hag named Gwyllion, called the Old Woman of the Mountain. She sought to raise an army of ancient evil to aid the White Hand against Rohan... it was our duty, Amlan and mine, to keep her at bay....\q
<u>The Darkest Hour</u>\n\qFew in Middle-earth can defy the Witch-king of Angmar, but in this darkest hour, I will stand against him.\q
<u>Heirloom of Osgiliath</u>\n\qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted rigging-hook have returned you to the city split by the mighty River Anduin....\q
<u>Limlók Under Attack</u>\n\qI do not like that this raiding-party has not shown itself... no, I do not like it at all!\q
Brigands intent on training wolves near Mossward must be stopped before they can use the wolves against the people in the town. Stop this practice before it begins.

You are tasked with entering the ruins outside of Mossward to eliminate the remaining pack-leader from the pair that lead the wolves there. Since the death of her mate, the wolf-matron in the ruins has been aggressive and so has her pack.
<u>The Stones Returned</u>\n\qThe five stones beg to be returned to their rightful places. By your hand, he will be unleashed.\q
<u>Ambush at Echad Taerdim</u>\n\qWe return now to Echad Taerdim, but something is amiss. There is a foul smell on the air… the smell of death.\q
<u>Lost Shadows</u>\n\qTracking down the Dheghûn has led you to an old mining chasm in Nardol Quarry. You should search the caverns for the source of these mysterious beasts.\q

<u>They Mined Too Fast</u>\n\qMithril it is called by the Elves, and true-silver in the Common Tongue, but the dwarves do not share their own secret name. The hope of finding it has led many dwarves to their doom in Moria, for they seldom heed the dire warnings when their hearts yearn for mithril, cold and bright in the dark.\q

<u>Laerdan's Escape</u>\n\qÉin, the questioner left behind at Barad Tironn, revealed that Laerdan had been moved from Annúminas and taken to Sammath Baul in Angmar. Time is running short for the Elf-lord.\q
A great leader amongst the Uruk from the White Hand was severely injured in an attack at Caras Geleden. You have been sent to finish the creature.
<u>The Prince of Rohan, Night</u>\n\qNight fell on the twenty-fifth of February, as my prince prepared for one last journey, a journey to lands we know not.\q
<u>The Daring Strike, Mid-day</u>\n\qThéodred came to the gates of Isengard by mid-day, and the uruks arrayed before him readied for his assault. We lined up, ready to charge!\q
<u>The Doorward</u>\n\qWe have victory this day, but it was not assured. Were it not for the deeds of Háma, doorward of Théoden, all might have been lost....\q

<u>A Sunset Storm</u>\n\qAt the behest of Céola, commander of the Rohirrim border-guard in the Brown Lands, you prepare to make a night-time assault upon Lashkarg, war-camp of the Khundolar... an effort that may be doomed if aid is not found....\q
Prince Ingór has declared that the Hall of Vérnozal needs to be cleaned up to suit the needs of the Zhélruka Clan….

<u>Unbridled Wrath</u>\n\qRuin! Wrack and ruin! These Orcs and uruks have brought ruin to my home, and I will bring ruin to them! If it were not for that tree... or was it a giant? A giant tree? No matter... if it had not saved me, I would not be alive to take my revenge....\q
Within the ruins of Stormwall, cold-worms have begun nesting in the vacant lair of Etterfang….

<u>Garth Agarwen - Barrows</u>\n\qAt the height of their kingdom, the Men of Rhudaur enshrined their dead within great tombs of stone and built into the ground. At the crest of the tallest barrow, Ivar the Blood-hand, awaits any who would attempt to cleanse the corruption from the land and free the Red-maid from her service to the Darkness.\q
Within the ruins of Stormwall, the vacant lair of Etterfang remains vastly unexplored….

<u>The Dog-catcher, Part 3</u>\n\qI know not why Namâkh embarked to Shakhdag. I wish he had merely told me he needed time alone, and had not put his life so foolishly in danger. We must search for signs of Namâkh or clues of his presence among the savage boar.\q
Within the ruins of Stormwall, cold-worms have begun building icy walls within the vacant lair of Etterfang….

<u>The Dog-catcher, Part 4</u>\n\qYou have traced Namâkh and Barûl to this abandoned house in Urmâkh. Inside, the smell is musty, infused with the scent of blood. As you enter, you see Namâkh bound in the corner, with Barûl standing over him.\q

<u>Instance: Delving of Glimmerdeep</u>\n\qThe Orkish claimants to Glimmerdeep have been thrown into disarray. Those who would seek to return the mines to order must first join the chaos and lay claim to the rich resources found there.\q

<u>A Champion's Courage</u>\n\qMosal-ruk, leader of the Orcs of Ost Cyrn, gathers his strength to crush the Eglain of the Lone-lands and press westward to Bree-land. Slade Ransford, a champion of the common good, stands ready with his allies to turn back the Orkish war-band....\q
Within the ruins of Stormwall, the vacant lair of Etterfang remains vastly unexplored….
<u>Running Wild</u>\n\qFor the Beornings, there is a time to work, and there is a time to run wild.\q
<u>Raphûz's Challenge</u>\n\qRaphûz must hunt a terrible boar terrorizing the people of Urmâkh to earn favour with Numûru.\q

<u>Schemes and Misadventures</u>\n\qWorking with Nimasi, you have traced the banner attacks to a large camp in southern Imhûlar. Investigate the camp without being seen to discover the source of these attacks.\q

<u>Foreword: Many Unhappy Returns</u>\n\qVery long ago, there lived by the banks of the Great River a clever-handed and quiet-footed little people. There was among them a family of high repute, ruled by a Grandmother, and the most inquisitive and curious-minded of that family was named Sméagol.\q

<u>Battle of Dol Baran</u>\n\qThe Dunlending armies unleashed an attack on the Rohirrim holding Dol Baran hoping to dislodge them from the high ground. But the horselords are prepared to defend their position with their lives.\q
<u>A Just Burial</u>\n\qBrothers Erchar and Herion return to the site of a battle that drove them apart. You accompany them to pay respects before the returning journey to Linhir.\q

<u>Nirgambâr, the Restless Tomb</u>\n\qIn a sheltered valley in the north of Khûd Zagin stand ancient, crumbling ziggurat-tombs of pale stone collectively known as Nirgambâr. Scouts have reported that one of the Zidemel's men, Andur, is said to have entered Nirgambâr drawn there by dark whispers. Locate and stop Andur before he can unleash what lurks in this cursed place.\q
<u>The Battle for Hytbold</u>\n\qThe Enemy is marching upon Hytbold, intent upon defeating the Lords of the Eastemnet and claiming eastern Rohan as their own.\q

<u>In Need of Cheering-up</u>\n\qWhile the Lady Éowyn appears brave and cheerful, some who know her well grow concerned for her, for she does not eat or sleep, and a heavy gloom seems to have settled upon her since the departure of Théoden King.\q

<u>A Lore-master's Will</u>\n\qThe Elf-loremaster Isferon received a gift from his friend Berenin before he passed over the Sea, but the gift is wrapped in a riddle. Before the gift can be revealed Berenin's puzzle must be solved....\q

<u>The Battle of the Twenty-first Hall</u>\n\qIn the aftermath of the raid upon Zabadgathol, Mazog sets his strength against Durin's Folk, assaulting many key encampments. If the Twenty-first Hall falls, then the advantage falls to Mazog's Orcs.\q
Goblins have overrun Limael's Vineyard. A party of the wretched creatures broke into an old wine-cellar and stole a number of flasks of a rare and ancient vintage.

<u>A Thief in the Night</u>\n\qThe hobbit-burglar Atherol Took has learned that some of the Big Folk who have been causing trouble in the Southfarthing of the Shire are planning to sneak onto Farmer Maggot's land and steal his mushrooms. Atherol has no intention of allowing hobbit-mushrooms to be stolen by Men....\q
<u>The Council of Kings</u>\n\qI have shown our trophies to the guard, and he at least will allow us inside.\q

<u>A Song for the Company</u>\n\qHoping for some new material with which to compose a song, the minstrel Piper Prescott has recruited young blood to aid the hobbit Leland Underhill retrieve some goods stolen from him by the brigands encamped throughout Bree-land....\q
Orcs are getting orders from something beyond them. You are to hunt through their camp, eliminate the enemy and recover orders.
<u>A Bad Birthday</u>\n\qThis may be the last meal we take all together: before the end of the war, or our lives!\q
<u>The Glory of the Bright Company</u>\n\qWe came without incident to the tunnel of Halroth, and ventured within. Our greatest danger lay ahead.\q

<u>The Temple of Utug-bûr - Dhórgruth</u>\n\qUtug-bûr is home to long-hidden vaults delved deep into the stone, hidden by sorcery since the end of the First Age. The Thardúth, one of Morgoth's powerful agents, bred the great Elder Orcs known as the Utûgi. Its denizens have remained in a sorcerous slumber for millennia, but have now awakened, and their lair opened anew with the passing of the threat of Sauron.\q

<u>The Daughter of Strife</u>\n\qAges ago, in the fastness of Eregion, the Dark Lord came in fair guise. Some among the Elves called him Antheron Gift-lord, for he taught them to craft the Rings of Power. In those days, he beguiled Narmeleth daughter of Laerdan and broke her mind....\q

<u>A Final Council</u>\n\qGlorfindel, mightiest of Elf-lords, tests the heart of Narmeleth, seeking to learn if the spirit of Amarthiel has truly passed from her. If Narmeleth has indeed returned, her knowledge of Angmar may aid the Free Peoples in overthrowing the False King....\q
The Taurogrim have taken over Óinsbridge as their corruption spreads out past the Thornholt….
The Taurogrim have taken over Óinsbridge as their corruption threatens all in the Grey Mountains….
<u>Across the Ikorbân</u>\n\qRaphûz invited you to speak with him ahead of his move to Khûd Zagin.\q
Prince Ingór has declared that the Hall of Vérnozal needs to be further decorated to suit the needs of the Zhélruka Clan….

<u>Council of the Seven</u>\n\qBeyond the foothills of Zirakzigil, the Dwarves of the Haban'akkâ at last glimpsed Azanulbizar. It lay barren and silent, but so too had it seemed to Thrór when he met his end at the hands of Azog. On the eve of battle, King Thráin called the Kings of the Seven Houses to council at Amdân.\q
<u>Théoden, Son of Thengel</u>\n\qWe have returned to Meduseld, against the King's orders, but we do not seem to be the only ones come to the Golden Hall to speak words of warning....\q
<u>Mouth of Gondor</u>\n\qRemain on your guard, my friend. You speak with my voice, and should be free of harm, but this embassy will not be without danger....\q
In the icy winds of the distant snowfields, a dwarf expedition has been lost to the frozen drifts, waiting to be rediscovered….

<u>Commands of the King</u>\n\qThéoden King has stepped beyond his hall to look upon the kingdom. What will he see, I wonder? And will it move him to strike down the evils arrayed against his people?\q

<u>The Cooling Chamber</u>\n\qAbove the great forges of Khazad-dûm lies a chamber that was used to cool the rising steam and return it as water to the pools of Moria. What purpose could goblins have within the walls of that ancient chamber?\q

<u>Helegrod</u>\n\qHelegrod... once a dwarf-hold in the Misty Mountains, until the coming of a great dragon. Though the dragon has long since perished, and the ice of many long winters has engulfed the ruins, rumours out of the North speak of a terrible shadow returning to the frozen halls....\q

<u>Barad Gúlaran</u>\n\qHaving obtained all the tools they need to contain a terrible spell, the sorcerers of Angmar retreat to Barad Gúlaran to fulfil the commands of their mistress Amarthiel, while the Rangers of the North seek to hinder them....\q

<u>Skûmfil</u>\n\qSince the overthrow of Moria, the Orcs have disposed of their dead in the great chasm they call Skûmfil. Over the ages, the rotting pile of carcasses and filth that has accumulated there has also attracted many foul and disgusting creatures, from the vile Gredbyg to the scavenging Kergrim....\q\n
<u>Blood for Blood</u>\n\qStriving to avenge Dolgimil, the Corsair and Haradrim invaders of Dor-en-Ernil make ready to siege Linhir once more and slay its people as retribution.\q

<u>Ost Dunhoth</u>\n\qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition….\q
The gates of Gundabad are heavily fortified. Only by approaching with stealth will you remain unseen….
<u>A Quiet Meal</u>\n\qA familiar scene unfolds. A weary traveller, having just finished helping with a hard day's work, joins a humble family for a meal.\q
Deep in the Misty Mountains, the Orcs and goblins use a secret tunnel to move supplies between Goblin-town and Gundabad….
Dâr Brulku, a fort near Gundabad, holds the Orcs' main stockpile of weapons and armour….
Deep in the Grey Mountains, the hobgoblins launch a plot to free their mistress….
To end this war, Gorgar the Ruthless must be defeated. But first, he must be found….
Gorgar the Ruthless has been tracked to Goblin-town. Will you find and defeat him in time?
Within the walls of Tûr Ágal, in Elderslade, an Angmarim sorceress has overtaken the tower, for unknown and nefarious purposes….
<u>A Ruthless End</u>\n\qArvaethor, a man with great passion for his home, would risk his life for the Vale. You have requested to join him on this dangerous errand into the hall of Nimrond.\q

<u>The Grand Stair</u>\n\qIn elder days, this place once served as a grand portal to many levels and halls within Moria, but since the ruin of Moria, it has become a den of many Orc-tribes. Mazog, he who rules the Orcs of Moria, exacts his tribute here through his minion Igash....\q\n
<u>Halros's Watch</u>\n\qMeanwhile, in the Shire, Halros of the Dúnedain helps watch the borders of that land and hopes his brethren in the south are faring well on their journey.\q

<u>The Secrets of Seregost</u>\n\qSeregost, the big scary castle in Agarnaith. Nobody knows what's inside! Secrets and probably shiny things. Viznak, the best and smartest Goblin ever, with the help of his big strong bodyguards, will try to get in there! Oh, also, we will try to find out stuff about this new plague. Yes.\q
Behold! The vault of Agbash-khalt, sealed and hidden to all those who have occupied Gundabad, has now finally revealed itself to the Zhélruka Dwarves….

<u>Lost Temple</u>\n\qA band of mercenaries led by the Gaunt-lord Ferndúr have begun looting a hidden Rhudauran temple, left in ruin since the fall of the Northern Kingdoms. What purpose does this servant of darkness have within?\q
Behold! The vault of Agbash-khalt, sealed and hidden to all those who have occupied Gundabad, has now finally revealed itself to the Zhélruka Dwarves….

<u>A Well-Ordered Mind</u>\n\qDorset Oakes, the son of a Lore-master now dead, seeks the knowledge contained in his father's old library and is prepared to hunt for the pages to the catalogue his father had written; however, goblins have been digging in the caves near the library and may soon break through....\q
Behold! The vault of Agbash-khalt, sealed and hidden to all those who have occupied Gundabad, has now finally revealed itself to the Zhélruka Dwarves….

<u>The Caravan to Snowbourn</u>\n\qFearing for the safety of my people, I have decreed that my son, Gísling, is to escort the crofters of Garsfeld to safety within the walls of Snowbourn. However, the road south is fraught with danger as foes approach from all directions....\q

<u>The Watcher in the Water</u>\n\qDire is the creature called the Watcher in the Water by the dwarves, an ancient evil called forth by the Dark Lord. Perhaps through the power of legend, a way can be seen past the terror...?\q
<u>Two Hobbits</u>\n\qThose footprints are hobbit-sized! What became of our mutual friends on that dangerous day?\q

<u>Gath Daeroval, the Shadow-roost</u>\n\qHigh above the Morgul Vale in a cleft in the side of Achathras, Gath Daeroval is home to the Shadow-roost of the fell beasts. It is said to be home to Khatlob, the massive, voracious brood-mother of the roost, who laid the eggs whence sprang the mounts of the Witch-king and the other Ringwraiths.\q
<u>A King Should See His Kingdom</u>\n\qKing Elessar desires to speak with you in the Tower of Ecthelion about an important matter.\q
<u>Halros's Watch</u>\n\qMeanwhile, in Dunland, Halros of the Dúnedain has been woken for his turn at the watch.\q
Take the fight to the Orcs in their camp at Sar-kidul.
<u>Rapid Retaliation</u>\n\qOrcs have followed you back to Enârshan's home. Put an end to them before they can cause any harm.\q
Prince Ingór wishes to hunt the great frost-drake, Svalnath, and to bring great honour to the Zhélruka clan….

<u>Tusks of the Boar</u>\n\qWhile sailing up-river to deliver crucial information to others who might stand against Isengard, the Boar-clan comes across a great muster of Dunlendings. Rather than stand idly by, they attempt to hinder the army in Wulf's Cleft by destroying their siege-engines.\q
<u>Kindred Spirits</u>\n\qYou there! You're the friend of whom Maethon spoke?\q

<u>Throne of the Dread Terror</u>\n\qThe Enemy's grip tightens on the defenders of Gondor as Gothmog seizes control of the armies of Mordor. Marching from the gates of Osgiliath, foes pour into the Pelennor Fields with a renewed vigour. In the wake of the Witch-king's defeat, vile sorcery looms over the field as the most powerful allies of the Dread Terror are summoned forth. If Gothmog spoke true of the fate he shares with Golodir, can victory yet be found?\q
Meats are needed to feed those in the war efforts….
A beast in Misthallow has been terrorizing those on the southern path from the Grey Mountains….
<u>A Matter of Lineage</u>\n\qYour encounter with Gothmog fills me with a dread I cannot explain. I hope to learn why here in the Old Archives.\q
The Ordâkhai at Ghât Lor are building siege engines to war with Queen Mizâdi and Renewed Hamât. Destroy the siege engines and defeat any Ordâkhai who move against you.

<u>Sons of Leaf and Stone</u>\n\qThough the memory be now dim, of old Elves and dwarves were close in friendship. Legolas of Mirkwood and Gimli the dwarf, through shared hardship, have rekindled the old bonds. Even now they look for Orcs to slay beneath the eaves of Lothlórien.\q

<u>Amdân Dammul, the Bloody Threshold</u>\n\qThe final battle of the War of Three Peaks has begun. Prince Durin Stonehelmson of the Longbeards leads the Gabil'akkâ, a great host of united dwarves, to the very gates of Mount Gundabad. But Gorgar the Ruthless, son of Bolg, has one last surprise in store for those who would seek to usurp him....\q
<u>The Ghost Returns</u>\n\qThis land is new to me, but it will be good to see an old friend. Will she be pleased to see us, I wonder?\q

<u>The Lost Workshop</u>\n\qThe workshop of Melkólf Stonecarver may hold the key to freeing the dwarf Bori from the clutches of Mazog. There is rumour of a secret escape passage from the throne room of Durin, and knowledge of it may be found amid Melkólf's possessions.\q

<u>The Secret Road</u>\n\qThe secret way out of the throne room of Durin was known to a few only, all of whom perished during the fall of the great dwarf-kingdom. But the errant mark of a forgotten scribe preserved a record of its existence, and now it may be used to rescue the dwarf Bori from the clutches of the Orcs.\q

<u>The Worries of Lord Celeborn</u>\n\qThe defeat of Mazog has sent ripples of hope throughout the dwarves of the Iron Garrison; though it be short-lived, my husband Celeborn must be satisfied with that victory and turn his eyes towards other dangers on the horizon.\q
<u>The Battle of Lórien</u>\n\qThe Orcs of Moria have come down from the mountains, and as they launch their attack on Lothlórien, Elf and Elf-friend alike must stand against them, or perish...\q
<u>A Beorninghús Tradition</u>\n\qIt is a Beorning tradition to signal both ends and beginnings with a feast.\q

<u>Askâd-mazal, the Chamber of Shadows</u>\n\qLong ago, Durin the Deathless sealed away an evil being known as the Shadowed King. Driven by intense jealousy, he wears the face of the Father of the Longbeards and builds a kingdom deep beneath the earth; a twisted reflection of the dwarf hall above, a mockery of the grandness of Khazad-dûm. He must be defeated, or his demented visions may become reality.\q

<u>Skorgrím's Tomb</u>\n\qIt would seem that Gormr and the Dourhands have allied themselves with evil fell spirits of Old, just as Skorgrím himself did long ago. Now Ivar the Bloodhand, a Gaunt-lord, threatens to sway the Dourhands to evil with the terrifying ritual about to take place in Skorgrím's Tomb....\q
<u>Gothmog's Rage</u>\n\qIf you do not follow my commands it will be your death, prisoner! Now move!\q
<u>A Vengeful Heart</u>\n\qSomeone else has entered the tower! Be on guard!\q
<u>The Last Great Stronghold</u>\n\qThéoden's company parted from Gandalf upon the road and retreated to Helm's Deep. What news could have reached them that turned them from their path?'\q
<u>Heirloom of the High King</u>\n\qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted badge have led you to the Bridge of Ariant, high above Lake Evendim, in the City of Kings....\q

<u>She Who Walks in the Darkness</u>\n\qHere agelong she has dwelt, an evil thing in spider-form. She who was here before Sauron, and before the first stone of Barad-dûr. Shelob the Great, last child of Ungoliant. Ungwetári. The time has come to face her once again.\q
<u>The Untamed Wilds</u>\n\qThe Beorning Vaskorn insists that a stand must be taken here and now against the approaching raiding party of wargs entering the Floodfells.\q

<u>Thaurisgar, the Vile Apothecary</u>\n\qIn the depths of Thaurisgar, countless foul and twisted experiments roam the shadows--the terrible legacy of Aniochán the Harrower. Before the fall of Carn Dûm, Aniochán worked tirelessly to outdo his rivals and win the favour of the Steward of Angmar. Chief among his tools in shaping his fell creations was a curious ichor known only as the Bile of Ifrinn. Thought to be lost after a disastrous experiment claimed Aniochán's life, now this foetid and vile substance is in danger of being let loose into the world. What did Aniochán hope to accomplish in Thaurisgar? Did he believe his end to be a failure or a true testament to his achievements?\q
The Orcs and Wargs have returned to Shathur-munzu, attempting to set up a new base south of the warfront….
The Orcs and Wargs have returned to Shathur-munzu, attempting to set up a new base south of the warfront….

<u>Five Against the Wold</u>\n\qAldor Harding is convinced that he will die to an Easterling blade... it has become our task to prove that men make their own fates. My companions and I will face the blades of the Easterlings, and we will prove victorious!\q
<u>Instance: Gemyndsted</u>\n\qYou have followed Quickbeam's directions to the Library at Gemyndsted. Clear the forces of Saruman from inside and reclaim any relics and texts within.\q
<u>Defence of Scylfig</u>\n\qThe people of Scylfig have been dreading this moment for quite a while. Now is the time for everyone to take up arms and defend Scylfig with their lives!\q
<u>Rescue in Nûrz Ghâshu</u>\n\qTaken by some madness, Golodir has ventured into the Rift. The air is thick with menace, and the stench of Thaurlach lingers....\q
<u>The Pale Herald</u>\n\qListen well! You must hear of Rûkhor the Pale Herald, and how he led my people astray!\q
<u>A Gift for the North</u>\n\qThe Stone-troll of Rushock Bog... a terrible legend stalks the fens, enraged by the dwarves who seek to capture it....\q
<u>Night Falls On Sarn Ford</u>\n\qAn unnatural fog rolled in, changing the contours of the land, and we were seized by a feeling of dread unlike anything we had felt before.\q

<u>The Snatcher</u>\n\qÚbil the Snatcher.... My father, Beorn, told me of that creature in my youth. He thought it a gangrel-beast that crawled from some dark cleft in the night. For many years, it crept unseen into the villages of the Woodmen and stole away their children to sate its hunger, but when it could hide no longer the creature fled the Vales of Anduin... never to return.\q
<u>The Fushaum Resolution</u>\n\qThe divided leaders of Fushaum Bal have called a meeting to put aside the bloodshed and find compromise over disputed land, resources, and riches.\q

<u>Fil Gashan</u>\n\qFil Ghashan is the stronghold of Talug, right hand of Mazog, Lord of Moria. Here, the Orc-general musters an army to make a futile assault upon Lothlórien. Here, he also breeds Orc-warriors of a most deadly skill....\q\n

<u>Adkhât-zahhar, the Houses of Rest</u>\n\qDeep in the Pit of Stonejaws, a grand tomb holds the remains of the many ancient dwarf-lords of Gundabad. The necromancer Loknashra, now empowerd with the spirit of Drugoth, has returned to raise an army and claim her vengeance upon all those who wronged her.\q

<u>Protectors of Thangúlhad</u>\n\qWhat was once an important fortification of the Enemy is now held by a small band of Elves. Unfortunately, the Enemy is marching there in force. Fortunately, some of the ballistae and catapults still function....\q
<u>The Want-kin</u>\n\qBearing no banners of allegiance, a curious company of dwarves has made camp in Elderslade. Whether they prove to be friends or foes remains to be seen....\q
A band of foes approaches the town of Trestlebridge! The town must not fall to the invaders!
DNT
DNT
Stone-claws and deep-claws have taken over the caverns of Ronglagam, as the great deep-claw Amshaz the Vast, slumbers within….
Precious resources lie deep within a cavern. Several piles of debris prevent miners from gathering this most needed resource….
The fool mayor of Hoarhallow is going to pay for enlisting the aid of the Free folk. Your objective is clear. Find the mayor and end him.

<u>The Library at Tham Mírdain</u>\n\qThe Library at Tham Mírdain once held much of the knowledge of the early Ages and withstood the brunt of Sauron's attack against Eregion. Though much of the surviving lore was carried away by Elrond Halfelven, the forces of Angmar now seek the remnants....\q
The fearsome hobgoblins have sworn themselves to the Frost-horde and gained terrible power in return….

<u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u>\n\qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q
Several scouts keeping watch on the hobgoblin's den failed to report back. They must be rescued before it is too late!
TBD…
<u>Desire above Strength</u>\n\qIdes has quickly grown to trust you as a mentor. She wishes to discuss with you her aspirations and her fears.\q

<u>The Drowned Treasury</u>\n\qIn the flooded depths of Moria was the great axe Zigilburk lost. Few have ever tried to find it, and fewer ever returned from their quests. Who now remains to challenge the shadows that linger in the dark halls of the deep places...?\q
The fearsome hobgoblins have sworn themselves to the Frost-horde and gained terrible power in return….
<u>The Picture Painted</u>\n\qListen now to my words, and the words of Vóin.\q

<u>Remembrance</u>\n\qToo many of the Dúnedain have fallen to the ravages of one who is their distant kinsman. There is a time for mourning, but is this that time, when the Champion of Angmar might secure her ring, Narchuil...?\q

<u>The Dragon and the Storm</u>\n\qDahâl Huliz has long been home to many spectacular contests, pitting capable gladiators against all forms of opponents. Rothog has summoned you to witness the unveiling of his latest spectacle for the Arena.\q
<u>The Sword and the Stonemaiden</u>\n\qThese are the Halls of Memory, where the words of Vóin give shape to deeds from long ago. Hold your questions, Faramir!\q

<u>Unlocking History</u>\n\qActing on Amâsu's suggestion, you found another possible location for the Dubarâkh, the hidden library we have been seeking. Inside, you discovered a curious wall that you suspect may be a secret door. Amâsu insisted on seeing it for herself, but she need not go alone.\q

<u>Queen of Queens</u>\n\qWhile dealing with the marsh insects of the Rushgore on behalf of the stranded Woodmen, you discovered the nest of their queen... a discovery that yields unpleasant results.\q
<u>The Warrior Remade</u>\n\qThis story begins during the reign of King Eärnil II, who was troubled by the loss of Minas Ithil to the forces of the Witch-king.\q
<u>The Trial of Wrath</u>\n\qIn haste to destroy an artifact such as this, a trial must be overcome.\q
<u>The Trial of Madness</u>\n\qIn haste to destroy an artifact such as this, a trial of madness must be overcome. A failure, and one shall indeed face a certain death.\q

<u>Stoneheight</u>\n\qStoneheight was once a place of refuge from the Orc-tribes in the North Downs, but now their walls have been breached. Yet even as the houses burn and crumble to the ground, you notice that it was not Orcs alone that did this.\q
<u>Flight from Khazad-dûm</u>\n\qWhat has happened in Khazad-dûm? Whatever has befallen, the Iron Garrison is in danger!\q
<u>Heirloom of the Snowmen</u>\n\qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted brooch have led you to the settlement of Sûri-kylä, where something is wrong....\q
<u>The King Under the Mountain</u>\n\qAt last, Dómor has returned from Mordor with a valuable treasure! Finally some good tidings!\q
<u>A True Friend of Durin's Folk</u>\n\qWho among us can deny the great deeds you have performed on behalf of Durin's Folk?\q

<u>Unfinished Business</u>\n\qUnder the cover of night, you and Mekhnet have stealthily crept past the threshold of Atrad-zarakh. Thraunákh tinkers away at his sapper-bombs somewhere deeper in, oblivious to the death that awaits him.\q

<u>Instance: Stangraf</u>\n\qThe mines of Stangraf have been overrun by the forces of Isengard. Stangraf contains a wealth of resources that must not fall into Saruman's hands. Remove the invaders, and recover as many resources as you can.\q

<u>The Shadow of Mordor</u>\n\qAs the Dark Lord's servants carry out the release of a mysterious prisoner, the Stout-axes rise in revolt, desperate to escape from the Dark Tower and flee to lands untouched by the shadow of Mordor.\q

<u>Legacy of Strife</u>\n\qAs the Heirs of Castamir expand their influence in Lebennin, the people of Ost Anglebed find their loyalties called in question as the old wounds of the Kin-strife are rent anew.\q

<u>Ruins of the Ancestors</u>\n\qMaster Architect Gori Stonesetter waits for you under the ancient arches on the bank of the River Kibil-nâla. He is determined to examine the ruins, built by an ancestor of his, no matter the danger of crumbling bridges or lurking enemies.\q

<u>Sejer-tharâkh</u>\n\qA lumber store-house of repute, Sejer-tharâkh was also known to hold one of the greatest libraries of trade-records in all of Moria. The Iron Garrison seeks to reclaim the lost trade-records and use that information to aid them in re-establishing Khazad-dûm as a great merchant kingdom.\q

<u>A Dark Pact</u>\n\qAfter investigating strange occurrences throughout the vale, you have tracked an invader from Tarlang's Crown to the Hill of Erech. While their identity remains unknown, they intend to form a pact with the Ruthless Dead - a union that could spell doom for Gondor.\q

<u>Fulz-zahar</u>\n\qNow established in the Twenty-first Hall, the Iron Garrison has dispatched scouts to the Redhorn Lodes in search of new sources of ore. In a small cleft along the region's southern borders, they have discovered Fulz-zahar -- a small mine upon which many big hopes lie.\q

<u>The Lord of Moria</u>\n\qFor a fearful moment, it seemed as if the Battle of Azanulbizar had turned against King Thráin and the Haban'akkâ, but as the horn-call of Grór sounded, Náin and the Dwarves of the Iron Hills charged forth at last.\q
<u>Isolation Amongst the Survivors</u>\n\qBefore you move on from the Steaping Cave, you would like to see the other women be more kind to Ránmald, who is in a fragile state.\q

<u>Agoroth, the Narrowdelve</u>\n\qDeep in the frozen wilds of Forochel, the Arnorian fortress Agoroth lies hidden. Although no living souls have set foot there for thousands of years, thou now findst thyself in a race to reach its vault before the forces of Angmar.\q
<u>Righting the Wrongs of Trum Dreng</u>\n\qInfuriated by the attacks orchestrated by the Dragon Clan and seemingly the armies of Isengard as well, Guto plans to take matters into his own hands....\q
<u>Sparring in Minas Tirith</u>\n\qWith a battle looming, the soldiers of Minas Tirith stand restless in the Training Ground. Perhaps you can help them ease their nerves.\q

<u>The Deadly Dinner</u>\n\qA grand dinner is being hosted by the Elders of Lake-town, however the shadow of the late Master's murder still hangs over the Manor. Is something wicked about to unfold?\q
The workers at the quarry in Scary have broken into a hidden chamber containing a nest of spiders, and the creatures have now overrun the quarry, endangering the peaceful hobbit village.
To the north-west of Maurûsh the spiders grow more foetid and strong. There is a call from the coalition at Ub Nishir to cull the matron at the head of the nest.
<u>The Ghost Returns</u>\n\qThis land is new to me, but it will be good to see an old friend. Will she be pleased to see us, I wonder?\q

<u>Laying to Rest the Evil Dead</u>\n\qHeralded by the demise of the gaunt-man Gúrdring, Glorfindel fears the return of Ferndúr the Virulent to the Trollshaws. Hoping to strike before Ferndúr's strength grows too great, Glorfindel has enlisted your aid in quelling the threat posed by this ancient Gaunt-lord of Morgoth.\q
Near the top of the ruins, a savage Orc commands the lesser forces. You must find your way to him and win the day.

<u>The Skin-changer's Heritage</u>\n\qIn the vales of the Anduin, the children and grandchildren of Beorn live a rustic and peaceful life. Soon, they too will need to face the shadow that threatens all of Middle-earth....\q

<u>Before the Doors of Durin</u>\n\qLong have Durin's Folk desired to look upon the halls of Moria once again, to reclaim their birthright from the goblins and Orcs who now dwell there. Has that time now come? Not even I can foresee their fate....\q

<u>Neighbours Meet</u>\n\qIt has been many long years since the Men of Rohan established the keep of Stangard on the borders of Lórien, but the neighbouring Elves, suspicious of all, have never yet let themselves be seen by the Rohirrim.\q

<u>Man and Monster</u>\n\qThe Ent, Mossbeard, wishes to tell you more of what he has learned from the trees of Balewood. Núrzum's might stems not from within, but from the vile stone upon his back granted to him by a powerful benefactor.\q
A local farmer outside Urmâkh has asked for help rounding up his escaped chickens.
<u>The Next Move</u>\n\qBelondor wishes to discuss with us what the future may hold for Gondor and for Umbar.\q

<u>An Omen from the East</u>\n\qWhile confronting the treacherous brigands and Oathbreakers of Ost Celebrant, you have discovered a concealed passage that reeks of dread. What horrors could be lurking beneath the crumbling ruins?\q

<u>The Hiddenhoard of Abnankâra</u>\n\qBeyond the falls of Amgaruslun in the Clovengap lies Abnankâra, the Hiddenhoard. Once an ancient treasury wrought in secret by Mótsog and the Greymauls during their rebellion against the Longbeards in the Elder Days, it has become the lair of Hrímil Frost-heart, a dreaded cold-dragon of Morgoth. Within this frozen retreat, Hrímil tends her wounds and slumbers, dreaming of vengeance upon Prince Durin and the dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ.\q
<u>Azagath Pursued</u>\n\qMy son Thorongil has been rescued, but the Kindred of the Coins will still be made to answer for his capture.\q
<u>Treating With Scoundrels</u>\n\qDeliver the ransom and bring home my sons. Yet tread cautiously and keep your wits about you. We know not if these Variag men have any honour at all.\q

<u>The Halls of Night</u>\n\qThe Hillmen of Angmar have discovered an ancient barrow hidden away for centuries. The leaders of Aughaire have called for adventurers willing to brave the tomb rumoured to be filled with wealth and riches. Markings surrounding its entrance bear an ominous warning; twisted creatures and slumbering warriors at the foot of a powerful sorcerer….\q
<u>Scatha's Legacy</u>\n\qFróthi, a Lore-master familiar with both Scatha and The Weeping Warrior, looks to examine what remains of the dragon necklace.\q
<u>The Dragon's Bones</u>\n\qFollow me, friend. Kólfith will not be long.\q
An injured band of enemies proves an easy target. Get them before they can regroup and regain their strength.
<u>The Shield-maiden's Training</u>\n\qThe desire to train against more unpredictable foes has drawn Ides' attention to the bears roaming just beyond the training grounds.\q
<u>The Will to Stand</u>\n\qWord reached us even in Enedwaith that the Falcon Clan stood against Saruman. But will a common enemy serve to unite us as friends?\q

<u>Instance: Iserngraf</u>\n\qThe Iserngraf is a source of much needed ore in Rohan. Mines this rich are sought by many and control of it is critical to the Rohirrim. Unfortunately, it has fallen under attack, and the miners have been driven out. Frithnoth has asked you to do what you can do discourage the invaders within.\q
<u>Wood, Mountain, Lake, and Stone</u>\n\qThis is Mazal Akrâz, the Chamber of Glory. My brother and my sons lie within. Let us go now to them.\q
<u>Shield-brothers</u>\n\qElfmar is a good man and true, just like his father. We should help him prepare his men for battle as best we can.\q
<u>Homecoming</u>\n\qI have been too long away from home. But what welcome awaits me now?\q
<u>A Logical Appeal</u>\n\qAfter seeing the many hardships faced by the Men of Stangard, you and Gadda have decided to make an appeal to the leaders of the settlement.\q

<u>Into the Silver Deep</u>\n\qWhile about to begin your long day of work at the Silverdeep Mine, an old Man beckons for you to come near. He is a close advisor of Thorin Oakenshield, the master of these halls. What could he have to say to a simple miner such as yourself?\q
<u>The Grey King</u>\n\qThe terrible beast known in legend as the Grey King has long haunted the passes of the Gloomglens, waiting in secret to throw boulders down upon the heads of the unwary.\q

<u>Awakening</u>\n\qAt Abkân'aban, the Stone of Wakening, the Angmarim of the Iron Crown seek to master the white forge of Durin the Deathless, forever defiling the hallowed caverns of Gloomingtarn.\q

<u>An Unexpected Return</u>\n\qIn the aftermath of the War of the Ring, the terrible losses borne by Lord Duinhir and the Men of the Blackroot Vale have led many among them to believe that they have been cast aside and all but forgotten by the newly-crowned King of Gondor, Elessar. But now, with the arrival of the King's emissary, perhaps they might be convinced otherwise....\q
<u>A Helping Hand</u>\n\qAs you make your way behind the secret door, more of Sêkhta's forces rise to stop you!\q

<u>Stanric's Stand</u>\n\qStanric is alive! He lives despite Sithric's hope to make everyone believe he died a sudden natural death. He wishes to enlist your help in freeing Stangard from corruption once and for all....\q

<u>Mordirith's Fall</u>\n\qHeartened by the gift of Dúnachar from Elrond of Rivendell, Golodir prepares to assail Carn Dûm and drive the sword into the unseen heart of Mordirith, the murderous Steward of Angmar. Courage may bring hope, but a thirst for vengeance could spell doom....\q
<u>Sink or Swim</u>\n\qBingo has decided to master one final skill for his journey: he will learn to swim!\q

<u>A Minstrel's Hope</u>\n\qSeveral citizens of the besieged town of Trestlebridge have taken refuge in nearby caves, hoping to wait out the siege, but the Orcs have become aware of the townsfolk's hiding place. It is up to the minstrel Leigh Putnam and her friends to warn them....\q
<u>A Secret Meeting</u>\n\qSomething thought secret has been brought to light. Something thought dormant has awoken. The Longbeards may have need of a hero once more.\q
<u>The Storm Abated</u>\n\qArmed with proof of Shaidal's innocence, you approach Rothog the Storm with your findings.\q

A ship carrying weapons and supplies has broken up and the cargo is washing ashore in the Shield Isles. You have been asked to collect the salvageable supplies to keep them out of the hands of the Heirs of Castamir.

<u>Sharkey's Night</u>\n\qToo late I realized the treachery of Saruman. Far afield of Rhosgobel and the path of my errand, the reach of the White Hand spread to the Gladden Fields. There his servants sought the Ring he would not claim, and there they remain, forgotten in purpose... searching for naught.\q

<u>Ost Elendil</u>\n\qThe Black Númenóreans in league with Amarthiel have come to Ost Elendil, seeking to establish a foothold in Annúminas, while the Rangers of the North assail the city of their fathers in a desperate attempt to drive them forth.\q
<u>Eskil's Escape</u>\n\qWe will find and rescue Eskil Bloodthumb... and my lost axe as well!\q

<u>The Northcotton Farm</u>\n\qSeveral hobbits have disappeared recently in the vicinity of the Northcotton Farm. It was abandoned years ago, but something stirs within its grounds and a faint, sweet aroma wafts over the walls....\q

<u>Inn of the Forsaken</u>\n\qYou have been asked by the proprietor of the Forsaken Inn to investigate the source of a terrible wailing noise coming from the basement. Rumours abound that the inn is haunted and as a result, business has been suffering.\q
<u>Thievery and Mischief</u>\n\qWhile war raged in the South and the Rangers of the North were absent, brigands and ruffians took an opportunity to wrest control of Bree....\q
Ekhamâti soldiers are holding prisoners here. Free them and defeat the executioner before they can harm any more people!
<u>A Waxing Moon</u>\n\qFor what reason did the servants of the Enemy seal this hall? It is untouched by evil and disturbed only by dust.\q

<u>The Shadow Hunter</u>\n\qThe time has come to enter the dwarf ruin, Shathur-munzu. The Woodmen warned us of 'monsters' and 'The Shadow Hunter', but I remain unconvinced. Whatever lies inside, we are capable of defeating it.\q

<u>Dawn's Arrival</u>\n\qDespite all our efforts, evil still lingers in the world. It has crawled into the dark corners and deep places to hide from the light. I will not allow it to threaten one of our own. It will not hide from me anymore.\q
<u>The Mystery of Zul-mazal</u>\n\qTogether we will learn what secrets lie hidden within the walls of this chamber!\q
<u>The Council of Herubrand</u>\n\qHerubrand meets with his advisors to discuss the actions that they should take in response to the assault upon the Mead Hall of Woodhurst.\q
<u>Liberating Woodhurst</u>\n\qSensing that Woodhurst suffers from a lack of leadership, powerful men seek to guide the city in a direction that favours them.\q
<u>The Dreaming Dwarf</u>\n\qI say again: show yourself to us, villain! Only cowards hide behind such a veil of deception!\q
<u>Invitation for a Drink</u>\n\qArnwi invited Calin for a drink at the nearby inn. Herubrand is suspicious and requested you accompany Calin....\q
<u>The King Rides West</u>\n\qThéoden King has mustered a force of more than a thousand spears and prepares to ride for Isengard. Will he return to Edoras in this life?\q
<u>The Greymaul Rebellion</u>\n\qOnce seen, it was by the Mirrormere that Durin's heart dwelt evermore. When he went there to live, it was I, Mótsog, he left to rule Gundabad in his name.\q

<u>Woodhurst Has Fallen</u>\n\qA dark power waited in the shadows of Woodhurst for the moment to strike and watched while the city's champions squabbled among themselves. Now residing on the seat as Woodhurst's conqueror, the champions may be too weak to purge its growing influence....\q
Far from Angmar, upon the Gates of Gundabad, the Iron Crown keep watch over Elderslade as they seek to hold on to power in Gundabad….
<u>The Sunder-battle</u>\n\qThis was the plan of Durin, foolhardy as it must have seemed to those who cared for him: it began with his surrender.\q
<u>Beneath the Greenfields</u>\n\qThe goblins of Mount Gram have never forgotten their defeat at the hands of the Shire-folk, and revenge has brought them hither once more....\q

<u>Into the Abyss</u>\n\qWhat secrets lie in the depths of the Mordath? The little Dwarf-king and his people will soon know more than they dared imagine! Ah, but what is this? Another dwarf stands upon the threshold....\q
Far from Angmar, upon the Gates of Gundabad, the Iron Crown keep watch over Elderslade as they seek to hold on to power in Gundabad….
<u>The Legacy of Durin</u>\n\qThe battle was ended, but there were tears still to shed.\q

<u>A Road Through the Dark</u>\n\qWhile out for a night-time stroll in the Shire, there is a certain unpleasant feeling lingering about... something on the air is strange tonight. Perhaps it is only the unseasonable chill, or the great darkness of this particular evening. But surely it is nothing noteworthy, for this is the Shire, and it is rare indeed for any evil to touch this land.\q
<u>An Incident in the Camps</u>\n\qYou'll see. Whatever unruly outbreak there was among the refugees, my sword-thegn Athálrik will have dealt with it before you got there.\q

<u>The Tower of Orthanc</u>\n\qWelcome to the ring of Isengard, heroes. I have watched your progress with great interest. Prove yourselves worthy and I shall share with you the secrets of Middle-earth....\q
<u>Under the White Mountain</u>\n\qArvaethor accompanies you into a cavern underneath the White Mountains in an attempt to push back the Orkish forces from entering the Vale.\q
The wood-trolls known as the Taurogrim still haunt much of Eryn Lasgalen. If Gorgar rouses them to battle, they will pose a great threat….
The wood-trolls known as the Taurogrim still haunt much of Eryn Lasgalen. Deep in Grazadh-gropor, they spread their corruption among the trees….
<u>The Reach of Justice</u>\n\qYou have found Athálrik. But I wonder, will he submit to the justice of this land? He seems to care for it only as a guise.\q
<u>Last Wishes of the Lord of Langstrand</u>\n\qToday we are gathered to hear the last wishes of Golasgil, Lord of Anfalas, who fell in service of the kingdom.\q

<u>A Blade of Flame and Fury, Part 1</u>\n\qMizâdi's assault on Kûr Anzar has led her to the great tower. Just outside of it, I spot a familiar figure - Okhíso, leader of the Barkhûshim in Imhûlar, and slayer of Eshtali, my husband. A blood price is the only payment that will now satisfy her.\q

<u>Dungeons of Dol Guldur</u>\n\qThe Dungeons of Dol Guldur are famed for their terror. Thrain, father of Thorin Oakenshield, perished here... though not before passing his legacy to Gandalf the Grey....\q
<u>A Blade of Flame and Fury, Part 2</u>\n\qYou must quickly ascend the tower of Kûr Anzar. Okhíso must not escape what justice demands.\q
Although the Dwarves of Gabilshathûr are no longer trapped beyond the Rammas Deluon, its miners face new challenges as the creatures of Angmar reclaim the fallen realm.

<u>A Blade of Flame and Fury, Part 3</u>\n\qOkhíso, seeking to divert your attention, has set Kûr Anzar aflame. That was not enough to stay Mizâdi's blade but now the city needs to be saved. You must put out the fires and rescue trapped citizens in Kûr Anzar.\q

<u>The Treasure of Rohan</u>\n\qThe true treasure of Rohan does not lie in silver or gold, but in the herds of the noble horses which roam the plains of the Riddermark. Descended from the Mearas, these great beasts are prized by all, including the Dark Lord....\q
<u>Welcome to Harwick</u>\n\qAldor Harding requests your presence, and you can only hope that he has heard of your diligent labours on behalf of Harwick.\q

<u>A Captive Audience</u>\n\qKhûldim Umûn, the former overseer of Ambarûl under the Empire of Ordâkh, is believed to know the location of the Dubarâkh, a hidden library storing the knowledge of the lost history and culture of Ambarûl. Girhâzi has an idea to get her prisoner to reveal the location.\q

<u>Rise of the Fallen Son</u>\n\qThe shades of a Dunlending clan stir restlessly amid the barrows of the Lich Bluffs. What broken oath binds these poor spirits to the confines of this world? Perhaps the shade of one of their heroes holds the answer….\q
<u>Retake Weathertop</u>\n\qWeathertop... once a watch-tower of the Dúnedain, now a refuge for Orcs. Candaith the Ranger strives to break their foothold in the Weather Hills....\q

<u>The Tribunal of Shadows</u>\n\qAt last, we have tracked Gwyllion, whom the Dunlendings call the Old Woman of the Mountain, here to the Gravenwood. Whatever foul plot she has put in motion must be stopped at the Slade of Shadows....\q
Within the glittering caverns of Mesem-gairu lies a treasure trove of crystals, seemingly untouched….
<u>Missing Persons</u>\n\qMany have recently been taken captive by the Dievlig. I fear a grisly fate will befall our allies if they are not found and rescued quickly.\q
Within the glittering caverns of Mesem-gairu lies a treasure trove of crystals, wanted by many….
<u>Painting the Picture</u>\n\qAllow my words to paint a picture for you, my friend: a picture from long ago.\q
On the fringes of the South Downs, a tribe of goblins plans raids against the bastions of the Free People. Cull their number to keep the Free People safe.
<u>Starlight & Shadow</u>\n\qTurning Elvish relics to dark purposes, an evil sorcerer prepares to summon deadly shadows from the Void atop an ancient tower over Emyn Lûm.\q

<u>The Twisted Heart</u>\n\qLongbough the Ent has been roused to anger. The Wood-trolls of the Eavespire are acting in league with a Black Huorn which was once under the Ent's guidance, and Longbough is determined to put an end to their mischief....\q
<u>Something Has Awoken</u>\n\qWe must be careful. Maurûsh crawls with Orcs.\q
<u>Mistaken Identity</u>\n\qA frightful storm has descended upon the plains of Rohan, and it threatens to dampen Bingo's spirits!\q
A new chef has been entertaining all of Umbar with his delicious crab creations. Umbar is running low on crab. Aid the harvest on the bountiful Shield Isles.
Helm's Deep Prototype - Render Test
<u>Treasure Lost, Treasure Found</u>\n\qDid Theodore Gorse come this way? And if he did, can you and Bingo bring him to safety?\q
<u>Lights in the Land</u>\n\qEnraged by your assault upon Lashkarg, the Khundolar retaliate against the Rohirrim border-guard, bringing their strength down upon the way-post of Etheburg....\q
<u>Through the Blockade</u>\n\qThe end of Bingo's journey approaches with every step, but rumours tell of a blockade that might slow his progress along the road.\q
<u>Travellers in Ithilien</u>\n\qSuspicious of an unquenched fire in the distance, Faramir led Anborn and the Rangers to a camp-site where they discovered neither Man nor Orc.\q
Within Shalakâm, the ancient waterways of Gundabad, the ukhrâsh have roamed unchecked. Their years of clawing and digging threaten to collapse the ancient tunnels….
