<u>Halflings and Oliphaunts</u>\n\qAs he and the other Rangers prepared a trap for the Men of Harad at Cirith Negen, Mablung found his discussion with the Halflings loudly interrupted.\q
Within Shalakâm, the ancient waterways of Gundabad, many old gates direct the flow of water….
<u>The Forbidden Pool</u>\n\qDown beneath Henneth Annûn, in the Forbidden Pool, Anborn spied the gangrel-creature at last and called upon his captain and the Halflings to decide its fate.\q
<u>A Troubling Path</u>\n\qAfter returning to Henneth Annûn, Faramir called for Anborn to escort the gangrel-creature to answer for coming to the Forbidden Pool without permission.\q

<u>Show No Fear</u>\n\qThe captain of the Easterling scouts in the Rushgore threatens the Woodmen stranded in the marsh, precipitating a confrontation, with the welfare of the merchants hanging in the balance.\q
A band of Ordâkhai have invaded Gha Nêkha and are harassing the locals. You are to go there and handle the situation.
On a remote Shield Isle, a distinguished Umbari scholar lost his priceless research when he was attacked by large beetles. Recover the research and take the fight to these vile creatures.

<u>The Forgotten Treasury</u>\n\qMany ancient halls lie hidden beneath ages of ruin within the walls of Moria. The dwarves seek to recover and protect their treasures of old, while the Orcs seek to exploit them. Soon, the Forgotten Treasury may become a battleground of terrible proportions....\q\n
<u>Enter the Easterlings</u>\n\qThe Rohirrim outpost of Stangard is endangered by a small party of Easterling raiders. Can the outpost be defended?\q
At a ruin outside of the nearby village there is a terror growing among the turtles. The matron who watches over the clutch has grown increasingly aggressive and, sadly, must be put down.
<u>Bingo's Burden</u>\n\qThanks to his fear of horses, Bingo has decided that his journey in Rohan will take place on foot.\q

<u>First of the Heirs</u>\n\qAfter rallying the Ruthless Dead in Blackroot Vale, Azruthor returned to Tarlang's Crown. There, he now leads a great army that awaits his command to raze the lands of Anfalas to the west.\q

<u>Into the Silver Deep</u>\n\qWhile visiting the Refuge of Edhelion under the care of your master, you find yourself in the midst of a brutal attack by greedy dwarves of the Dourhand family. Their king, Skorgrím, thirsts for power with an unnatural lust, and you are in the eye of the storm.\q
<u>Thornholt</u>\n\qTBD.\q
<u>The Taming of the Mearh</u>\n\qHot-headed and brash, Eorl witnessed his father’s death and vowed to avenge him.\q
<u>The Deeping Wall</u>\n\qThe armies of Isengard have brought great ladders with which to scale the wall. Push them down, push them down!\q

<u>On These Stones</u>\n\qAmid the disappearance of Fastred's son and the siege of Walstow, a terrible sorceror of Mordor, Crúmgam, leads a vast force of Orcs in a ploy to bring Snowbourn and the entirety of the Eastemnet to ruin.\q
Orcs drive south along a tributary to the south of Maurûsh along the river. They intend to poison it, and you must stop them.
<u>An Audience with the Storm</u>\n\qMembers of the Kindred of the Coins take petitions from nobles throughout Umbar. Rothog has summoned you to his chambers to hear one specific complaint.\q
<u>Breaching the Necromancer's Gate</u>\n\qDol Guldur is a labyrinth of tight hallways and open courtyards. The Necromancer's Gate marks the entry into the heart of the fortress....\q

<u>Ancient Spirits</u>\n\qA great power of old lies hidden within the Mournshaws of Enedwaith, and spirits that once wandered the ancient world now roam these woods. Only by confronting these spirits will favour be garnered in the court of the Huntsman.\q
<u>Dour Faces</u>\n\qYou and Spalvi have climbed high into the Redhorn Pass, looking for cave entrances that might bring you closer to finding Bingo....\q
<u>Foray Against the Sorcerers</u>
<u>Khâshap's Assembly</u>\n\qDNT.\q
A group of day travellers has disappeared near Zahûmakh and haven't been seen in several days. Explore Zahûmakh and look for signs of the travellers.
<u>Thorog's Legacy</u>\n\qSigrun, a Dwarf in the Misty Mountains, has seen The Weeping Warrior and seeks to examine the corpse of dead Dragon, Thorog.\q
<u>Only Half-Remembered</u>\n\qI will bring you to my friend, but do not disturb his rest. My song keeps him at peace.\q
<u>Instance: Strange Passers-by</u>\n\qThe Ent Ashlimb wishes to relay a memory to you, for something troubles his slow, sleepy mind.\q
<u>A Chapter About Elves</u>\n\qBingo is excited to take a pleasant stroll in the sunlight, leaving the dark passages of Moria behind him....\q
The abandoned mines of Sundergrót still hold valuable ore and treasures, ripe for the taking. However, the goblin intruders stand in your way….
The abandoned mines of Sundergrót still hold valuable ore and treasures, ripe for the taking. However, the goblin intruders stand in your way….
The abandoned mines of Sundergrót still hold valuable ore and treasures, ripe for the taking. However, the goblin intruders stand in your way….
The abandoned mines of Sundergrót still hold valuable ore and treasures, ripe for the taking. However, the goblin intruders stand in your way….

<u>The Fall of Khazad-dûm</u>\n\qIn the year 1981 of the Third Age, the Longbeards made their final stand against the Balrog known as 'Durin's Bane'. The brave dwarves that defied the terror on that day would be the saviors of their people, but the fate of their kingdom was certain.\q

<u>The Dungeons of Naerband</u>\n\qThe tightening grip of Gondor has compelled Urudanî, the Maiden of Flame, to seek a stronger alliance with Thraknûl, chief torturer of Naerband. Together, they have reforged the prison of Direhold into a place of flame, iron, and anguish.\q

<u>The Changing Wind</u>\n\qAmalíbi, the rebel leader in Khûd Zagin, asked you to corner Bosóta Dôlo, a captain of the Ordâkhai occupiers to persuade him to assist the rebellion in exchange for his life and a return to his homeland.\q

<u>Sâri-surma</u>\n\qAn evil presence has descended upon the Ice Bay of Forochel, inhabiting a large glacial iceberg.  Having sent several hunters to defeat the evil, the Lossoth have asked you to help them destroy this evil once and for all....\q

<u>Garth Agarwen - Arboretum</u>\n\qOnce a lush garden the Arboretum's caretaker, Grimbark, was driven mad when the Red-maid fell to corruption. Now, Grimbark forces all vestige of uncorrupted life from the Arboretum making it a welcome home for The Dead.\q
<u>First Verse, Last Verse</u>\n\qWhat has happened? How is it I come to be here?\q
<u>The Retaking of Cair Andros</u>\n\qThe Faint-hearted, that I have dismissed, now wish to quell their shame by retaking the island fortress of Cair Andros, for Gondor.\q
<u>Humble Beginnings</u>\n\qWhat do you mean? Have you really decided to do this, then?\q
<u>Urugarth</u>\n\qLying on the outskirts of Carn Dûm is the fortress of Urugarth, home to countless Orcs, goblins, and other curs of Angmar.... The breeding grounds of Angmar's horde.\q
<u>A Restful Night</u>\n\qThe journey has been a tiring one already, and Bingo is ready to camp for the night in the wild of the Trollshaws....\q
<u>A Flurry of Fireworks</u>\n\qWhat a perfect evening for a fireworks celebration! Gandalf the Grey wishes to launch a grand fireworks display for the folks of Bree Town!\q

<u>Stoneheight</u>\n\qStoneheight was once a place of refuge from the Orc-tribes in the North Downs, but now their walls have been breached. Yet even as the houses burn and crumble to the ground, you notice that it was not Orcs alone that did this.\q
<u>A Dangerous Detour</u>\n\qBingo's quest to have an adventure full of excitement and daring has now brought him up the Bitter Stair, to the dangerous stronghold of Helegrod...\q
<u>The Ride of the Rohirrim</u>\n\qSix thousand spears have come to Gondor at her darkest hour. It will become the hour of Théoden and of Rohan!\q
Deep in the bounds of the Old Forest, a nest of venomous spiders lurks in wait for a morsel of Man, Elf, hobbit, dwarf, and more.

<u>Corruption's Source</u>\n\qDown twisting tunnels, through crystal-lined caverns, lies the source of the corrupted sarrowstones. As ancient evil cracks apart and decays a new threat bubbles forth, whispering poisoned words to its maddened worshippers.\q
<u>Voice on the Wind</u>\n\qRaphûz intends on finding Ashâmi, fearing she headed to her death because of his actions.\q
<u>Calenglad's Appeal</u>\n\qMeanwhile, Calenglad of the Dúnedain seeks for answers in the forest of the Mournshaws.\q

<u>One Hope Remains</u>\n\qWielding the broken sword Dunachar, Narmeleth leads a party by secret ways into the stronghold of Gador Gúlaran to face Mordirith, the Steward of Angmar, and Mordrambor his servant. It is hoped that Mordirith will remember the pain Dunachar inflicted upon him....\q
<u>The Wizard, the Queen, and the Kindred</u>\n\qWhat seems to be the problem here?\q

<u>Instance: Siege of Óinsbridge</u>\n\qWhen the Ungoledain were driven out of Kêr Bréin, many fled and hid in the woods near Óinsbridge. Now the lumber needed by the Zhélruka to rebuild is in grave danger of becoming entangled in the spider-clan's venomous webs.\q
<u>Calling On Cúridwan</u>\n\qWhat is it, Glorfindel? What have you seen?\q
<u>Trading Fates</u>\n\qHaving seen his people ride to safety at Edoras, Thane Mágla awaits death in his Mead Hall as the White Hand prepares to raze Middlemead.\q
<u>Escape From Naerband</u>\n\qThraknûl, the chief torturer of Naerband, has locked his prison fortress down and looks to capture anyone disobeying his twisted laws.\q
<u>Sammath Gûl</u>\n\qSammath Gûl are the chambers once occupied by the Dark Lord Sauron in the guise of the Necromancer of Mirkwood. Stained by his presence, few now dare enter here….\q
There are reports of ships disappearing in several of the northern Shield Isles of Jeb Khâtel. Investigate the islands and figure out what is happening to these ships and their crews.
<u>The Perilous Pact</u>\n\qA vision of Fram the Foremost, fighting a fierce mountain-drake, comes into view.\q

<u>Pits of Isengard</u>\n\qAhhh, you have found the Pits. What lies beneath is but a small taste of what I shall unleash upon Middle-earth. Man cannot stand against my power, and you too will perish.\q
<u>The Death of Scatha</u>\n\qA vision of Fram the Foremost and Karazgar, confronting the dreaded long-worm, Scatha, comes into view.\q

<u>Fram's Folly</u>\n\qFram was taken aback by his own demeanour. He loathed his unwillingness to mend the rift between the dwarves and the Ai-thúda. When he understood the curse upon him, he made a plan and acted upon it.\q
<u>Rise and Fall</u>\n\qWith the source of the unrest uncovered, Lhucu prepares to enter Lhan Gogledh and confront her father, Trehéarn. A task she dare not attempt alone.\q

<u>Root and Rot</u>\n\qThe denizens of the Old Forest stir restlessly, unnerved by lately-appearing strange creatures. Aware of the danger this poses to Buckland, Marigold Boffin has brought you to the forest to further investigate.\q

<u>The Anvil of Winterstith</u>\n\qThrice, in times gone by, the Anvil of Winterstith opened and I and my horde were unleashed upon the world. Now my great glacier is riven once again, so soon after I returned. Who could this be at my threshold? What little, foolhardy mortals would dare disturb my solitude? \q
<u>No Other Way</u>\n\qUp, up, up the stairs, gollum. Gollum. And then... the tunnel, yes... this way, good hobbitses... yes....\q

<u>The Temple of Utug-bûr - Thûr Hin</u>\n\qAs you enter Thûr Hin, the Lair of the Children, the smell hits you. Dust and copper, like blood in your mouth. A dozen wars were born here, along with thousands of soldiers. In the distance, you can hear two Utûgi arguing amongst themselves, their voices echoing through the musty hall.\q

<u>In The Face Of Loss</u>\n\qWracked with guilt at the thought that he could have saved his sons from their fate, Lord Duinhir has turned his back upon his duties, his people, and even his wife, Lady Rosfin. Although many now fear the worst, Steward Malthellam still holds hope that the Lord of the Blackroot Vale can master his grief, but only if he does not insist upon bearing it alone....\q

<u>The Temple of Utug-bûr Inner Sanctum</u>\n\qAs you step through the sanctum's threshold, the ground groans in disapproval, and an odorous, chilling wind rubs your bones. The wind carries mournful wails, whispers, and laughter from the dancing shadows at the edge of your vision. Within the heart of the sanctum a frenetic thrum begins, as if the shadow comes alive and echoes the rapid beating of your heart. Something in the darkness is aware of your presence.\q
<u>The Black Gate</u>\n\qWe have come to the very doorstep of Mordor to challenge the Dark Lord Sauron. There can be no turning back now.\q

<u>Of Axe & Fire</u>\n\qThe Uruks of Isengard have come to claim the last remaining trees of Nan Curunir - the grove of Quickbeam the Ent.\\n\\nShould these dark minions discover the presence of the Ents so close to Isengard, Saruman will bring his fires to bear upon Fangorn before his forces issue forth to face the Rohirrim.\q
<u>Scatha Awakens</u>\n\qAs Scatha scorched Fasthálla with his fiery breath, Frumgar and Fram took up arms against the dreaded long-worm.\q

<u>A Crack in the Iron Crown</u>\n\qAs the Gabil'akkâ presses onward to Gundabad, word has spread that a mysterious enemy has arrived at Caivád Sâr, threatening to turn the tide of the War of Three Peaks.\q
Brigand apothecaries are converting poison from usan-kûni. You need to destroy their workstations and defeat the apothecaries and their leader.

<u>Tremors Beneath Barad-dûr</u>\n\qAwoken by tremors in the dungeons of Barad-dûr, you and the other restless Stout-axes of Mordor seize the opportunity to speak without fear of punishment by the Dark Lord's servants.\q
<u>Mordor Triumphant</u>\n\qAnd so we come to it, at last. The battle surges all around us, and our last stand begins...\q

<u>The Ill-fated Feast</u>\n\qFram's celebration of the death of Scatha caused great excitement through neighbouring lands. Lords and emissaries prepared themselves for the feasting and revels to come.\q
Some travellers have gone missing after venturing near the crypts of Esh-kimâkhi. You are tasked with investigating the area around the crypts for signs of these travellers.

<u>A Venomous Strike</u>\n\qThe deadly Ungoledain now occupy these dwarf ruins on the outskirts of Thornholt and have been a menace to its inhabitants. They need to be driven away from the area before they can sow more of their venomous chaos.\q

<u>Springing the Trap</u>\n\qThe Rangers of the North have learned that Mordrambor, a Black Númenórean deep in the counsels of Amarthiel, is travelling to Haudh Elendil with a small retinue. Hoping to seize Mordrambor, the Rangers stage an ambush....\q
<u>In the Palace of the Swan</u>\n\qIt is good to see cheer restored to the Palace of the Swan. When last I was here, the mood was grim.\q
<u>Greet the Sun</u>\n\qYou have reached the East Gate of Moria at last, after a long and strenuous journey through the dark.\q
DNT

You have been asked to help identify infiltrators in the town of Herne. You are to ask for details on joining Sharkey's ranks and determine how many in the town might be aligned with the enemy out of the south.
Svalfang the Hill Giant ventures into the Wildwood, seeking payment for those he has killed.

<u>Stand at Amon Sûl</u>\n\qNot long ago a great battle was fought upon the peak of Weathertop between Gandalf the Grey and the Nine. Evil has been drawn to Amon Sûl, where the Ranger Candaith seeks to hold the hill for the Rangers of the North....\q
<u>The Perfect Recipe</u>\n\qThe day of the party has finally arrived, and Bingo has sent you outside to greet the arriving guests!\q

<u>Halls of Crafting</u>\n\qThere were no greater craftsmen than the Dwarves of Khazad-dûm. Those days are now gone, and Mazog's Orcs, with the aid of Black Uruks from Dol Guldur, have taken the ancient crafting halls of Moria to forge their vile weapons of war.\q

<u>The Secret Shadow</u>\n\qFor how long had this pass been concealed by the sorcery of the Nazgûl? Of this place, I have heard no tale from the Lord and Lady of Lorien nor from the Men of Gondor, but I dread what evils might lie hidden there, undisturbed by the fall of the Enemy.\q
<u>A Greater Power</u>\n\qThe hidden temple of the Thardúth stands before us.\q
<u>Return to Ashâgir</u>\n\qWe must reach the hidden chamber before it is too late!\q

<u>Garth Agarwen - Barrows</u>\n\qAt the height of their kingdom, the Men of Rhudaur enshrined their dead within great tombs of stone and built into the ground. At the crest of the tallest barrow, Ivar the Blood-hand, awaits any who would attempt to cleanse the corruption from the land and free the Red-maid from her service to the Darkness.\q
<u>Pit of the Falcon</u>\n\qMeanwhile, in Tâl Methedras, the thirst for vengeance drives Golodir of the Dúnedain to seek out Lheu Brenin, the treacherous leader of the Falcon Clan.\q
<u>The Madness In His Eyes</u>\n\qI wish we need not make use of the Hungry Fire... but we have no choice!\q
<u>Sigileth In The Darkness</u>\n\qGreat evil resides within this place. We should find my sister and get out of here!\q

<u>Haudh Valandil</u>\n\qThe Lords of Umbar, sorcerers trained by Sauron, the great Necromancer, seek to bring terror to Annúminas by raising the long-dead remains of Valandil, third King of Arnor, as a terrible wight. Only the most courageous of the Free Peoples will be able to put an end to their evil deeds....\q
<u>Raiders In Tûm Rost</u>\n\qThe people of Iáphel suffer at the hands of the Corsairs. The smell of burning grapes hangs on the air...\q

<u>Boss from the Vaults: Storvâgûn</u>\n\qHigh in the cliffs above Helegrod, the traitorous Storvâgûn has pledged the giants of the Misty Mountains to the service of Angmar in exchange for vast riches.\q
<u>Blood of the Black Serpent</u>\n\qAs the Battle of the Pelennor Fields intensifies, the forces of Rohan and Gondor unite to defeat the Men of Harad and their vile King: The Black Serpent.\q

<u>Ending the Nightmare</u>\n\qThe Mokúrz-hai have become a plague to the people of the Dunbog. Blaire of the Boar-clan has asked you to accompany him into Lhan Colvarn to end this threat once and for all.\q
The Lonely Mountain of Erebor, a stronghold of the North, must be defended at all costs….

<u>The Abyss of Mordath</u>\n\qDetermined to wield the lost Ring of Power Manthríf once more, King Váskmun Greytooth has led his Firehorn Dwarves into the Abyss of Mordath, where the sunken foundations of Barad-dûr now rest. Meanwhile, the Order of the Eye has made haste to pursue the Firehorns, eager to avenge their fallen and contest the dwarves' claim to the greatest artifacts of the Dark Lord. Unbeknownst to any of them, greater still are the terrors Sauron hid away in the shadows of the Mordath....\q
<u>War Comes to Rohan</u>\n\qLanghold is under attack by brigands, and worse yet -- their new Khundolar allies from the East.\q

<u>The Forges of Isengard</u>\n\qIt would appear that Saruman has been attempting to craft an abundance of Legendary Weapons to fortify the armouries of the White Hand. This forge should be a wealth of useful Legendary components; these will serve the Free Peoples far better than the smiths of Saruman.\q
Goblin-town has long been a thorn in the side of the free peoples in Rhovanion. Once again, the goblin horde inside stirs….

<u>The Waiting Night</u>\n\qWe have prevailed upon the innkeeper to allow the residents of Herne to shelter within Crossway House for the night, for I fear that whatever evil came to this town will be back.\q
Goblin-town has long been a thorn in the side of the free peoples in Rhovanion. Once again, the goblin horde inside stirs….

<u>Cease to Resist</u>\n\qYou have arrived at the location of the ancient forge, high atop Hurmulkezer. The ancient forge has not been used for some time and is capable of creating powerful weapons.\q

<u>Assault on Archet</u>\n\qJon Brackenbrook and his hunters have reached the outskirts of Archet to find it already ablaze! A desperate struggle to save their village is about to begin. Hopefully you have arrived in time....\q
<u>The Council of the Captains</u>\n\qAragorn has called for a council to determine his next course of action. May wisdom guide his steps!\q
<u>Defence of The Prancing Pony</u>\n\qThe inhabitants of Bree have spent the occupation holed up within The Prancing Pony. Angered at their uprising, the brigands have decided to burn them out....\q
Within the halls of Cútaig, the most vicious Wargs of Gundabad are bred. There, even the most skilled of hunters must tread with care lest they become the hunted….
TBD…
<u>The Ambush</u>\n\qOrcs and Easterlings have set a trap for the Host of the West, but now we seek to foil the ambush before it can be sprung.\q
Travellers speak of shifting lights enticing them from the roads toward the ruins of Gorthad. You have intrepidly entered the ruin to investigate and root out the source of this evil.
DNT
<u>By Secret Steps</u>\n\qI will not lead the Host of the West into Dagorlad without knowing what awaits us. I have sent trustworthy friends to scout before us on the battle-plain.\q

<u>Dahâl Huliz, The Arena</u>\n\qThe gladiator pits of Umbar Baharbêl are an instrumental aspect of the Umbaran culture. The battles in the arena of Umbar serve many purposes to the city. Foremost, the arena battles entertain the masses. Second, the arena battles serve to mete out justice against the city's greatest offenders. Since taking control of Umbar, the Kindred of the Coins altered the arena's rules. Capital punishment and wanton death are a thing of the cruel past. Combat is now a sport for the masses to engage with and enjoy. Anyone can enter the pit to enhance their glory. The gladiators bound to the arena serve their sentences by entering battle and fighting to the end....\q
DNT

<u>Webs of the Scuttledells</u>\n\qThe Great Spiders of Mirkwood have begun to stir again, and the Elves of Thranduil, King of Mirkwood seek to learn the cause. What dire darkness has arisen within the wood to summon forth such evil?\q
<u>A Candle Flickers in the Dark</u>\n\qKhôltekh has asked you to help him find and catch Sêkhta. He believes Sêkhta is an Archivist, a historical scholar working and living in the Tor-gardens.\q
<u>Battle For the Upper Reaches</u>\n\qGazathrug, the Orc Captain of the Upper Reaches, fears losing his hold on Máttugard, a fear that is finally coming to fruition.\q

<u>Fornost</u>\n\qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q
DNT
Traverse the steps of Caranost, and make your way deeper into the Orc-held ruins as you drive the foe from the field of battle.
Within the Wildwood sits the village of Cotfast, a home to rogues and villains.

<u>The White-hand in Darkness</u>\n\qSaruman's attempts to bring the Orcs of Moria under his sway will only be ended when his minions perish. The valour of the dwarves must be relied upon in these dark times. At Stazgnâkh, the White Hand must be cut off....\q
<u>The Defence of Minas Tirith</u>\n\qThe War for Gondor begins as Sauron's armies march for Minas Tirith. Can the Men of Gondor master their fear before the Enemy claims the White City?\q
<u>Stilling the Wade</u>\n\qSeeking to avenge the wrongs done to her people, Éowyn rides east to drive the White Hand from the Wade once and for all.\q
<u>The Hornburg</u>\n\qThe Hornburg is all that stands between Saruman's army and the fall of Rohan. Aragorn stands defiant upon the ramparts of the gate-house. Dawn will come soon.\q
Ekhamâti soldiers are camped nearby. Steal their weapon caches and deal with any enemies you encounter.
<u>The Auction</u>\n\qAll is ready for the auction. It is an event not unlike a warrior's arena, for my clan is accustomed to waging war with words and coin....\q
Uruks within the ruins are an affront to every Elf. You are asked to enter the ruins and drive out the foe, purging the filth they bring to the Elven homes.

<u>The Lord of Iron</u>\n\qPower is a heavy burden. I, Náin the Slakeless, son of Dáin Ironfoot, Lord of the Iron Hills, feel the crushing weight of the decisions I must make, and the lives that hang in the balance. There is much to consider. Now, who is this that comes before me?\q

<u>Fangs of the Wulf</u>\n\qOf all the Ox-clan, I am the most canny, for I know best how to create my own opportunities... a broken sword here, a shattered shield there, and a crippled arm to wield them. Men, arms, and armour do not come cheaply.\q
<u>Many Worries</u>\n\qMeanwhile, Halbarad of the Dúnedain struggles to decide the best course of action for the Rangers under his command.\q
The All-seeing are assaulting Kûr Anzar! Destroy their makeshift fortifications and repel the invading Barkhûshim forces.
<u>A Dangerous Road</u>\n\qHaving loaded their waggon and bid their friends good-bye, Runald's family departs from Elthengels. A most dangerous road lies before them....\q

<u>Sarch Vorn, the Black Grave</u>\n\qBefore the fall of Cardolan, in the aftermath of the war with Angmar and the Great Plague that followed, countless dead were laid to rest in mass burials among the stones of a ruined temple of the Edain. Its name of old long since forgotten, it came to be known as Sarch Vorn, the black grave, and through centuries of abandonment, none save the most foolish or greedy dared approach it. But now the Witch-king of Angmar has returned to rouse the barrow-wights from their slumber and summon forth an ancient evil thought banished long ago: the Grey Fear...\q
Trolls and their ilk have occupied and sullied a once proud hall within Gundabad.
<u>Voyage of the Wave-hunter</u>\n\qAnd so the voyage of the Wave-hunter begins! Umbar awaits...\q

<u>Thrór's Hammer</u>\n\qDwalin, lord of Thorin's Hall has tasked the Heroes of Eriador with recovering Thrór's hammer from the tomb of Skorgrím, where the Dourhands have enshrined it as a memorial of victory over Durin's Folk....\q
<u>The Day the Giant Came</u>\n\qNow that the escapees from Dunfast have recovered their strength and their hope, you must endeavour to pry their tale from them.\q

<u>The Gates of Carn Dûm</u>\n\qUsing the scroll of the Hillmen, a key to the gates of Carn Dûm has been forged. Now the Heroes of Eriador and Lorniel, daughter of Golodir, must pass the gates of the iron fortress and free the Ranger from the clutches of Mordirith, the Steward of Angmar....\q

<u>Deep in the Darkening Wood</u>\n\qDeep within Mirkwood, an ancient enemy has returned. A Beorning trader is lost within a maze of trees and thorns, predators closing in around him. Find a way through, and save him before it is too late.\q

<u>Salves for a Ravaged Land, Part 2</u>\n\qThe road to Kûgrun, home of Cúridwan, the Golden Maiden is treacherous. Dangers both seen and unseen move against you. Keep your wits about you, for there are many who would wish you ill in your journey.\q
<u>Into the Circle of Madness</u>\n\qTo further the conquest of Minas Morgul, we must capture the Star-gazers' Spire in the Circle of Madness.\q
<u>A Wedding at Midsummer</u>\n\qIt was on Midsummer's Day that folk from near lands and far came to the White City to witness the Great Wedding.\q

<u>Salves for a Ravaged Land, Part 3</u>\n\qKûgrun. My home, my golden sanctuary. It is impossible for many to find, but impossible for others to miss. Those who seek out its comforts in good faith find welcome company, and sometimes, even answers to seemingly impossible questions.\q

<u>An Echo of Days Past</u>\n\qWhile Frithgeir prepares the brew that will restore the sense of our host, an ancient dwarf who has lived long and seen much, our company decides what should next be done...\q
<u>The Wedding Banquet</u>\n\qLong into the night, the folk of the city made merry and celebrated the union of King Elessar and Queen Arwen.\q
<u>Salves for a Ravaged Land, Part 4</u>\n\qYou have brought all the ingredients back to Cúridwan to create a salve to cure the Lâg Dávrit, the Pale Blight afflicting Vartúlin.\q

<u>Salves for a Ravaged Land, Part 5</u>\n\qNow we return to Vartúlin, buoyed by our triumph. But something seems amiss, the wind tastes bitter. Thórvilon is gathered with others near Milingor's Veroth. What has happened?\q

<u>Garth Agarwen</u>\n\qGarth Agarwen… the ruins of an ancient fortress of Rhudaur, now overrun by corrupted nature and a vile necromantic power out of Angmar. The most terrible power still remains to be confronted.\q

<u>Honour and Treachery</u>\n\qYour journey to avenge Léofdag has led you to the Pelennor Fields, while Fastred, Reeve of the Sutcrofts, seeks the foe that once sought to deliver ruin upon his lands and family. With your paths now aligned, you must strike as one against the treachery of the Enemy.  \q
Deep under the Three Peaks of Gundabad, nameless things have constructed a shrine to Throkhâr The Hunger, their lord….

<u>Darkness Revealed</u>\n\qNot only the shades of Oathbreakers wander the barrows of the Lich Bluff. Some dark Power has raised a horde of wights in service to the enemy. Only by travelling into the darkest recesses of an ancient barrow can the source of this evil be uncovered….\q
Captain Lachír's single fixation has taken him and his men deep into Anglach. But what is this miraculous metal he claims to have found there? Can good truly come out of the forges of darkness?
The Barkhûshim took with them historical artifacts and scrolls when they fled Kûr Anzar. You are tasked with recovering these artifacts and defeating any Barkhûshim who move to stop you.
High in the tower of Bekâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad prepare for war. In their keeping are weapons of dwarf-make, stolen long ago in the sack of Gundabad….
In the armoury of Ashmâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad make ready their weapons of war. Little do the Trolls of Gundabad fear, for their own might is enough….
High in the tower of Bekâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad prepare for war. Stored there to feed the war effort, many Orkish provisions have been left poorly-guarded….
In the armoury of Ashmâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad make ready their weapons of war. Many ballistae peer from its battlements, keeping watch on the gates of Gundabad below….
High in the tower of Bekâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad prepare for war. Among them, Ushgoth the Mighty makes ready to enact his plans on the battlefield….
In the armoury of Ashmâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad make ready their weapons of war. Rumours speak of an Orc of Angmar drawn into Gorgar's service….

<u>The Feast of the Running Stag</u>\n\qElder Riagán has welcomed you to Lhan Tarren and invited you to join in the Feast of the Running Stag, the Stag Clan's annual ritual. You should join your friends at the feast and respectfully observe the rites.\q
<u>A Dark Gift</u>\n\qYou must move quickly into Angar Aragín to save Numûru!\q
<u>A Promise Kept</u>\n\qRaphûz invited you to speak with him after you assisted him at Telperiën's Wall.\q
Atop the Drearspire, cold-drake emisarries have been sighted giving aid to the Angarmarim.

<u>An Eye in the Storm</u>\n\qThe view from Weathertop is wide, and many have climbed that great hill to see all that could be seen. You have been brought hither to learn of the subtle influences connecting runes with nature, for words and speech-craft hold much sway over many powers in Middle-earth.\q
After reclaiming Gabilazan from the Dourhands and their foul allies, the Dwarves of Durin's Folk must now contend with the other inhabitants of the Misty Mountains.
Deep within a cavern, there are bunches of crystals that have been twisted by dark magic. Angmarim have driven a pack of wargs into this cavern hoping to corrupt the beasts.
The Orcs and Wargs have returned to Shathur-munzu, attempting to set up a new base south of the warfront….
The Orcs and Wargs have returned to Shathur-munzu, attempting to set up a new base south of the warfront….

<u>Dúnedain Past and Present</u>\n\qLothrandir, a Ranger of the North, has joined thee in thy quest to find a lost Arnorian treasure in Forochel. Thy only hope of finding it may lie with the shade of Arvedui, last King of Arthedain.\q
<u>The Power of Oaths</u>\n\qWith the key of Agoroth in hand, the time has come to find the door to the hidden fortress, deep within the caves of ice.\q

<u>Instance: Awake At Long Last</u>\n\qYou have finally had some measure of success, for Oldheart seems quite awake for the first time in an age...but you are filled with trepidation, for some great power has woken with him. You feel it in your very bones.\q

<u>The Bounty Hunter</u>\n\qBasil Gummidge hired adventurers from throughout Eriador to bring the ruffians and tomb-robbers of Evendim to justice, but now a notorious tomb-robber, Cuthbert Sprunt, has placed a bounty upon the arbiter's own hunters....\q
<u>The Ruthless Dead</u>\n\qThe Dimholt road leads to the Dark Door and the paths beneath the Haunted Mountain, where the Dead walk. Few dare to go that way.\q
<u>The Defence of Faldham</u>\n\qThane Elfmar has rallied the Elfward for the coming assault against Faldham, hoping to repel the assembled White Hand force.\q

<u>The Vile Maw</u>\n\qWhither did the Watcher in the Water flee when it was driven from its lake? The Vile Maw would be my guess. Beneath the waters of the dark flood are ways which lead into the black depths of Moria....\q
A group of Corsairs based on the Cape of Umbar has been striking out into the Bay of Belfalas, harrying merchant ships. Take the fight to them!

<u>Of Dreams and Desires</u>\n\qIn days long past, I knew her as Tárasánë, the Green Lady, but the wickedness of the Necromancer and the great spiders of Ungoliant tainted the Greenwood and she was lost. What has become of her? Has she departed these lands evermore? Even now, I cannot say.\q

<u>A Formal Complaint</u>\n\qAn attempt to lodge a formal complaint on behalf of the glassblower, Hob Hillbrow, led to a violent encounter with the Chief's Men. The time has come to put the ruffians in their place....\q
In the far eastern edges of Angmar lies The Rift. The passage through the mountains there is one of few that the Iron Crown has taken to the slopes of Gundabad….
In the far eastern edges of Angmar lies The Rift. The passage through the mountains there is one of few that the Iron Crown has taken to the slopes of Gundabad….

<u>The Fallen Kings</u>\n\qIt is said that the nine Nazgûl would assemble, in those days of battle, to best their greatest adversaries and to strike relentless fear into those who dared face them in combat.\q
<u>Muckle: Fangorn</u>\n\q Within the forest of Fangorn there is an ancient battle taking place.\q

<u>Instance: Reclamation of the Steel Keep</u>\n\qThe daring may choose to enter the Steel Keep in search of its ancient secrets. Yet they would do well to be wary. Although Karazgar has been driven from those halls, they remain far from safe to trespass.\q
A lovely day for pitching in on the farm without the fear of anything untoward happening at all.
<u>Heirloom of Rhudaur</u>\n\qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted cup have led you to a temple most foul....\q

<u>Sons of the Usurper</u>\n\qAfter learning of Azgarzôr's whereabouts in Lebennin, Erchar and Herion rally at your side to avenge Garvir as Jajax prepares to deal a devastating blow to the Heirs of Castamir before they can lead Umbar to ruin.\q

<u>The Deeping Wall</u>\n\qThe dike has been overrun. Now, the full weight of Saruman's army prepares to crash down upon the valiant defenders upon the ramparts of the Deeping Wall. The wall must stand or the fortress will surely fall.\q

<u>Skorgrím's Heir</u>\n\qHigh within Tûr Fúar, the Drearspire, Brathar Crack-helm, lord of the Dourhands, has issued a challenge to the legendary Longbeard, Glóin, seeking to avenge his supposed ancestor, Skorgrím, and restore the place of his people among the Seven Houses of the Dwarves.\q
The fortress of Skarháld is under attack! The Frost-horde has launched an assault from parts unknown in Ered Mithrin in hopes to drive the dwarves away….
A raiding party from Gundabad has been spotted approaching the fortress of Skarháld, in Ered Mithrin. No different than all other Gundabad raiding parties, this one seeks to slay all in their path….
<u>Speak the Words</u>\n\qThe Emissary awaits. It is time to speak the words.\q
<u>Imminent Collapse</u>\n\qOndor the Dwarf seeks to collapse the tunnels from which the Orcs waylay the innocent, avenging the death of his father and sealing the doom of his foes.\q
Commander Rangvald trains dwarves for battle at the fortress of Skarháld, in Ered Mithrin….
<u>The Rescue</u>\n\qWe will rescue your friends, and we will have vengeance upon the Falcon Clan. You have my word.\q
A remnant of the lost Dwarf-kingdom of Grárik, Skarháld has long-endured both the harsh climes of Ered Mithrin and the wrath of dragon-kind. However, the Frost-horde knows well its weaknesses….

<u>The Word of a Healer</u>\n\qThe Dourhands have long scouted the lands near the dwarf-keep Othrikar, and they now move to attack the outpost of our friends. The good sentries of Othrikar are stout warriors, but they will be outnumbered, and their victory over the Dourhand menace is far from being assured by the odds as they stand.\q

A remnant of the lost Dwarf-kingdom of Grárik, Skarháld has long-endured both the harsh climes of Ered Mithrin and the wrath of dragon-kind. Beneath the Keep of Tharrazhâr lie tunnels of most beautiful crystal, but that is not all that lurks within….

<u>The Depths of Kidzul-Kalah</u>\n\qThe dwarves left deep scars in the earth, and in their absence terrible things have moved into the dark pits. The waters of the Gladden merely halted their spread. With your aid I might end this threat... for good.\q
** Translate Me **

<u>A Steed Like No Other</u>\n\qA vicious and most dangerous lynx stalks the townsfolk of the Yondershire. Adamanda North-took will not rest until she has defeated this most deadly foe and saved her village. She needs your help to bring down this beast!\q

<u>Barad Guldur</u>\n\qBarad Guldur is the chief tower of Dol Guldur. From here, the Necromancer once viewed Greenwood the Great. Now the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur forays from this perch in search of the Company of the Ring….\q
<u>Sammath Gûl</u>\n\qSammath Gul are the chambers once occupied by the Dark Lord Sauron in the guise of the Necromancer of Mirkwood. Stained by his presence, few now dare enter here...\q

<u>Iorbar's Peak</u>\n\qA stone-giant dwelling upon Iorbar's Peak has taken an egg from the eyries of the Great Eagles. Gwaihir the Windlord has requested that you brave the storms of the mountain and safely secure the egg before it becomes the giant's next meal.\q
Girhâzi has given the order to clear the Ordâkhai out of Omboha, their camp to the north of Iridír.
<u>Into the Circle of Sorrow</u>\n\qTo further the conquest of Minas Morgul, we must capture the Tower of Treegarth within the Circle of Sorrow.\q

Uruk embattlements set into the side of the hills threaten the land below. But it is the leaders in these forces that wield the true power. You are tasked with finding and eliminating the leaders of the Uruks at this encampment.
<u>In the Presence of Saruman</u>\n\qThe Old Man wants you. You had better do what he says, if you know what's best for you. Ha! With the power of his voice you won't have a choice!\q

A particularly brutal Orc captain has made the old tower of Tharbad his base of operations.\nYou have been asked to clear the courtyard approaching the tower of defenders to open the way for an attack on the tower itself.

<u>Goblin-town Throne Room</u>\n\qIn the darkest depths of Goblin-town, at the heart of the goblin kingdom, teeming with the vile breed, lay the throne room of the Great Goblin. Long have the inhabitants of Goblin-town been leaderless, but as the Shadow in the East grows, calling its minions to arms, a new leader has taken the mantle of the Great Goblin....\q

<u>The Deeping-coomb</u>\n\qSaruman's foul sorcery has destroyed the Deeping Wall and driven the Rohirrim into the Deeping-coomb. The retreat to the Glittering Caves and the Hornburg must be secured if there is to be any hope.\q
A group of Longbeard explorers are in trouble and Prince Ingór wishes for the Zhélruka Clan to come to their aid….
<u>The Wizard's Vale</u>\n\qI was the steward of Saruman's household, and ran his affairs from day to day. I was accorded high honour, and would still were it not for Gríma, the Wormtongue.\q
<u>Weapons of the Enemy</u>\n\qPlagued by terrible dreams in the House of Elrond, Laerdan reveals in his sleep that Amarthiel's ring, Narchuil, is being held in the fastness of Barad Dúrgul.\q
<u>Helm's Dike</u>\n\qThe rampart across Helm's Dike will be the first line of defence. But for how long will it hold?\q
<u>Escape from Isengard</u>\n\qWe do this now or not at all, friend. There is no looking back. We will escape from Isengard or we will die. But we will not stay here.\q

<u>Barad Tironn</u>\n\qA clue found upon the body of one of the Angmarim reveals that the Elf Laerdan may still be held at Barad Tironn in Annúminas, where he was captured by Amarthiel's minions. It can only be hoped that he yet lives.\q
A prominent Umbari noble has vanished during a routine trip to the Shedax Khîn in the Shield Isles, near an isle where it's rumoured the dead walk freely. Investigate and rescue any trapped sailors.
<u>Núrzum</u>\n\qWhile I remain behind, my friends journey to Byre Tor to see what they can learn of Núrzum. Perhaps I worry unnecessarily, but what will I do if they are unable to return?\q

<u>Farewell to Evendim</u>\n\qThe Ranger Calenglad has long stood watch over the ancient city of Annúminas, in Evendim. If he is to join the Grey Company on its southern road, he will need to leave that city behind...\q

<u>Lothrandir of the Frozen Wastes</u>\n\qThe Ranger Lothrandir has knowledge of the southern lands through which the Grey Company must pass, but he will only take that road once he is certain the Lossoth of Forochel are free of danger...\q

<u>Helm's Dike</u>\n\qHelm's Dike forms the first barrier of defence for Rohan's final stand. The rearguard left here must buy time for the defenders to prepare the fortress and wall for the oncoming siege. Saruman's army marches, angry and ready for war.\q
<u>Unnatural Winter</u>\n\qI was born in Dunfast, many years ago. What has happened to the village I remember?\q
<u>The Hornburg</u>\n\qThe Hornburg is all that stands between Saruman's army and the fall of Rohan. Aragorn stands defiant upon the ramparts of the gate-house. Dawn will come soon.\q
<u>The Bloom</u>\n\qCorudan says they have planted the seed of Núrzum's defeat, and we need only wait for it to bloom. Is he right? Can we trust this Ent?\q
Crebain have been stealing helms and hats from the good citizens of Urmâkh. A local scout has tracked them to Ghât Okho. You are to recover the headwear from these brazen winged thieves.

<u>Will of the Stormhammer</u>\n\qDetermined to aid his son, Durin, and the Dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ to reclaim Mount Gundabad, King Thorin Stonehelm hopes to enlist an unexpected ally at the Lonely Mountain.\q

<u>The Water Wheels: Nalâ-dûm</u>\n\qDeep in the abysses of Moria, the dwarves had once crafted a great waterway to bring water in from the mountains. Something now blocks the great wheels from turning, causing the Iron Garrison concern.\q\n
<u>One More Journey</u>\n\qMeanwhile, Saeradan of the Dúnedain travels north with the bodies of his fallen brethren, determined to lay them to rest.\q
<u>The Horn of Gondor</u>\n\qSomeone cut a mighty swath through the Uruks in the East Wall, but was it enough to save our mutual friends from certain death?\q

<u>Scion of Winter</u>\n\qVethúg Wintermind - that is a name long-hated by the dwarves. He, the vile cold-drake whose frost once choked the halls of Thikil-gundu in the Grey Mountains, now comes to Erebor in vengeance. We have been granted little respite from battle, but we must stand against him or all shall be lost.\q
<u>And Is Extinguished</u>\n\qKhôltekh believes that Sêkhta is stealing the Candle of Umbar, a ship docked in the Sail-haven. Help him apprehend Sêkhta!\q
<u>Sabotaging Kûr Anzar</u>\n\qAssist Razâl and Numûru on a mission into Kûr Anzar to weaken the Barkhûshim.\q

<u>A Final Reckoning</u>\n\qAnd so the Battle of Azanulbizar was ended. Although Azog and some ten thousand of his kin lay dead, the battle had exacted a heavy toll on the Dwarves of the Haban'akkâ. Yet, in the mind of King Thráin, the Sixth War of the Dwarves and Orcs was not yet finished.\q
<u>Ashâmi's Challenge</u>\n\qAshâmi must face a fearsome serval terrorizing the people of Urmâkh to earn favour with Numûru.\q
<u>The Captive</u>\n\qThe emissary of Isengard captured by the Falcon Clan is near to death. Lheu Brenin hopes to get information from the captive before he passes.\q
<u>Hobnanigan Field</u>\n\qA fun game of Hobnanigans is about to start. Join the Hobbits in their most favourite game!\q
<u>Heirloom of the Wild Men</u>\n\qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted figurine have led you to a remote cave....\q
<u>To a Ranger's Aid</u>\n\qAmdir, quickly falling into the shadows of the wraith-world, has slain two of his brethren already and seeks the blood of a third....\q
The safety of the small outpost of Hrimbarg in the Misty Mountains is under threat from the winged beasts of the Frost-horde….
<u>Heeding the Call</u>\n\qWe can not allow Rhosgobel to fall into the claws of the Ungoledain!\q
<u>Heirloom of Khazad-dûm</u>\n\qThe words of Galadriel before her Mirror surface in your memory....\q
Sírlond, the encampment outside of the ruins of Caranost, is under siege. Enter the fray and bolster the free peoples' forces.
The Dumûri have learned the Ordâkhai in Eshadûr have restocked their supply of black powder. Your mission is to destroy it before it can be put to use.
<u>Mekeb-faham</u>\n\qThe Dwarves of Moria had a rich history. Their scholars worked diligently transcribing plans, tactics, and epic stories to parchment so that they might remember the past.\q
<u>The Inner Circle</u>\n\qScout-master Ausma has taken the lead on a mission to infiltrate Shakhajât, the seat of power of Warlord Dushtalbúk and his Frost-bound hobgoblins.\q
<u>The Apprentices Attack</u>\n\qScout-master Ausma has charged you and her three apprentices with dismantling the Angmarim forces in the Pit of Stonejaws in one fell swoop.\q

<u>To Ausma's Aid</u>\n\qThe scouts Kyrstig, Molkha, and Klúso have stormed the hobgoblin fortress Shakhajât to rescue their master, Ausma. But it is not clear if they are too late, or if their help was needed at all.\q

<u>The Deeping Wall</u>\n\qThe dike has been overrun. Now, the full weight of Saruman's army prepares to crash down upon the valiant defenders upon the ramparts of the Deeping Wall. The wall must stand or the fortress will surely fall.\q

<u>The Deeping Wall</u>\n\qThe dike has been overrun. Now, the full weight of Saruman's army prepares to crash down upon the valiant defenders upon the ramparts of the Deeping Wall. The wall must stand or the fortress will surely fall.\q

<u>The House of Isildur</u>\n\qIn the year 1975 of the Third Age, a party of Dúnedain led by the brothers Laegened and Haerdor travelled north into Forochel to reclaim the relics left behind in the flight from the wreck of Fornost...\q
A group of visiting Dourhands has become very disruptive….

<u>The Cost of Loyalty</u>\n\qAfter contemplating a vile symbol recovered from brigands, Doron, leader of the Oathbreakers in Parth Celebrant, has chosen to confess how he and his men came to be cursed.\q
<u>An Echo in the Mountains</u>\n\qHe is there! But what is he doing?\q
<u>A Journey Into Danger</u>\n\qWe must speak only quietly, or we shall be discovered.\q
<u>The Snows Come Again</u>\n\qYou cannot ignore the shiver that travels down your spine as the cold air creeps in over Byre Tor.\q
Dourhands have found the Glimmerdeep and seek to mine what they can from its depths….

<u>As Near As May Be</u>\n\qA skilled jewel-crafter has crossed our path, and Halbarad has devised a curious plan for him. He wants imitations made of the ring of Barahir borne by Aragorn for each Dúnadan in our company...\q
Dourhands have found the Glimmerdeep and seek to mine what they can from its depths….
Dourhands have found the Glimmerdeep and seek to mine what they can from its depths….
The dreaded two-headed troll Stûg-and-Zar lurks within this cavern….

<u>Sunken Labyrinth</u>\n\qYour search for Faramir leads you to the subterranean tunnels under Osgiliath, where he may have fled to escape an enraged fell beast. Shed light on the Ranger's disappearance by delving into the darkness.\q

<u>A Thirst for Blood</u>\n\qI of all my companions understand the thirst for blood. It burns in those who have seen tragedy... but Reeve Fastred must put aside his thirst, for a horde comes that knows no mercy, and only the blood of the Men of the Sutcrofts will be forfeit....\q

<u>Fornost</u>\n\qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q
<u>Survival: Barrow-downs</u>\n\qThose who have long haunted the Barrow-downs at the command of the Witch-king are angered by your intrusion. Surviving is the least of your newfound concerns....\q

<u>Marked by the Sea Shadow</u>\n\qBeset by a sudden murder, I set out to capture the person responsible... and insodoing, revealed a much larger plot... one whose shadow is cast far and wide over land and sea. We shall bring this person to justice, one way or another.\q

<u>Frodo's Burden</u>\n\qI am concerned for Frodo, for he bears a great burden. It is my hope that those whom I have sent to watch over the hobbit will determine if his mind remains strong enough for the task for which he has been chosen....\q

<u>Constables and Robbers</u>\n\qBrigands out of the Brown Lands have established a camp in the Rushgore from which to raid Parth Celebrant for ancient relics. After a diplomatic attempt to remove the brigands from the Rushgore, Aculf prepares to take more drastic measures....\q
The Ordâkhai torturer Dokhára is holding several Ambarûli people prisoner in Eshadûr. The prisoners must be saved from a horrible fate.

<u>Plans of the Golden Host</u>\n\qThe Golden Host of Lothlórien has crossed the river Anduin, but now a second, smaller party must follow in its wake. These are the Elves of the Hidden Guard, chosen to bring the prisoner Mazog to the gates of Dol Guldur.\q
<u>Keeper of the Dead</u>\n\qDolenthol, a Ranger of Ithilien, leads a small group of brave warriors to track down the mysterious Thargaun, who rules over the dead within the Circle of Sorrow.\q

<u>Midnight in the Drownholt</u>\n\qThe first leg of the Hidden Guard's journey will take them through the treacherous fens of the Drownholt, a perilous road but a necessary one when secrecy is so highly prized.\q
<u>The Deeping-coomb</u>\n\qThe fire of Orthanc has broken the wall! To arms, to arms! Defend the coomb!\q

You have been tasked with protecting the Khâlbina from threats on her route to Halrax in the Shield Isles. You were below deck for a moment when you hear shouting from above. You've been boarded by Corsairs!
Protect the Khâlbina and her crew from dangers while sailing to Jax Phanâl on the Cape of Umbar.
<u>The Legacy of Durin's Folk</u>\n\qIt is a day of unity for Durin's Folk as we gather to celebrate our triumph over Sauron, welcome new allies from Mordor, and honour the return of old friends.\q
<u>Mazog in the Web</u>\n\qNow the Hidden Guard must brave the dangerous woods and canyons of the Scuttledells, home to the Saewethil, a brood of venomous spiders that will brook no intrusion…\q

<u>The Leader of the Foul Wood</u>\n\qZagâfum, leader of the Wood-trolls of Glâd Ereg, has been discovered. The corruption that the Wood-trolls are inflicting upon the forest is unfathomable, and worse, unnatural. I cannot help but believe Saruman has his hand in the matter.\q

<u>The Mirror-halls of Lumul-nar</u>\n\qTo bring life back to the gardens of Moria, the Iron Garrison has crafted great mirrors and placed them upon the pinnacle of Zirakzigil. The light has failed, however, and the dwarves seek to learn why their mirrors do not reflect it as they once did.\q

<u>A Reluctant Young Thane</u>\n\qAgelwyn, the young wife of Thane Gladsúnu of Marton, has a difficult task set before her in her husband's absence as she awaits his return. Their town has fallen, and the people of Marton need a leader now more than ever.\q

<u>Garth Agarwen - Arboretum</u>\n\qOnce a lush garden the Arboretum's caretaker, Grimbark, was driven mad when the Red-maid fell to corruption. Now, Grimbark forces all vestige of uncorrupted life from the Arboretum making it a welcome home for The Dead.\q
The Ordâkhai have gained ground, capturing the floating bridge at Wrackwade. The Dumûri have asked for your help to overcome their defenders and regain possession of the river-crossing.
<u>The Finder's Gathering</u>\n\qThe children's Gathering takes place in a back room of the Old Guest-house. Gifts, brought by all, are piled high on the table for all to enjoy.\q

<u>Amarthiel's Hope</u>\n\qSuspecting that Amarthiel, the champion of Angmar, has come to Annúminas -- a suspicion supported by the warning of the Elf Laerdan -- the Rangers of the North prepare to infiltrate the ruined city and put an end to her evil plans....\q
<u>The Cruel History of Durthang</u>\n\qMy tale begins more than a thousand years ago, when the watch on Mordor had already begun to fail....\q

<u>The Journey to Helm's Deep</u>\n\qActing as Thane, Agelwyn must now venture out and lead her people to the safety of the Hornburg, where Théoden King plans to make his stand against the vast forces of Isengard.\q
<u>The Missing</u>\n\qWe have tracked the Orcs to the cave of Burg-shápol, but will we find the captive craftsmen in time?\q
<u>Dargnákh Unleashed</u>\n\qA brave band of adventurers.... Think you that this drain is long-abandoned? You cannot imagine what lies ahead.\q
<u>Forth the Toringas</u>\n\qThane Tordag of Torsbury, determined to reclaim his town from the Dunlending invaders, has joined with Dudsig of Oserley to march upon his ruined village....\q
<u>Eyes of Edoras</u>\n\qWe have returned to Edoras and should see how Éowyn fares with her duties.\q
<u>Boss from the Vaults: Thrâng</u>\n\qDeep within the Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu, Thrâng, the chieftain of the Ghâshfra, is ready to take on all comers who challenge his might.\q
<u>The Feast</u>\n\qYou have healed Khûtra! Now it's time to enjoy the feast you helped prepare and listen to a toast from Elder Roshat!\q

<u>The Brenin's Council</u>\n\qThe Brenin's Council of Lhanuch gathers even now, to decide whether to join their bretheren to the south in allegiance to Isengard. But they are a proud isolated people who will not bend easily, even when threatened with the power of the traitor Saruman.\q
DNT
<u>The Soothsayer</u>\n\qRubbish and nonsense. Herubrand may believe the words of this soothsayer, but I will not fall for her trickery.\q

<u>Instance: Scattered Friends</u>\n\qGandalf has found you deep in the eaves of Fangorn after you followed the trail of two lost hobbits. He wishes now to allay your worries for the vulnerable halflings and to tell you all that is afoot in Fangorn.\q

<u>Fire and Ice</u>\n\qElrond Halfelven fears that the remaining Nazgûl has enlisted the aid of the Gaunt-lord Drugoth to instill a fell spirit into the frozen corpse of the ancient Dragon Thorog and raise the beast once more as a wight. Little time remains to stop their evil plans.\q
<u>The Cursed Vale</u>\n\qDisheartened by news of the Oath-breakers' influence on the vale and the growing threat in Tarlang's Crown, Malthellam has called you and Lady Rosfin to counsel.\q

<u>The Flickering Flame</u>\n\qWith the downfall of Skorgrím, the Dourhands have become leaderless. In desperation, they have sent an emissary to Minas Angos to renew the alliance that their late lord forged with Angmar, an alliance which cannot be allowed to survive...\q
DNT

<u>The Keeper of Books</u>\n\qAngmar's campaign against Eriador requires many resources to be maintained. Múl Kholuim, an agent of the Angmarim, is tasked with overseeing the flow of money and the provisioning of the army... if he falls, it would be a great blow to Angmar.\q
DNT
Something is lurking among the ruins along the banks of the Greyflood, and you have been asked to investigate.
The waters of the Greyflood are haunted by tormented spirits. Rhona believes they must be bound there by some power, which she has sent you to discover.
<u>Last March of the Ents</u>\n\qWe marched... marched... marched to war... to Isengard...\q
Within the ruins ahead there are said to be great relics of the Elven past. You are to retrieve as many as you can for the Elven patron funding the expedition.
An accursed flame burns in the ruins at the edge of the Greyflood. It must be doused if the spirits there are to be banished.

<u>Remembering Thrymm</u>\n\qThrymm Red-beard, the champion of Forlaw, proudly carries the hope of the people of Wildermore. He was one of the few to heed the call to defend an incoming attack on an early morning in Forlaw...\q

<u>Tumun-ghâr</u>\n\qWith lessons newly learned, the Iron Garrison cautiously seeks a local supply of ore within Moria to supplement their caravans. Within the Redhorn Lodes, out of the sight of the Orcs, they have discovered Tumun-ghâr. With high hopes, they delve into this long abandoned mine, being always cautious not to delve too deep.\q

<u>Fornost</u>\n\qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q
<u>Sworn Oaths</u>\n\qGarmund has rejected my commands to remain guarding the city. He has taken his éored to reclaim land from the Orcs, keeping his oath to protect the whole of the Norcrofts.\q

<u>The Fellowship Departs</u>\n\qThe household of Elrond Halfelven gather to bid farewell to nine brave adventurers, entrusted with a secret task which could mean the salvation or doom of Middle-earth... I, Gandalf the Grey, must lead them along dark roads....\q

<u>Draigoch's Lair</u>\n\qWelcome, thieves. I can smell the dread in your sweat. I hear the whistle of fear in your breath and feel the fluttering of your little hearts as they race in your chests. But come now, why do you fear? There is plenty of treasure here... enough for all, and more to spare.\q
<u>Warg-pens of Dol Guldur</u>\n\qThe Warg-pens of Dol Guldur are where the hounds of the Dark Lord are bred, trained, and kept. Here, goblin-keepers care for the matron of the pack....\q
<u>The Icy Crevasse</u>\n\qA powerful sorceror from Angmar seeks to drive the frozen winds of Forochel south into Evendim, freezing the lake and allowing a great army to march on Tinnudir....\q

<u>Woe of the Willow</u>\n\qIn the heart of the Old Forest, a fell sword calls forth evil spirits from the Barrow-downs. Only by destroying the sword can you stop the wood-trolls' blight from spreading and end the forest's misery.\q
A massive wasp and her hive in the Gorge of Woe are altered by the corruption seeping across the land. They must be destroyed.

<u>Flight to the Lonely Mountain</u>\n\qThe Ring has passed beyond my vision into the pass of Cirith Ungol. Dale has fallen in the North, and the survivors of the siege are retreating to the Lonely Mountain, with the Easterling forces not far behind them….\q

<u>Ost Dunhoth</u>\n\qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition….\q

<u>We Cannot Get Out</u>\n\qAlas that Balin son of Fundin believed he could reclaim Moria with but a small force. As the Company of the Ring learned, the numbers of the Orcs and the might of Durin's Bane could not easily be turned aside....\q

<u>Carn Dûm</u>\n\qCarn Dûm, the capital of Angmar and the former stronghold of the Witch-king. Angmar's shadow has returned to this city in the form of the False King, Mordirith, Steward of Angmar.\q

<u>Wealth of the Dead</u>\n\qRaphûz is set on acquiring enough wealth to prove his value to Ashâmi's father, Igbâl. You agreed to accompany him through the outer ruins of Nirgambâr to search for a worthy treasure from the dead.\q
<u>A Broken Mosaic</u>\n\qFortune smiles upon the Gabil'akkâ, I think! Is there not an artist in Gundabad who might repair this broken mosaic?\q

<u>The Council of Stoke</u>\n\qAt the prompting of her advisors, Reeve Fríthild of the Broadacres has summoned together a war-council to determine how best to deal with the threat posed by the forces of the White Hand....\q
<u>Thane Mildrith</u>\n\qElthengels is under attack! Quickly, my friends! We must help with its defence!\q

<u>Dungeons of Dol Guldur</u>\n\qThe Dungeons of Dol Guldur are famed for their terror. Thrain, father of Thorin Oakenshield, perished here… though not before passing his legacy to Gandalf the Grey….\q
<u>Nestinanessornë</u>\n\qAwaken, Nestinanessornë.\q
A routine scouting expedition to investigate a fire in the Wildwood becomes a harrowing mission to save a town.
<u>The Giver of Gifts</u>\n\qI can still see this city as it was, during the height of its beauty. So much was lost.\q
<u>A Silent Presence</u>\n\qWe must learn if it is an Angmarim ritual within the Drearspire that causes these worrisome visions. If it is... we will stop it!\q
<u>The Choices of Master Samwise</u>\n\qWhere am I? Where have you gone, Sam? They've taken everything! Everything! The quest has failed!\q
<u>The Narrow Way</u>\n\qA brave Elf-scout finds herself trapped behind enemy lines in the darkness of Taur Morvith. There is naught but a single narrow bridge to offer hope of escape.\q

<u>Assault on Dhúrstrok</u>\n\qHigh among the catwalks of Deepscrave lies Dhúrstrok, the stronghold of Gorgar the Ruthless. Somewhere within these ageing halls filled with dwarf-relics, Gorgar's loyal generals have imprisoned Lord Náin. It is up to you to free him.\q
<u>Heirloom of the Tribes</u>\n\qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted needle have led you to the oldest woman in Lhanuch, and the story she has to tell....\q

<u>Dâr Narbugud</u>\n\qThe Elves of Lórien have uncovered Dâr Narbugud, the lair of the Mistress of Pestilence, the vile creature responsible for the plague spreading among the creatures of Moria. What heroes will overthrow the queen of the nameless? Who will put an end to her plague?\q
<u>Sword-hall of Dol Guldur</u>\n\qThe Sword-hall of Dol Guldur in the central training hall of the Enemy's minions, overseen by three terrible champions of the Dark Lord....\q
<u>Something Foul</u>\n\qA great number of Dievlig were seen entering the great cairn in Plas-maru. Perhaps it is here we might discover what causes the Dead to stir in the Bonevales.\q
<u>Half-truths</u>\n\qElrond Halfelven has called a council together to determine the fate of Narchuil, the ring of Amarthiel, and to question Laerdan concerning his former captor....\q

<u>The Streets of Râhal Bakh</u>\n\qFrom the apothecaries of Carn Dûm to Langstrand all the way to Umbar, Indagir now known as Khâshap has been transporting a draught of the vilest make. We now grasp at his heels as he makes his final attempt to deliver this substance to his master. We will not fail. We cannot. Khâshap must be stopped, now!\q

<u>The Quays of the Harlond</u>\n\qIn secrecy, Aragorn has made his way up the Anduin with an army of men ready to fight for Gondor. Now is the time to help lead Aragorn's forces to Pelennor and turn the tides of battle!\q
<u>The Pit-fighter -- Day One</u>\n\qThe arena of Thorzhaf is home to a pit-fighting tournament, where the greatest warriors battle for fame and power.\q
<u>The Pit-fighter -- Day Two</u>\n\qPit-fighters of Mordor have been known to rise to power through their efforts in the area of Thorzhaf.\q

<u>Halls of Crafting</u>\n\qThere were no greater craftsmen than the Dwarves of Khazad-dûm. Those days are now gone, and Mazog's Orcs, with the aid of Black Uruks from Dol Guldur, have taken the ancient crafting halls of Moria to forge their vile weapons of war.\q\n
<u>The Pit-fighter -- Day Three</u>\n\qThe arena of Thorzhaf, home of a pit-fighting bloodsport, runs under the direct orders from Thraknûl, the Black Uruk.\q

<u>Shakalush, the Stair Battle</u>\n\qIt is on the stairs of Bagûd-mekhem, the Gate of Winds, that a decisive battle of the War of Three Peaks is to be fought. There, caught between those loyal to Gorgar the Ruthless and Hrímil Frost-heart, the Gabil'akkâ hope to deal a devastating blow to both of these forces in a single stroke.\q
<u>The Matron and the Master</u>\n\qTwo terrible beasts, Bangrath and Murragrath, threaten the safety of the Trév Gallorg, the Hillmen of Aughaire. Their reign of terror must be put to an end.\q

<u>Bane of the Elvenking</u>\n\qAt last, Iphantemel has been revealed by the receding darkness of Eryn Lasgalen, and now the remnants of her brood grow thinner with each passing day. For her gluttony and weakness, they have abandoned her to her fate, but now I fear they heed the call of one even greater: Ungwetári!\q
<u>Epic Battles: Basic Training</u>\n\qThe armies of Saruman approach. Will we be ready to face them?\q
<u>Allies Unexpected</u>\n\qAfter a short rest, the company sets out for Isengard and finds the road greatly changed...\q
<u>Fate of the Stonemaiden</u>\n\qSee... hear... know....\q
<u>The Battle at Frostbluff</u>\n\qA fierce cold has come down from the mountains threatening the games the children of Winterhome are playing in the fields!\q
<u>Bregmor's Legacy</u>\n\qFotri, a Dwarf in Forochel, has seen The Weeping Warrior and seeks to examine the corpse of dead Dragon, Bregmor.\q
<u>Strike Against Dannenglor</u>\n\qHere at Dannenglor, the Enemy holds and interrogates those they have captured in battle. The prisoners must be rescued swiftly!\q
<u>The Song of Sweet Lara</u>\n\qThis is far enough for the night. We will continue to the city in the morning. Get a fire started!\q

<u>The Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu</u>\n\qWithin the Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu, Angmar mines for the ore they need to arm their legions. In their search for iron, they have uncovered the home of the Eldgang, as well as a hidden evil, ancient beyond knowledge....\q

<u>Lost Temple</u>\n\qA band of mercenaries led by the Gaunt-lord Ferndúr have begun looting a hidden Rhudauran temple, left in ruin since the fall of the Northern Kingdoms. What purpose does this servant of darkness have within?\q
<u>The Beast Below</u>\n\qThere is something worrisome on the air.\q
<u>Lothrandir</u>\n\qThere are many hidden rooms within the ring of Isengard. Does my kinsman live still within one of these chambers?\q

<u>Guiding the Misguided</u>\n\qGwin Curhonon, a hobbit of the Gloomglens, was captured by the bugan, wild goblins owing allegiance to no one. Now he seeks the help of a brave hero to bring him to safety.\q

<u>Revolt in the Deeps</u>\n\qThe Dunlendings and Rohirrim have agreed to put aside their differences and work together in an attempt to escape from their brutal Orc-overseers in the deadly mines hidden beneath the Heathfells.\q

<u>The Glittering Caves</u>\n\qThe Glittering Caves of Aglarond are where the women, children, and supplies have been hidden. With the loss of the Wall and the Deeping-comb, Gimli, Gamling, and Eómer now rally any they can find to hold the line and protect all huddled within.\q
<u>The Shadow In Morthond</u>\n\qA great beast flew out of the mountains, and now I fear a creature of much evil stalks the Blackroot Vale....\q
<u>The Crumbling Halls of Glynafon</u>\n\qCedivor Hedgerow, renowned historian and artifact expert, seeks protection while he delves into the crumbling halls of Glynafon.\q
<u>A Dream of Cold and Silence</u>\n\qWhat do you think is going on in there? Do you think Merry can recover?\q
<u>A Trail of Vengeance</u>\n\qYou and Cyneberg have come upon a trail of slaughtered Orcs, with no idea who may have killed them.\q

<u>Skûmfil</u>\n\qSince the overthrow of Moria, the Orcs have disposed of their dead in the great chasm they call Skûmfil. Over the ages, the rotting pile of carcasses and filth that has accumulated there has also attracted many foul and disgusting creatures, from the vile Gredbyg to the scavenging Kergrim....\q
The entrances to the mines of Writhenset have been seized by half-orc intruders!
TBD…

<u>Wary Riders</u>\n\qI know not why I am disturbed by Reeve Athelward's hospitality, but I sense that not all will be well for us if we remain. This night, we must leave Cliving like thieves, else danger takes us unaware....\q
<u>Núrzum's Wrath</u>\n\qNúrzum has sown discord throughout Wildermore, but nowhere was the power of the stone felt greater than where his path of destruction began deep in Balewood.\q

<u>The Exchange</u>\n\qTensions run high among the remaining Elves of the Hidden Guard: one of their number slain, the other dying from a deadly poison. And now the dwarf Bróin has disappeared on the eve of the journey's end…\q
A group of goblin raiders camp within the old ruins of Stramvárth for the night….

<u>Oakheart's Might</u>\n\qA mysterious note from the strange Sara Oakheart bade the heroes who saved her meet her at the gates of Barad Gúlaran, the ancient retreat of the Witch-king of Angmar. Seeking an answer to the mystery of the old woman, Golodir assents....\q
Within the old ruins of Stramvárth lie abandoned supplies from various Orcs and Goblins who have camped there….
Brigands are attacking Iridír! The village must be defended.

<u>Dungeons of Dol Guldur</u>\n\qA small force of Elves has infiltrated the dungeons of Dol Guldur under cover of darkness, aiming to find and release the dwarf Bori from the bonds of his captivity.\q

<u>Remmorchant, the Net of Darkness</u>\n\qFar beneath the Ephel Dúath, in the deepest caverns of Torech Ungol, lies the Remmorchant, the Net of Darkness. There, wreathed in webs of shadow only the Light of Eärendil might hope to penetrate, lies the lair of Ungwetári, last child of Ungoliant.\q

<u>Memories of Mithrandir</u>\n\qDimly-remembered stories from his childhood, oft-repeated in the darkness of his cell, have struck the spark of memory in Bori the dwarf. He is certain the passage you discovered is the same used by Mithrandir long ago to enter Dol Guldur in secret.\q
<u>Heirloom of Cardolan</u>\n\qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted sceptre have led you to a remote barrow....\q
<u>Troubled Dreams</u>\n\qYou should get what rest you can, my friend, and try not to dwell upon the horrors of the battle. Perhaps things will seem less grim by the light of day...\q
<u>Thievery and Mischief</u>\n\qWhile war raged in the South and the Rangers of the North were absent, brigands and ruffians took an opportunity to steal control of Bree....\q
<u>Breaking Through</u>\n\qTogether, the Dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ will break through the ice that blocks our passage into Gundabad!\q

<u>The Vile Maw</u>\n\qWhither did the Watcher in the Water flee when it was driven from its lake? The Vile Maw would be my guess. Beneath the waters of the dark flood are ways which lead into the black depths of Moria....\q\n
<u>Union of Evil</u>\n\qRemain alert. You go among our enemies, and will be in grave danger if you are discovered.\q

<u>Old Friends and New Tidings</u>\n\qThis Dunlending girl who travels with you cannot be allowed to see the secret ways into Lothlórien. I must bind her eyes if she is to come with you to see the Lady.\q
<u>A Need for Words</u>\n\qThe men atop the wall need words of inspiration if they are to stand against Saruman's armies.\q
<u>The Riches of Rhûn</u>\n\qBetrayed by the Khundolar, Jarl Gurthilm and his company now seek to punish their treacherous benefactor and seize the gold that was promised them.\q
<u>High Seat of the Dwarves</u>\n\qThe Steepset has always been the high seat of the Lord of Gundabad. I would see it with my own eyes.\q
Pesky stone-claws have been seen recently, digging around the Hadhodiant….

<u>The Blade That Was Broken</u>\n\qThe time of Isildur's Heir is at hand. With the recovery of the last Silithar, Elrond has commanded that the light of Narsil, which cut the One Ring from the hand of Sauron, be renewed and rekindled as Anduril, the Flame of the West....\q

<u>Gnats in Her Net</u>\n\qAs the webs of Shelob's children rise over Cirith Ungol, tremors beneath the Ephel Dúath grow more terrible with each passing moment. What horrors now stir within the depths of the Tower?\q
<u>Pilgrimage to Sundergrót</u>\n\qLong ago, during the First Age, the Greymaul Rebellion came to an end among the rocky cliffs of High Sundergrót.\q
An ambush could threathen the bridge builders, who work to repair to the Hadhodiant….
<u>Secret Ways</u>\n\qDo not be blinded by the beauty of the Glittering Caves, my friend! We must see to the safety of the folk that shelter here!\q

Far to the north of Annâk-khurfu lies Rathad Caul, the Narrow Way, a treacherous passage into Câr Bronach. There, those still loyal to the Iron Crown guard the approach to the last bastions of Angmar.
<u>Gondor and Umbar</u>\n\qI was told my life would be forfeit should I return here... but I feel this is something I must do.\q

<u>Sworn to Secrecy</u>\n\qSent by Aragorn himself, Lord Angbor the Fearless has come to Tumladen bearing news of the victory at Pelargir for Lady Terenis as well as tidings that might assuage her fears of her brother's fate.\q
Deep in the Wyrmsgráf, a terrible fire drake protects the nests of the worms….
Deep in the Wyrmsgráf, what remains of Scatha's brood makes their den....
Deep in the Wyrmsgráf, what remains of Scatha's brood makes their den....
<u>Assault on Audaghaim</u>

<u>Echoes of the Dead</u>\n\qWe have come to walk the Forsaken Road, where a group of Oathbreakers sought to escape their curse. Is it possible that Aragorn might compel them to fulfill their oath? We seek to learn if it is so.\q

<u>The Seven Swords</u>\n\qWith the aid of the Heroes of the North, the Ranger-scholar Nethraw has reclaimed seven swords which were given to the Hillman-chieftains of old. Now Nethraw and his allies prepare to enter the ancient halls of Krúslë Lannan....\q
High on the walls of High Sundergót, strange tracks have been found, trailing around foul nests and even fouler creatures….
Dourhands have found High Sundergrót and seek what treasures they can find from the old dwarf ruins….
<u>Those Who Are Dead</u>\n\qNo one living could hope to know what moves the Dead Men of Dunharrow. Only one of their kind could know what it means to remain forever cursed....\q

<u>Carn Dûm</u>\n\qCarn Dûm, the capital of Angmar and the former stronghold of the Witch-king. Angmar's shadow has returned to this city in the form of the False King, Mordirith, Steward of Angmar.\q

<u>Filikul</u>\n\qHasta went forth to discover the meaning of the strange happenings which occurred but weeks before. He has not returned, and his companions are becoming worried that something may have happened to him...\q

<u>Dâr Narbugud</u>\n\qThe Elves of Lórien have uncovered Dâr Narbugud, the lair of the Mistress of Pestilence, the vile creature responsible for the plague spreading among the creatures of Moria. What heroes will overthrow the queen of the nameless? Who will put an end to her plague?\q\n
TBD…
Maddened stone-giants take to their dwellings in the rocky slopes of Câr Bronach, and where they walk, only trouble will follow….

<u>Instance: Imping</u>\n\qImping, one of the last Rohirrim sawmills along the Entwash, has fallen to invaders. Ethelbryt has tasked you with defeating the leader of these invaders in the hopes that such a demoralizing blow would weaken the enemy and allow the Rohirrim to retake the mill.\q

<u>The Defence of Arnach</u>\nHaradrim invaders encircle Arnach, preparing to attack. Can Baranor and his two trusted captains muster their guards, green and untested by war, to hold strong against the brutal onslaught of the foe?

<u>Garth Agarwen</u>\n\qGarth Agarwen . . . The ruins of an ancient fortress of Rhudaur, now overrun by corrupted nature and a vile necromantic power out of Angmar. The most terrible power still remains to be confronted.\q
<u>Warg-pens of Dol Guldur</u>\n\qThe Warg-pens of Dol Guldur are where the hounds of the Dark Lord are bred, trained, and kept. Here, goblin-keepers care for the matron of the pack….\q
<u>The Hornburg</u>\n\qThe Hornburg must not fall! This is the last defence, my friend. We must stand for as long as we can. For Rohan.\q
Brigands have taken the ruins of Ruddymore as a base of operations. You have been tasked with taking it back.
<u>A Life Hangs on a Thread</u>\n\qThe Corsairs camped in Lamedon have wounded Fuirion badly, and his life hangs on a thread while they look on in mirth.\q
Avorthal had been moved from the Dourhand encampment to a ship preparing to depart for an unknown port in the north. His rescue is paramount to maintaining peace in Ered Luin....
<u>Mark of the White Hand</u>\n\qLead on, Flam. Where does your friend hold captive this Uruk?\q
A vicious group of wild hill-beasts have descended upon the path to the mine of Glimmerdeep, in Ered Mithrin….
Upon the entrance to the mine of Glimmerdeep, in Ered Mithrin, trolls from Gundabad have set up a blockade….
There are reports of a great treasure buried on an island deep within the Shield Isles. You've been tasked with retrieving the treasure to help the restoration of Umbar.
<u>The Infiltrators' Surprise</u>\n\qAn unsavoury band of the Big Folk have assembled and are planning a frightening surprise for Bree! I hope my new friend can stop them!\q
An enterprising hobbit is looking to make a meal delivery service. She asked to have someone help get things rolling and you accepted the task.
<u>DNT</u>\n\qDNT.\q

Wargs make the hills their home and collect an impressive number of bones. It is unclear if the bones belong to the free folk or other victims. Regardless, the threat from these beasts is too great to let them remain.
A good number of folk have gone missing and it is unclear if the wargs alone are responsible. Scouts have seen that some were taken to the warg pits and you are asked to see about rescuing them.

<u>Instance: Direnfirel</u>\n\qDirenfirel is a small lumber-mill that is now under the control of Saruman's forces. Remove the forces of Isengard from the area and gather what resources you can carry back with you.\q

<u>Eaworth Under Siege</u>\n\qOur message comes to the Entwash Vale at an inopportune time, for Orcs have already besieged the city of Eaworth. The Riders Four must now join with Reeve Ingbert and his allies to break the siege....\q

<u>Shot in the Dark</u>\n\qThe Rohirrim are attempting to retake Brôntrig, the Dunlending village that overlooks the Gap of Rohan. If we are successful, we will control two vital outposts to defend against an imminent attack from Wulf's Cleft.\q

<u>Gorthad Nûr, the Deep-barrow</u>\n\qShalgoth, the leader of the kergrim bone worshipers, hides far within Gorthad Nûr, the Deep-barrow. He and his followers seek to complete some dark ritual of necromancy, and must be stopped.\q
TBD…
Helm's Deep Prototype - AI Test
<u>Rothog's Fury</u>\n\qNow with proof of her treachery, Rothog calls forth Zarzíra Dawn-star for questioning.\q
<u>Recent History</u>\n\qOur Chieftain, Girhâzi, was not always the great warrior that we know today. She became the leader we needed exactly when we needed her to.\q
<u>Spectre of the Grey Fear</u>\n\qWe may already be too late. Let us hope we are not.\q
